Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel- what many American travelers are used to”
Reviews.Author: elitetrav
Reviews.Content: Generally when traveling abroad you want a hotel with the local flavor. That's all well and good, but theres something to be said for a hotel with wonderful amenities after a full day of sightseeing and taking in all the sights. This hotel is not only wonderfully comfortable, but the staff is friendly and very professional. I did not feel like I was cheating myself by not staying in a more rustic hotel. I loved going back to the room at the end of the day and enjoying a state of the art room with television where I could get news in English! The beds were the most comfortable that we had experienced on our trip. The only draw back is that it is a bit out of the main center, but easily to access everywhere you would want to go. The food here was quite good, and it was the only place in Italy with eggs that were edible! An iron in the room, and a coffee pot as well, were those little touches that you appreciate when traveling. Would most definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: marcia161
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 4 nights. The room was very clean and spacious.The staff was very friendly and helpful!The food in the restaurant (buffet) was delicious. The hotel is located out of the city center but easily reached by subway or by bus.Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Super Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsb836
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and daughter who both have special diets. The hotel staff fully understood and went out of their way to accommodate their dietry needs, leading to a relaxing holiday. The breakfast buffet, evening meals and bar provided excellent choices and atmosphere. All the staff were friendly and went out of their way to make our stay special. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The shuttle bus was excellent and helped minimise travel costs into the city centre. Prior to selecting this hotel I read 25 Tripadvisor reviews for various city hotels - this one stood out because the manager Davide Grilli replied to the visitor comments, which to me, showed he cared about his hotel residents. Overall, we made the right choice and thoroughly enjoyed our stay; we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: caroline134
Reviews.Content: Travelled to rome and stayed at the Crowne Plaza in October of 2011. The hotel itself is clean and well maintained. It provided us with all we wanted from our Rome trip -somewhere clean and safe to stay at night. It provided a complimentary bus to the centre of Rome which we used regularly as the Hotel itself is a good bit away from the centre. There is also a public bus outside the hotel which provided the same service but more regularly for a few euro. The rooms are a bit dated but I found the hotels in general very expensive in Rome and slightly dated so this was perfect for the price we payed. We did not eat at the hotel, but there is a fantastic little place a few yards up from the hotel (I cant remember the name). The atmosphere was fantastic, the food was amazing and the prices were a world away from those you see in the centre of Rome. I particularly recommend the steak, and house red wine.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Rome, Easter 2012”
Reviews.Author: Sandra S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn during the second week of the Easter break. Although the location of the hotel isn't great, there are coaches running all day to take you into the city and at least you have the calmness of the hotel surroundings when you get back. Staff were brilliant and meal times were controlled and relaxing. We took our two children aged 6 and 8 and had a great time. Only critisism was that they couldn't use the indoor pool which is unusual for Holiday Inns - maybe they should have times for children and adults so that everyone can enjoy the pool because the outdoor pool is only open during peak summer. That is the only reason I probably wouldn't stay there again because it was quite dissapointing for the children.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.....”
Reviews.Author: Lambrinh K
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull hotel, frendly stuff, nice waitters!!! Federico you are simply the best receptionist ever!!! Kisses from Anna & Lambrini!!!!

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: chucky31_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this superb hotel in october of 2011. What can I say?It was a fantastic stay.Big rooms nice furniture, big bathrooms. The food was great. The major plus to this hotel is the fact that it has an indoor heated pool and jacuzzi which is great. The hotel is located on Vila Aurelia Antica street.It is not close to the city centre but there are buses who come and leave near the hotel.To reach to the closest metro station Cornelia you also have to take the bus.But besides that it was worth the staying.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tony_robo
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Crowne Plaza. From the time we arrived until our departure the staff couldn't help us enough. The rooms were clean and spacious and the facilities were great. The staff booked restaurants for us, helped with internet access and offered advice on where to go. The shuttle bus was another plus. We will be back again this summer when the pool will also be available. Thank you to Davide and the team.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and very relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RJT456
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the outskirts of Rome. We took advantage of the shuttle bus but found getting the local buses in and out of Rome very easy. The rooms were spacious and clean. I would recommend getting breakfast at the hotel because there is not many places nearby to get breakfast from. One service they offered which was particularly good was a morning photo copy of the news in England (and US). There is a very nice restaurant next to the hotel if you don't fancy going into Rome. We used the spa several times and it was an extremely relaxing end to the day. We also enjoyed sitting in the bar listening to the pianist. The only disappointment was the fact that you had to pay for the internet and the choice of tv channels was extremely limited.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Service And Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Magiagirl
Reviews.Content: The five nights we spent at the Crowne Plaza, Rome- St Peter’s was exactly what we were looking for on the second leg of our 2 week Europe vacation. We did not rent a car in Italy, so we took full advantage of the free shuttle service to St Peter’s Basilica area and downtown Rome. We also used the airport pick-up service for our arrival which was very convenient. The customer service was top-notch, our room and bed very comfortable, and wi-fi accessible. They even provided a small, free, aromatherapy sleep kit during our stay with lavender linen mist. We are loyal to the Intercontinental/Holiday Inn brands and could of stayed in downtown Rome area, but liked the spa the Crowne had to offer and the shuttle service. Also, most of the downtown hotels were double the price of the Crowne Plaza and we spend little time in our room when traveling. Nonetheless, we had a lovely king room with a balcony, honor bar, and a large bathroom complete with bidet, fluffy robe and slippers for the spa. We thought it was an excellent value for the price, comfort, service and amenities. A couple of helpful things to know before you go: If needed, the hotel can usually change money for guests for a lot less then the banks or money changing businesses which sometimes charge up to 30-40%; if you stay here, and could use the down time, make time to try the spa and steam rooms; finally, there is a great little restaurant a few minutes walk down the road called La Nocetta

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franca P
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to find a beautiful hotel in a very nice setting. The rooms were spacious and super clean and the staff always helpful and friendly. The hotel is not central but connections with the city centre are very good and at the end of a long day it was nice to go back to a comfortable and quiet place without paying the excessive prices of centrally located hotels. Breakfasts were very rich and with good quality selection.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, but being renovated!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: An old Crowne Plaza in need of renovation - of which they are doing!. A bit weird checking in at a reception desk lit by a flood light! However the works did not interfere with our stay. Room was as expected from this level of hotel. Staff very friendly. Buffet breakfast was a great start to the day, plenty of choice and being a buffet - you can fill your boots! Fab location for visiting Rome, a local bus stops right outside the hotel - 1 euro and your outside the Vatican within 15mins! Would definitely stay again and i expect that when the hotel has been given a lick of paint it will only add to the stay. Didn't use spa facilities but they looked great, as to would the outdoor pool in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Familiar location.”
Reviews.Author: Estevanico
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this location. They are currently in the midst of some renovations to update the lobby and common areas. So far it looks great. We checked in on Good Friday, which was a zoo considering the construction had part of the front desk shut down and at least 40 people trying to check in and out at the same time. The staff was kind and handled the rush with aplomb. When we stayed before, it was primarily due to the free shuttle to the airport. This is no longer the case, they charge 15 euro each way. This will impact our choice to stay here in the future. We ordered room service and it arrived quickly and perfect. They are in a sort of isolated area, but it is quiet and near a bus stop. They also do offer free daily shuttle service to Vatican Square in the morning and the city center in the afternoon. The a/c in our room did not work at ALL.

Reviews.Title: “No grumbles at all!”
Reviews.Author: Petegm
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the hotel did everything that it was supposed to. The staff were nice, minor gripes were dealt with quickly and politely. Bedrooms were nice and spacious and with a large balcony area. Breakfast was a nice buffet, the evening bar man was a delight and good fun. The pool, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room all worked and were all hot. All in all, a really nice stay, a 10 minute taxi ride to the centre of Rome, no real problem but I didn't find out about the shuttle bus until our last day. Stupid of me ! Never used the restaurant so I can't comment , but I heard good things about it. Peter Matthews room 285

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from City”
Reviews.Author: rans_travel
Reviews.Content: We are just at the end of our two week trip in Italy and the last two days of our trip in Rome we stayed at Crowne Plaza. The beginning of our trip we stayed for 5 nights at Hotel Romanico Palace (very close to the US Embassy). The earlier location was excellent and we were centrally located. The last two days of our trip we were in Crowne Plaza, which claims to be near St Peters.... but it is not close to anything and the shuttle which goes from 9 am to noon (hourly) to St Peters and then from 4 pm to 9 pm (hourly) to Piazza Venezia is almost useless. You will spend over 45 minutes of your time each way on these trips due to traffic. The rooms are nothing great, the bathrooms are not well maintained, overall, the place looks quite run down. Will not stay here again on future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hot water problem!”
Reviews.Author: Justyna K
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel from March 23-29.I've traveled with my 6 year old child to visit grandparents. Our room was very spacious and clean, however for the last 2 nights by evening there was no hot water in the tap. Imagine dirty child playing in the park for a whole day and not being able to take a shower before going to bed. Shift manager promised to talk to general manager and make amands, but while checking out the bill remain untouched, never heard any apologies, just like nothing even happened. Please be aware of this, specially that Rome will get hotter and hotter from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Maggie572005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of weeks ago when the reception/bar area was being refurbished. We had booked superior rooms at full price and had paid up front well ahead of our stay. The grounds of the hotel and the rooms are good but the hotel is not near any bars or cafes. We had breakfast in the hotel on our first morning and at 18 euros per person it was very poor value. On other mornings we either got the hotel shuttle bus to take us to cheaper eating places or got one of the local buses into tourist areas with plenty of eating places. We also ate in the restaurant on the first night. Again it was very poor and very expensive. The outdoor swimming pool was still closed for the season. The grounds were well kept. If we go back to Rome I would not stay here. It is too far away from the tourist areas and when we got back to the hotel in the evenings, we had to drink at the hotel bar which again was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: 121stewart_m_12121
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for work reasons and I found it perfectly suitable.WiFi is available everywhere and my room was very spacious. At the same time I had the possibility to use the Spa and gym facilties which were free. Should I need to stay in Rome again for work I will certainly chose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It was "alright"”
Reviews.Author: vivscotlady
Reviews.Content: My fourth visit to Rome, absolutely adore this city. We booked this hotel for the pool facilities for my teenagers, needless to say we were too busy to try them out! Firstly the positives: Breakfast...absolutely superb, everything you could look for even a glass of bubbly if you so wanted. Rooms....modern, large bathrooms for Rome with good house keeping. Negatives or the not so goods! Our first impression wasnt great to be honest, the reception area is quite frankly very tired, although there was a notice up saying that is was being refurbed. That did not excuse the dirty enterance doors, carpets etc. Thankfully the rooms did go someway towards putting things right as you do spend more time in your room than the reception....thankfully!!! Staff... Answered when spoken to I guess, but more interested in the business clientelle was my impression. Location.....do not underestimate the distance to the centre...yes only twenty minutes and yes there is a courtesy bus, but for a short trip when you want to pack things in, its not the best. We didnt wander out at night as the hotel is situated on a very busy main road, so we tended to stay in. I found it much better to be in the centre and if you discounted the average nightly taxi fare of around 20 euros each trip it soon mounts up. The bus time table isnt that great either particularly coming home so please bear that in mind. Woulld I stay again, no, because I would rather be in the centre with all it has to offer. If you prefer a quieter located large hotel then this could be for you....horses for courses and all that! Would be good in the summer to have access to the outside pool area too. One other thing if booking the tour buses go for Cristina Rome, they have the pale yellow buses, way more buses with a great timetable. Would definately not recommend Roma tours (red buses) numerous complaints from other passengers etc. Other than that it was a very enjoyable trip

Reviews.Title: “Standard quality hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ForeignerFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers good facilities for conferences and business meetings. Not very close to the city center, but has a shuttle bus to the airport and the city. Offers good ftiness fascilities as well as pool and Sauna. Rooms are furnished well (I was in a suite on a ground floor), and are spacios and clean, though not with the latest design. Breakfast offers enough choice. WiFi costs extra. Offers nice outside pool area which coudl nto try as it was February.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside of city center”
Reviews.Author: aronuz
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet area, 10 minutes ride away by taxi or their shuttle (1 euro only) from the city center. We had a big connecting room, clean bathroom. Stuff is friendly and they greet you with bon giorno or bon sera every time they see you.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel out of the city”
Reviews.Author: MariaBCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights while visiting Rome and although the hotel is about 20 minutes from the city center, we found that the hotel's shuttle service worked fine for us (you can take it near Vatican City in the morning or by the Colosseum area in the afternoon/evening, for one euro each). There are also cabs available right in the hotel's entryway. The room/bathroom was larger than most European hotels, which was nice. There is a supermarket within walking distance, as well as Arturo's restaurant (and you can eat at the hotel as well). If you want to be in the heart of the city, then you may prefer staying closer to the sights, but we found that as long as we could reach our destinations from the hotel's shuttle, everything worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “Due An Upgade”
Reviews.Author: Dogsheep
Reviews.Content: A typical Crowne Plaza holiday inn hotel nice big rooms good service but bloody expensive. It is looking very tired and needs surgery.

Reviews.Title: “Tired & Dated Hotel where guests were in the way !!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael060312
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 superior rooms for 3 nights. I was shocked to see the hotel reception in full 'renovation' mode. The restaurant was covering as a bar. I was diverted 100 yards down a corridor to a bedroom to use the toilet as the toilets were not in use. Tradesmen filled all areas of the hotel with noise from 7am - 10pm. It was clear that the guests 'were in the way'. I was blanked when I asked the concierge for advice and help to book a restaurant. The rooms were spacious however so out of date. The swimming pool was closed with red tape blocking off alot of the areas. I knew as soon as I arrived, we were in trouble. This hotel should NOT have been opened. The only bright part of our day was the Restaurant Manager Veronica - she sympathized with all the residents that were complaining (& there were alot). Each morning there was a queue for breakfast and each morning Veronica smiled and consoled the residents. This is not good enough from Crowne Plaza. A simple apology is not acceptable either (which we never received). Most people who complained were upgraded for free, we paid for the superior rooms !!! We stayed on March 06, 07 & 08th. I waited a week to see if my dis satisfaction had weaned however, to the contrary it has grown. This was our "once a year holiday" and it has been tainted by our experience in the hotel. I always thought if you booked a superior room you would receive the best accommodation, i would not like to see the standard rooms. This hotel looks like it was built in the early 70's. one tip if i may, don't be fooled by beautiful website photos, like i was.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: asia5100
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza hotel needs some renovation. Size of the room was fine, king size bed, but bathroom terrible- plastic bath, nit great style. Cleanliness was good, nice touch of evening service with little biscuits. Breakfast was fine but I will love to see more Italian food. We went for dinner one night- buffet, I will not recommended. Starters- salads bar was good but main courses very bad, chicken with cinnamon - very bad!!! The staff was more interesting to chat between each other than serve the guests. Not really Crowne plaza standard but maybe Italian style. I loved the spa and swimming pool facilities. Location a nit far from centre but offer some shuttle services and local buses.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with fantastic service although a little far away from the centre.”
Reviews.Author: zoebirduk
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 3 night stay with my mom and friend. The hotel is very impressive to look at and all of the staff spoke English and were very welcoming. We had booked a room for the three of us to share which was spotless. It had two double beds as well as chairs, tables etc. It was nicely decorated and had a balcony also. We only had the option of booking on a room only basis, therefore we had to buy our food there which was quite expensive The breakfast was a buffet and cost 18 euro each. Having said that, the food was amazing and the service was also fantastic. At one point we attempted to carry our own drinks outside and were immediately stopped from doing so in order for the staff to do it for us. The outdoor pool was taped off, presumably as it was out of season, although this did not bother us as we were very busy seeing Rome! We also did not visit the spa due to lack of time. We had considered a massage but found this to be too expensive at 70 euro each. During the evenings we chose to sit outside and have a few drinks in the heated area. We were served by Fabio Ban, one of the staff members who treated us like royalty! He happily showed us around, brought our wine out to us in an ice bucket, poured our drinks, brought us snacks and checked on us frequently so we didn't even have to go inside to order another drink! He even remembered on our second evening not to bring us nuts as I have an allergy. I honestly can't say enough good things about how warm and friendly he was and the service that he provided. I would definitely return to the hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “a great citytrip”
Reviews.Author: Lien D
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. This is a very good hotel. It's not in the city center, but you have a lot of choices, you can take metro/bus for 1 euro or the free shuttle of the hotel. In maximum 15 minutes you are in Vatican city or trevi,.. When we came back from the city center, we went to the wellness, swimming pool, whirlpool, sauna,... this al for free, this was amazing experience. Relaxing and return to the city center to see Rome by night. The staff were friendly and helpfull, they will answer all of your questions. We took breakfast, this is for a reasonal price. You have a lot of choice, fresh fruits, meat, cheese, eggs, .... We will come back, because we had a beautifull experience in the hotel. negative point: internet to pay

Reviews.Title: “So-so stay.”
Reviews.Author: JenB0227
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel. I thought the staff was very nice and helpful and the room was nice. The hotel is not close to the city center, which isn't that big of a deal. You can take a hotel shuttle or the city bus. My issue is once you're at the hotel, you're kinda stuck. We ate at the hotel and the food was really expensive and not very good. The hotel is fine if you're going to eat elsewhere. But if you're going to eat at the hotel, plan on a huge food budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Zheka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, huge rooms comparing to other hotels in Europe, clean, nice balcony that we kept open at night time for fresh air, employees of the hotel were very very helpful with anything that we were asking, especially thank you to Andrea ( sorry if I misspelled his name) he was on duty on Monday past week february 27. He went beyond to help out with directions, internet connection and so on. The spa with sauna and steam room defenetley adds to comfortable and enjoyable stay. The hotel is outside the city but there was a shuttle that took US to Vatican and from there you can get anywhere in the city. Bus stop is also outside the hotel. Food was good as well, they are trying to cater to americans. Great experience over all. One tip: Ask for room next to the elevator: the hallway is very long

Reviews.Title: “We will be back for another week next year”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen A
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it had parking - we were coming by car from our home in the South of France, and an indoor pool. From our first contact by telephone, then email, we were impressed by the efficiency and courtesy of the staff. On arrival we were not disappointed. Everything lived up to our expectations. The staff were particularly helpful to us and responded to all enquiries with patience and understanding often giving us really useful advice to avoid queues! Yes, it is a 10 minute bus ride from the centre of Rome but this is made clear on the information you receive before booking so we knew what to expect. We used the courtesy shuttle bus in conjunction with the service buses (1€ per person journey/s within 75 mins). The normal pattern was to leave on the 9am bus and return mid-afternoon on the service bus to benefit from time to relax in our room then swim in the indoor pool and use other facilities available in the Wellness suite before our evening meal. We booked for a week on a half board basis and felt it was very good value for money. Our ratings below show what we felt about the facilities. Rome is a fantastic city and although we have 'done' the major tourist sites, we will definitely be returning to 'dig a bit deeper', go a bit further afield and organise ourselves to enjoy Rome at night. Thank you to everyone who made our first visit to Italy so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey W
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at The Crowne Plaza and loved it. Staff - I don't understand why other guests on the reviews are moaning about the lack of customer service from the staff, they were lovely and very helpful if we had any problem. This was my first holiday abroad with just myself and my partner and we found them very accommodating. They sorted the hotel to airport transfer for us and the staff at breakfast were friendly and happy even if it was 6.30am! (We didn't choose to get up at 6.30am it was our airport transfer bus lol) Location - I thought the location was brilliant, Rome can be a bit stressful sometimes, cars coming at you in every direction and Crowne Plaza is situated a little bit on the outskirts which is perfect if you have just had a long day of walking and sight seeings. The hotel shuttle bus was really efficient for us, we would take it to St.Peters in the morning and be picked up downtown around 5.15pm.There is also a lovely restaurant next door if you were looking to venture out. Food - We were on a bed and breakfast basis and I loved it. Some people on here aren't happy with it but what's not to like? There was scrambled eggs, toast, sausages, bacon, cereal, hot drinks, cold drinks, croissants, cakes. Loads to choose from! Hotel in general - The spa is amazing, loved the log fire and the way it was set out. Very peaceful with a lovely pool, jacuzzi and sauna. The bed was the comfiest bed I may have ever slept in. The rooms itself had everything you need, it was also spotless - could not fault it! Overall I definitely will be returning to a Crowne Plaza hotel, maybe not this particular one as I feel I've seen Rome but if all the other Crowne Plaza hotel's are a mirror of this one then I definitely will be booking soon. Kelsey & Leo

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the busy centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: cafetoria
Reviews.Content: Just had a lovely weekend in Rome for my 30th birthday. Picked this hotel because it was away from the busy centre of Rome, it was a great choice! Staff on the Reception are very helpful and friendly, check in was quick and easy and we were given a map of Rome to help us find our way around, which was really useful. You can walk to the hotel from the nearest Metro stop (Cornelia) in around 15 mins, or get on a bus which stops outside the hotel and runs regularly. We had a Kingsize room, which was huge and had a sofa area, plus a balcony which got the sun in the afternoon and overlooked the outdoor pool. The hotel also has a really good pool/spa area inside, you have to wear a shower cap in the pool (which we weren't particularly impressed by!!) but it is all spottlessly clean and well maintained. If you want to visit Rome but prefer to have somewhere a little quieter to stay, I'd recommend the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is good, but not very central”
Reviews.Author: Rockinger
Reviews.Content: it's the hotel i go when i am in rome, despite it's away of central rome. the staff at the reception is very friendly. the rooms are quite spacious, swimming pool and spa is great. if you don't want to go downtown in the evening, there is a nice restaurant right at the gateway of the hotel. i never eat in the hotel when there are local good restaurants around. in rome you find great restaurants everywhere ;) taxis are there all the time, they have shuttles too. good value for money... 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “Among the best places in Rome”
Reviews.Author: euge_dh
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel on average three nights per week for the last four years. The staff is very courteous and definitely willing to help in any way. Rooms are spacious and nicely appointed; worth noticing are the very comfortable beds adorned with lots of pillows and a useful desk for most business needs. The bathroom is very functional with a bathtub/shower and good lighting. Isolation, both thermal and acoustic, is good under all circumstances. Air conditioning in the room is very effective and its noise is barely noticeable. The two restaurants (the Osteria for lunch and dinners, the Jardin d'Hiver for breakfast) are comfortable and never overcrowded: tables are well spaced and lighting is adequate for every time of the day. Breakfast at the Jardin d'Hiver is absolutely a great way to start a day with an amazing view of the pool. Lunch and dinner's offers accommodate virtually everyone's wishes. The restaurant staff always goes the extra mile and never let you down. Having a drink at bar Il Palco is a treat; after 8pm live music is played and often it goes on later than 2 am. This alone is already is worth the stay. Checking-in and out is very quick and you never have to wait longer than a few minutes. There are shuttles to/from Fiumicino airport (trip time about 20 minutes) and to/from downtown (trip time about 15 minutes). Even if not centrally located, there is a public bus stopping just outside the hotel's entrance that brings you to the nearest underground stop, which is 10 minutes away if you walk directly from the hotel. The trip to downtown (Piazza di Spagna, Piazza del Popolo, via Veneto) is then merely 10-15 minutes. The main train station -Roma Termini- is 25 minutes away. If you come by car the free parking is a plus. The three swimming pools (two outside -one of which for children- and one inside in the spa) are themselves worth the stay; the fitness centre is open from 6am to 9pm. Before "moving" to this hotel I tried several hotels in Rome and I never found the right mix of quality, price and service. This Crowne Plaza is a welcome exception! If you plan to stay in Rome, then you need to consider this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: centexhotel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our first trip to Rome and it was a great property! Nice, large rooms at a reasonable rate. And, the free shuttle to central Rome was a lifesaver.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: JULIAN M
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is amazing. Quiet and excellent service. The breakfast area is amazing and now they are refurbishing the Restaurant as well. The Rooms are very well spaced and very warm and comfortable. I recommend this Hotel to any couple visiting Rome, definitely one of the Best cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, the staff couldn't do enough for us. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated and the food in the resturant was good with a huge choice for breakfast. Also we ate twice in the hotel for dinner which was very well priced and good quality food.

Reviews.Title: “All roads lead to Rome”
Reviews.Author: NJMJCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: I can not understand why people complain that the staff speaks poor English, people forget that they are in Italy and here speaks Italian, and there are some who understand just a little English so you should be happy. Some people complain over there is far from downtown, if you can book a hotel room and you can go on the internet, one can see where the hotel is in relation to everything, my wife and I booked the room at the hotel and look forward both when we go to Rome for 5 time on 9 years. We buy a ticket for public buses that will last for a week for 16 ½ € so we can run everything we want. The mood comes after all of that is different than where you come from, if one requires that all service should be like home, then stay home.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough but bad location”
Reviews.Author: SolTabet
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 times in this hotel.from the outside it looks old but the rooms are renovated. You can enjoy the rich buffet whether for breakfast or for lunch. U have to take a taxi to go wherever you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: kwc196
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers large, comfortable, and quiet rooms at an attractive price, making it a good choice for customers who value such criteria. On the other hand, it is located in the suburbs of Rome, definitely not within walking distance of any sights; the public bus stopping outside the hotel is cheap and frequent enough, though. My room, quite standard according to the floor plan, was spacious indeed for an European city hotel, but without much character. The only standout aspect was the abundant supply of towels. We were not upgraded despite being Priority Club Platinum, unusual for a Crowne Plaza, which usually do this automatically. We were traveling by car on this trip, for which the large free parking lot and easy access to highways made this hotel a convenient choice. I can strongly recommend the Italian restaurant next door up the street towards Rome, which offers great food and genuine hospitality (something the hotel's jaded staff could learn from).

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza St Peter's Rome”
Reviews.Author: Linda T
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, spacious rooms, excellent facilities. Had adjoining rooms overlooking stunning outdoor pool (open in summer). Spacious rooms with fridge and tea making facilities. Nice products in well organised bathroom. Two restaurants one serving more formal meals and a huge selection of both hot and cold breakfast buffet and the other a more casual affair with a great buffet menu offer. Lovely bar area to relax in in evening,spacious foyer and beautifull quality spa with indoor pool. Staff could not do more to help and despite being a large hotel made the whole thing very homely and friendly. A little out of the centre, but regular, free shuttle into town and quite nice to be in a peacefull area to chill out in. Great park nearby for walks. Love it, will definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “A Christmas Treat”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: Having had such a wonderful stay at the Crowne Plaza last summer we decided to book again for Christmas and we are so glad we did. Once again the hotel exceeded our expectations. The food was first rate, we dined both Christmas eve and Christmas day and the meals were spectacular but, very filling! The facilities are good but a little disappointing is the fact that the childen could not use the spa pool. In fairness we did know of this when booking and it is not a problem in the summer with the outside pool. We were impressed that the shuttle was running, especially at Christmas, so we were able to pop into the centre and visit our favorite sights without the worry of taking the bus or taxis. The 'crowning' glory however is still the hotel staff, from top management to the maids. Everyone is so helpful and friendly and nothing ever seems to be too much trouble' We will definately stay at the Crowne Plaza again, probably this summer as it is so hard to beat for value. Thank you all for such a lovely stay and may we wish you all, Anno nuovo, vita nuova.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Gregory K
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we stayed during New Year's eve. The hotel facilities were very clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and very professional. The free shuttle to the Vatican and downtown Rome, and back, was a great touch. Buses and metro stations are nearby as well. Concierge provided us with a map to the city and transportation options to get to the different sites. The breakfast buffet was very impressive. Would of liked a free continental breakfast to make it perfect, but the food quality was excellent. Overall, it was a great stay and I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off Rome at New Year”
Reviews.Author: Jude99
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at this hotel and have always been really impressed with the quality of service, rooms and the spa. We have always visited in the summer so we were hoping that Rome would be quieter over the new year break. We were wrong about Rome, just as packed as usual but the restauarants and bars were quiet and all touting for business, We decided to spend NY eve in the hotel bar and purchased tickets for a finger buffet and champagne at just under 50 euro each. BIG MISTAKE and for the first time at this hotel felt really ripped off!. Finger buffet consisted of one plate of mediocre finger food and that was it! we had assumed it was an up-grade on the usual bar snack served with drinks so sat waiting all night for the buffet to appear. Should have booked the sit down banquet served in the main restaurant which looked great with a band and dancing etc..

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TLYE
Reviews.Content: My partner, daughter and I stayed here on 14th - 17th December.Great room and great service, Indoor spa fabulous. Shuttle bus to and from hotel to the city excellent service. Near enough to main attractions,10 mins on shuttle bus.Highly reccomend and will definately return. Great little bar/restaurant to the left of the hotel(little way to walk) where wine at 1euro 50, and beer equally cheap. Restaurant to the left is very good for food too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Far from the Madding Crowd”
Reviews.Author: polishdiner
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel. I have stayed here many times and have always experience a great room and great service. The near neighborhood has a few good restaurants and markets for fresh fruit. The shuttles are convenient and dependable but the hotel is also easily accessed by public transport and taxi fares are reasonable. The near by Villa Pamphili is a great place for a walk or run. Before I stayed at this hotel I never bothered with some of Rome's less visited treasures on the holy side of the side of the Tiber, like the Botanical Gardens. The pool and sauna are a fantastic way to finish a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel but just a little bit out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: leightravelclub
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel knowing that it was some way out of town. Previous experience of city center hotels has been that often room size and facilities are limited, so, we went for this out of town place. Full marks for service all round. It is kind of a soulless place, typical of a business hotel from a large chain, but yes, we would use it again. Our priority club membership gave us early check in and late check out. Large clean rooms, all with a balcony. I think a good choice for a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Solid stay and Value. Not walking distance to St. Peters”
Reviews.Author: uga_travel
Reviews.Content: For the quality of hotel to price ratio, this was a pretty decent deal. Nice facility, nice sized rooms and a decent rate. However, it's not exactly walking distance to St. Peters. Luckily, they have an excellent shuttle service. Every morning, they have hourly shuttles to the entrance of the Vatican and every evening, they have shuttle pick up from downtown. Without the FREE shuttle, this wouldn't be a great value. Good service team as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamperNC
Reviews.Content: Prior to staying at the Rome Crowne Plaza (November 2011), we read many reviews posted in Trip Advisor. Moat of them were "spot on" in their praise for the quality of rooms and excellence of service. Particularly noteworthy was the congenial attitude of the front desk staff. I'm sure that they get repetitive questions from "first timers" to Rome, but without exception all of the staff was most helpful. We had been warned that the cost of breakfast was quite high and that there were no alternatives within walking distance. We found that the only offering for breakfast was the buffet, which was exceptionally good, but it cost 18 euros per person. We certainly will stay at the Crowne Plaza next year when we visit Rome again, but we will smuggle breakfast into our room!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, food and service”
Reviews.Author: mauilouglo
Reviews.Content: Hotel accomadations and service was 5 star. Food in their restaurants was excellent. Only drawback would be, too far from Romes main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but not worth what I had to pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: Longbasket
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a cruise package that friends and I purchased. The amount of money we paid for this hotel was way above what this hotel offered. We arrived early for check in so the hotel stored our luggage. We had a tour so came back to the hotel around 6 pm and it appeared that the staff had to search for rooms for my friends and I. Two friends had requested a non smoking room and were given a smoking room. My friend and I received a non smoking room but it did not have heat and was very cold. Our friends room on the second floor was so hot they had to sleep with the window open. The room was clean and the beds comfortable however, for the money we paid I expected a higher quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dkitchen794
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of Rome at St Peters Square, very close to all sites. It is a very nice hotel-great rooms. I only stayed there for one night but it was very clean, modern with very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a sleepy neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: nesulli
Reviews.Content: I have learned my lesson about traveling to the old European cities - stay away from the noisy downtown areas if you want to get a good night's sleep. We stayed at the hotel at the end of our Mediterranean cruise. This hotel is actually perfect for cruisers since it is close to the St. Pietro train station which takes you out to Civitavecchia, and you don't have to go into Termini. Rooms were very spacious(even by US standards!) with all of the latest Crown Plaza amenities, and had great little balconies. Free internet available in the business center(one computer), there was a second computer available elsewhere in the lobby so don't wait. The hotel is located quite a bit away from the attractions of Rome, but the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle with a published schedule. (basically, the bus doesn't run from noon to 4pm). The little restaurant in the hotel was actually the biggest surprise - Best Burger in Europe! There appears to be ample parking if you are driving and there was a special little lot with taxis always waiting if you wanted to use them. The hotel offers a shuttle to FCO for about 12 euros per person(kids pay too).

Reviews.Title: “Don’t look elsewhere! This is it!”
Reviews.Author: Watheroo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in October, during a Globus European Tapestry tour. Globus provided excellent accommodation throughout the tour. But after so many days on the go, were hoping the Crown Plaza would be all that and more – this hotel did not disappoint. It ticked all the boxes for a fantastic stay on beautiful Rome! MODERN We were also most pleased with the layout and decor of the rooms, lobby and restaurants. The rooms were also clean, well-appointed and spacious – hard to find in this city I am sure! CENTRAL With central Rome close by we found it very easy to get to where we wanted to go. Don’t get me wrong the hotel is far enough away to still have the feel of a quiet spacious facility. SERVICE: Every staff member was very helpful and made our stay comfortable. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone for their stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - feel like in a Resort but just next to the city center!”
Reviews.Author: MarghR
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two friends for a relaxing week end in Rome. You don't feel like in a city Hotel, although it is just quick and easy to reach Rome city center. The Spa is nice, clean and totally relaxing, unfortunately we didn't have the chance to try the amazing Spa menu, and the park with the open swimming pool gives you the idea you are in a resort. We had a lovely welcome from the staff, very helpful in arranging transfers, taxi to and from the airport and city center. The rooms are big and clean with kettle and a choices of coffee and teas, which you don't often find in Italy. Strongly raccomanded!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, this is the place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Moore38
Reviews.Content: I've been at the Crowne Plaza on several occasions and i've never been disappointed. Every time i receive a warm welcome, the staff remebers me, which is surprising considering the size of the property and the amount of people who stays there. I feel very relaxed, looked after and a little spoiled. The service is always superb and the facilities and amenities in the room and around the hotel are brilliant. I think it's the best value for money hotel in Rome, at least of all the ones I've tried. I love Rome and it's comforting knowing that I have a preferred space to stay when in town. I would definitely reccommend this hotel as a place to stay. Even if it's not in a walking distance from St Peter's Square, they have a free shuttle to and from the town centre, and that shows how much they care about their guests. Crown Plaza, thanks again for another pleasant stay and for making me feel "part of the family".

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient hotel.”
Reviews.Author: m_l_koch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the first week of November (2011). We stayed for seven nights. As has been stated before, the hotel rooms are very large and have decks. Ours overlooked the pool, which is very large. Everyone was very helpful and made our stay comfortable. Right outside the property, is a bus stop that you can take into town and even onto the metro (subway). We did both and were able to get a round really well. They sell bus tickets at the hotel. You can also take the bus the hotel provides, into town. It leaves in the morning for the Vatican area and in the afternoon to an area that is in the heart of Rome. If you are in good shape, you can walk to the Pantheon, Treve Fountain, Coliseum and the Forum areas from this bus stop. We used this bus the first couple of days and it helped us get our bearing, before we ventured out ourselves and used the local bus and metro services. This hotel is very quiet and just a little removed from the noise of the city. We are so glad we stayed at this hotel, we highly recommend it. I do agree that the restaurant is very expensive, but most of Rome is. We ate breakfast there one morning. We paid $5.00 an hour to use the internet in the lobby. We hope you enjoy this hotel as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Your hotel The Best .”
Reviews.Author: Aleshkova E
Reviews.Content: Some time ago my family and I came to your town on vacation and stayed at your hotel.We want to express to you our gratitude for your warm welcome and good service. Our children were very happy and satisfied your Hotel my husband and I also had a great time and got a lot of positive emotions. Thank you once again for the wonderful time we spent with you. Your staff were so kind to me, I do not know how to thank you. My family really enjoyed your hotel. I will recommend your hotel to my friends. My children said that your hotel The Best .

Reviews.Title: “Good and Fairly Handy”
Reviews.Author: Dalebo
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in October 2011 and were extremely satisfied. Nice room, good dining facilities and the Concierge was excellent. The only negative thing I can think of is that they did not serve a simple breakfast, Complete breakfast buffet only

Reviews.Title: “dont go there”
Reviews.Author: k_kov11
Reviews.Content: A very old hotel, crapy rooms and service. Far from every location and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Rooms, Crap service, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: WineTrails
Reviews.Content: This place is the perfect trifecta of awful. During our trip to Italy, my fiance and I stayed at 3 different hotels and this was by far the worst of them. Firstly, we had specified that we wanted a non-smoking room (I'm asthmatic and allergic) - the room they originally gave us was a smoking room. I immediately requested that they switch the room and got some very bad attitude from the hotelier. Next, the room they gave us in exchange - flush button on the toilet broke off the first time we used it, shower water knob broke off our second night there. When I demanded to speak with the manager - I was told he was not there and couldn't be bothered with petty complaints. If all of this wasn't enough, the hotel is located quite far from the city center and while a shuttle was offered, it stopped running at 9PM (Why they would think this was a good idea, I'm not sure). Getting there using public transportation was very difficult and cab was very expensive. Oh, and their breakfast "buffet" was pathetic and overpriced. My recommendation is, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of our great European adventure and loved it. Having arrived early in the morning after a really long trip from Australia, we expected to have to wait for our room, so after being warmly welcomed and offered a coffee, we were pleasantly surprised to be told our room was ready within a few minutes. The staff were very helpful in directing us to the shuttle bus in to the centre of Rome, although we walked a few times, (admittedly a long walk!) and enjoyed that too. We would definitely be happy to stay here again. Loved the buffet breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: js_gill
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times when travelling to watch the football. The price of the hotel is very good, however this is more to do with the location. It's quite far from the centre, however as others mentioned there is a shuttle bus but you have to plan in advance and see when it's due to leave. We took public transport to central station in Rome a few times, but this is not something I would recommend if you were with children as the route we took (which seemed the best way) was not pedestrian friendly. There were some spots with a pavement no wider than a foot and you felt dangerously close to the traffic. In terms of bar area, it's a classic Crowne Plaza bar and nothing trendy and they have someone playing the piano most nights, so it's not really for a young crowd, but we only used it when we came home for a nightcap so it was quite pleasant after spending the evening in the olmpic stadium in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Buono con qualche problema”
Reviews.Author: gimalleo
Reviews.Content: I was here while attending a scientific meeting. Ok, this is a good hotel with nice and very clean rooms in a quiet and green area near St.Peter's. The staff was very nice and attentive. Why three stars? Minus one because the walls are paper thin! You can hear everything (even the breath of people in the room next to yours). Minus one because in a business hotel (there were several meetings ongoing), room wi-fi MUST be for free.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, thanks to the hotel bus”
Reviews.Author: 3ssn
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and also more luxurious than you will find the center of Rome for this price. The Crowne Plaza Rome St Peter's is not close to St. Peter's Basilica. Not even near the center. The center can be reached by foot, but it's not advisable to walk. Fortunately the hotel has its own free bus in the morning to St. Peter and in the afternoon / evening downtown. In the center, everything is within walking distance. An alternative is the taxi, will cost around € 15 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Traceysnelus
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here in early November 2011 for three nights and we thoroughly enjoyed it. When I come to Rome again, I will ensure that this hotel is first on my list. The hotel room boasted two double beds and balcony and provided all the necessary essentials. The room was cleaned daily and all of the staff were pleasant and most friendly. The consierge was kind enough to even help me with my italian. I cannot remember his name but it was a joy to have met him. We had included breakfast, which was self service and there was plenty of options, from cakes, sweet pastries, cereals, fresh fruit and hot food was also on offer. The staff seated you quickly and ensured that everything was OK serving you with tea/coffee etc. Whilst the bar was expensive, this was not unexpected. I did not use the restauraunt as we chose to eat out whilst in the city. On the evening we went for a walk around the neighbourhood, situated next to the hotel was a restauraunt anda short 10 minute walk took you to small local bars. The location was of easy access to the city and they hotel offers a free shuttle service that has two stops, one near the vatican and the other closer to all the main attractions, including piazza navona, which is a must see on the evenings. We had no issues getting around and seeing everything that we wanted. The hotel also offer a very cheap shuttle service to the airport 12 euros each way per person, we chose to take this on the return journey, with the shuttle drop off point at Terminal 3 which is very close to all terminals.However, this service does not run past 6pm to the hotel so another option shall have to be taken should your flight arrive later in the day, but you cannot expect them to have to provide for everyones situation. In summary, as far as the hotel experience we were more than pleased, and I will certainly be recommending this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “PEACEFUL HAVEN IN BUSTLING ROME”
Reviews.Author: PISCESCo_Down
Reviews.Content: My huband and I stayed in this hotel in September 2011. It is a large hotel and we had a spotlessly clean room ( with 2 double beds) overlooking the pool and garden area. It was cleaned daily and met our expectations. Breakfast was self-service with good variety. This hotel is about 3 miles from The Vatican and there were regular buses outside main gates of hotel( bus stop is on the right). The hotel also runs a shuttle at various times of day. After a busy day in noisy Rome we were able to relax in the peaceful spa. However I feel that check-in arrangements could be improved as the queue was very long perhaps due to American tours checking in . Despite this i would still highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rarety in Rome - A room with some room!”
Reviews.Author: GinMcG
Reviews.Content: Nice size room with a couch, table, and two chairs. Like most hotels I stayed at during a 2 week Italy trip, there was no clock. If you kept the TV on there was a digital read-out at the base. Turn the TV to a channel that isn't broadcasting and cover it with a towel if you are like me and want to be able to know the time when you get up during the night. (or better yet - bring a travel alarm clock). The biggest drawback to this place - no tourist sights are nearby - you need to take an expensive cab ride anywhere. There were a few small restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ire25
Reviews.Content: Hotel was really clean and staff were very friendly. Breakfast was very nice and the shuttle bus is a fantastic service. The one and only down side were the prices of the drinks in the bar, very expensive. But would definitely recommend the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but bit disappointed to be honest!”
Reviews.Author: Gregcauser
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to be going to Rome and thought staying at the Crowne plaza would make the trip just a little more special. However, great trip but the hotel took something away rather than making my trip. It was ok and in summer with pool would be a great place to relax. But 2 out of 4 nights we were woken up...terrible soundproofing!!! Kids running, party going on upstairs. (at 11pm) We phoned down to reception who said he nothing that he could or would do. In response I said I would sort it and only at that point did he say he would come and resolve....which he did. Rusty fittings on shower and room not cleaned...old bed sheets with crumbs in it. Overall ok but won't stay again. I wouldn't mind but billed as 4.5 stars etc and on of best hotels through British airways and expensive. So, avoid it if after something a little better than average. However Rome is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for our trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: panyan1960
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a long weekend trip to Rome with friends as we were all celebrating our 30th wedding anniversaries. My husband is a Platinum club member, and so I contacted the hotel before our arrival, and requested good rooms in a quiet location. The staff were very helpful, and on arrival check-in was quick and efficient. Our rooms were located on the 4th floor, in a quiet area and with a pool view. We were very happy with the rooms which were clean, spacious and very well appointed with a flat screen tv. Tea and coffee making facilities, bottles of water, and some complimentary chocolates. We did not eat in the hotel because we were there for only a few days and wanted to get out and see the real Rome. We did not breakfast in the hotel as it was expensive, however compared to what you might pay when eating out, it probably represents good value for money! Staff recommended some restaurants for us, which were approx 10 to 15 mins walk away which we did not mind, especially as they were very good and reasonably priced. Try "Gustosando", there was quite a wait, but the restaurant is like the tardis and the food was well worth it! The hotel is just outside the city, which means it is quiet, but the shuttle bus runs regularly and we found a way to make it work for us which meant we could be out all day and avoided expensive taxis. Another tip: airport taxis - from Fumancino cost E40 one way. If there are 4 of you travelling this works out cheaper and more convenient than the hotel shuttle. We got stung by some guy at the airport offering cheaper transport (very cleaver!), cost us more, ha ha! Overall this is a very good hotel, good location. We will definitely stay there again when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel with big issues: far from downtown / no facilities around neighborhood / poor maintenance in rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eric_since2011
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this Crowne Plaza Hotel is not the same level of service and maintenance compared to others. This hotel is far from downtown, room bathroom with poor maintenance and there is carpet inside the room. Who enjoys the Priority Club Membership, let you know that they do not respect it as others from the same Club, unfortunately. There is only one restaurant around neighborhood. If you are thinking of walking around night, this hotel is not a good option. You will need a taxi service for sure. Good points: good SPA area, indoor swimming pool, shuttle service to downtown (some specific hours). Please, reconsider your stay if you want to walk around night to have dinner and be near the hotel, a walking distance hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a real double bed!”
Reviews.Author: dodger1226
Reviews.Content: I've been to 5 hotels in Italy in the past 3 weeks, this is the ONLY one with a true double bed mattress...larger than a Queen, smaller than a King and it is comfortable. The room is large, comparable to a room one may have for a double-bed or King room in the States, has a large closet and sitting area with table couch and two chairs and...plenty big enough, plus quiet and comfortable for two. TV has 3 English news channels plus many choices of movies. Wifi works well throughout hotel. It's a busy place, a lot of US folks but also a lot of many other nationalities, front desk is usually a wait. Had breakfast 6 mornings, OK, good selection of food is available. Staff is very friendly, nice, understanding, can't say enough here. Facility is clean, the general appearance I would describe as "worn". It needs a refurbishing, particularly the furniture. Its an easy bus and metro ride into the center or take the hotel shuttle. We usually took a taxi for returning which cost 7 to 12 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for comfort.”
Reviews.Author: LauraJune2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel food and accomodation are beyond our expectations. Gracious staff, excellent Amercian breakfast buffet and dinner. Shuttle service provides transportation in the morning near St. Peter's Basilica and in the afternoon to Ancient Rome. Only drawback was there were nearly no closeby shopping centers nor restaurants around. Had to take a taxicab, hotel shuttle or bus to bring us somewhere. Overall service is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Issues with shuttle bus and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaS642
Reviews.Content: I felt confidant when my travel agent booked me into the Crowne Plaza before and after my cruise in September 2011 since I was traveling alone. She even reserved me a space on the shuttle from the airport to the hotel and sent me specific directions sent to her by the hotel for finding the shuttle outside Fiumicino Airport. However, when I arrived at the designated parking space (after having walked almost a mile dragging my luggage and carry on) there was no sign or parking space indicating Crowne Plaza. After walking halfway back to the terminal, I called the Crowne Plaza and was told to return to the specific parking space and to look for a shuttle and sign the read "Holiday Inn." Shortly thereafter, the Holiday Inn shuttle arrived, the driver had my name and reservation, and he took me to the Crowne Plaza. This was an inauspicious beginning to my trip. Problems with the restaurant at the hotel: I was ignored for 20 minutes while 2 couples were waited on and served (there was no one else in the restaurant but the 2 couples and me). Finally my order was taken. The next day after I finished my dinner and the plates were taken away I waited another 20 minutes for a server to ask if I wanted dessert or coffee. I spoke to the hostess and she said she would ask the chef if he had something other than the fruit salad that had been on the buffet all day. When I returned to my seat my liter of water was gone and no one had presented me with a bill. The maitre d' came over to ask if he could do something after I had again sat down. He very nicely offered to find me a piece of chocolate cake and offered to comp me some wine. All I wanted was the dessert and a coke to take to my room and that was brought to me with compliments of the maitre d'. I can't help but think that I was ignored because I was a woman alone. Other than that, the room was spacious and comfortable. However, I would not stay at the Crowne Plaza again because of the lack of information on the shuttle and the neglect in the restaurant. The night I stayed there after the cruise I walked down the street to a ristorante where the food was much better and less expensive than that at the Crowne Plaza. There was no other place to go in the vicinity of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WFMMO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2011 with my husband & 2 kids aged 11 & 5. Did not bother hiring a car as i was attending a conference at the Parco Della musica for a few days & Rome has a brilliant public transport network. Very good service all through. Fantastic breakfast with an extensive choice - nice start to the day. My kids had a ball at the pool. Rooms very clean, beds very comfy. Airconditioning brilliant - a must for Rome at that time of the year! We did quite a bit of sightseeing so it was lovely to come back to a nice and cool hotel after roaming around the streets of Rome! They had an offer on - 'kids eat dinner free for every paying adult' which we took advantage of. Not too wide a selection of food for dinner but for the price well worth it. Only downside is waiting for the public bus to take you to the metro station which if you can be bothered to walk is a 20-25 min walk away. They have a complimentary coach which if you time it right is useful. In a nutshell a lovely hotel away from the hustle & bustle of central Rome. I will definitely stay here again & recommend it to anyone who loves peace & quiet while on holiday!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: parisa07
Reviews.Content: Everything was awesome .The room was a great size , The bed was nice and pillows nice. The bathroom was good too . Breakfast was good ,

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, but far.”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few days, but luckly had a rented car to move around because it is far from the city center. But dont get me wrong, it is a nice hotel, well organized, proper for a Crowne Plaza standard,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: angela123go
Reviews.Content: The bed was nice and pillows nice. The bathroom was good too. I would have given them more stars if they didn't plunder your wallet for internet access like a sleazy motel. It was a truly ridiculous price for internet!! Really made me mad. Internet is a necessity and should be an included service (or a reasonable fee) for a 4 and 5 star hotel like Crowne Plaza. Their location is out of the way from the center of town, which is okay if you don't mind also paying for a taxi everyday. Don't rely on the public buses. We spent an entire day our first day trying to navigate the city by public bus. You must take a taxi or you will see your time in Rome disappear with public transportation from this location. Also, we didn't try to take the hotel shuttle bus, really not convenient. You'll end up using a taxi. Also, skip the restaurant. It's not good at all. Breakfast is okay, but not worth the price if you have another option for the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad aspects of this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MattScot
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed here for 4 days in mid September as part of a trip round Italy. The Hotel is situated a good way from the centre and has there are few shops/bars/restaurants nearby. Having said that the Hotel provides a free stuttle bus into central Rome which was very useful. I had contacted the Hotel in advance to tell them that we would be arriving early and was advised they would do what they could to get us into our room. This could not have been further from the truth as we were made to wait until 1545 (check in 1500) to get into our room despite being told several times that our room was being made up. The service we received from the reception staff was abysmal, we sat and watched dozens of tour party customers be given room keys the minute they arrived. On the plus side our room was spacious and comfortable with the bed being excellent. The outdoor pool was great and a really good way to cool off. I completed my comments card highlighting our very poor check in experience but never had any response from the Hotel. On the whole a comfortable hotel, not the greatest location and very expensive for food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Longing to my third stay ! Jamais deux sans trois !”
Reviews.Author: boutondargent
Reviews.Content: I have spent three nights in Crowne Plaza St-Peter's in Rome-Italy from October 1st to October 4th. I am writing this review to express my delight and gratitude to the General Manager and his Front Office Manager, whom I met personally and who took time to listen to my suggestions and comments. Everything was perfect, the spacious room, with its lovely view on the outside swimming-pool, its cleanliness, the comfort of the bed, (let me add that I appreciated the gentle soap with essential oil of bitter almonds in the bathroom), the food in the restaurants, the kindness of the waiters, the shuttle services to Vatican, city center and to the airport. This hotel offers all comfort to its guests, internal swimming-pool, hammam, sauna, jacuzzi and the huge outside pool (25x13.5 meters). I have chosen this Crowne Plaza because of its fitness-Spa area and its excellent equipment, the shuttle services and last but not least the outstanding reception and the professionalism of its whole staff. The concierge explained with patience where to go and what to visit. The staff is kind, helpful and very friendly. It is my second visit and I look forward to the third one. All in all, I loved my stay in this marvellous city : the eternal Rome. .

Reviews.Title: “4 Day Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WetherbySteve460
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day break in Rome at the Crowne Plaza. One of the main criticisms people seem to raise is the location of the hotel. If you book it knowing where it's located, and take advantage of the excellent shuttle bus then it's a really good quiet location for a nice break - especially if you're lucky with the weather and get to take advantage of the outdoor pool area! The rooms are excellent, nice & large and all appear to have balconies. The breakfast selection is very good, including cereals, fruit, pastries, right through to a reasonable cooked selection, with all the usual selection of fruit juices, coffee, teas etc. The bar area is nice & relaxed, drinks possibly slightly over-priced, but all served with crisps & nuts which is a nice touch. The free shuttle is excellent, running to the Vatican in the morning, and into the centre of town at night, returning hourly between 4.15pm-9.15pm, Taxis though are reasonably priced back to the hotel - ranging between 10-15 euros depending where you get them from. Overall I'd certainly recommend the Crowne Plaza Rome, just make sure you appreciate the location when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, grounds, great bar, internet worked well”
Reviews.Author: Seniordad
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, helpful shuttle, beautiful bar. Staff very helpful. We stayed here on the first two nights of a 2 week tour. Internet worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Arty1011
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at end of Sept. 2011 Excellent rooms - large by most standards - very clean, air conditioned, - friendly helpful staff - large elevators - breakfast is overpriced but is the only game in town as no other restaurants are nearby - limited menu for lunch and dinner- excellent pool/spa area - shuttle is available but we did not use it - close to vatican but quite a way from historic Rome - bus is handy and Taxi stand on sight

Reviews.Title: “I would come back”
Reviews.Author: londoncar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with comfy beds and friendly staff. Is not so close to the town center but the shuttle service provided for the hotel works very well. Extremely convenient and make the journey very pleasant. Every night you can spend sometime at the bar listening a good piano player.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Start to a Mediterranean Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Ewoks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Peter's Crowne Plaza for 3 nights before going on a Mediterranean cruise. Pulling up to the hotel, the exteriour was slightly disappointing, it looked old and run down, but once we got inside everything looked new and clean. We arrived around 11:00 a.m. and were graciously allowed to check-in early. As we had not slept for a day (long flight) this was very welcome! Our room was clean and larger than I expected. We had a king size bed and it was very comfortable. I would recommend that you utilize the bus service the hotel offers to the Vatican and the city center. Not only because it's an easy way to get to some site-seeing places, but because of the driver, Stephano. He is very knowledgeable about the area and he marked on a map several places to eat, shop and have a drink near the hotel that we would not have found otherwise. Also, on our return trip from the city center, he took us past the St. Peter's Bascillica at night and it was beautiful! If not for this bus trip, I would not have had the opportunity to see the bascillica at night! There is not alot to see around the hotel, so if you do want to do some site seeing you'll need to travel by taxi or bus if you don't utilize the service the hotel provides. The pool area was nice and there was a place to get cool beverages - but they were expensive! Also, even though we are Platinum Priority Club members, we did not get any free breakfast coupons like we normally do (and it appears most everyone else had!) so while breakfast was good (the chocolate croissants were fabulous!) it was expensive also. The hotel set up a private transfer for us from the hotel to the cruise ship in Civitavecchia. The driver showed up on time, carried our luggage (and there was lots of it!) and got us to the port in style! We were very happy with this service they hotel set up for us! Overall, the St. Peter's Crowne Plaza was a good place to stay before our trip. Clean, spacious and comfortable, only negatives being that it's kind of out of the way and can be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter933
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conviniently located near the major historic spot of Rome. Free shuttle buses to Vatican City and they also offer an airport shuttle run for €12. Rooms are very nicely appointed and my room was having a view on the patio and pool. Breakfast was a bit pricey but I saved a few € by preordering a minimum of 2 breakfast. Internet was not included and it`s a bit expensive. Staff were all very professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angie O
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and is very customer oriented. The only glitch was when we arrived from a very long trip from Paris, we were told they did not have a room for us. We were upset of course, but they were very apologetic, and they set us up at a sister hotel- Holiday Inn with taxi trip to and from, breakfast buffet and shuttle to the city center paid for. The next day we had to come back and to our delight, they upgraded our room to a suite overlooking the pool. The rooms are huge and very comfortable and beautiful. The spa and roman bath are amazing, and they provide free shuttle service to the city and the vatican. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some things troubled us”
Reviews.Author: RENATAGREECE
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked a room to Crown Plaza Rome through a travel agency one month before we went. Generally the hotel was nice. The reason for going there was our wedding anniversary, so we asked our travel agent to ask them for a very nice room for this reason. So, that's what our agent did and as we were informed they would do their best to please us. Also, we booked a seat at the shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel because the hotel is far from the airport and far from the centre of Rome, so we had first to go there and get familiar with the means of transport and then start to use them. The hotel staff told our agent to tell us to print out from their website the place from where we could pick the shuttle bus and the itinerary of this bus. Despite the fact that we had to stay 1 hour to the airport because the shuttle bus was arriving at the airport every hour (that was not convenient), we preferred it this way because it seamed the easier way to go to the hotel (we had heard that there are taxi drivers outside the airport who are not licensed and generally that taxis are expensive). When we arrived at the airport and checked out we went straight to where our map said and waited for the shuttle bus. In order to be sure that we were at the right waiting place, we showed the map to some airport staff and asked them, but they said that they didn't understand the map and probably we were at the right place but they weren't sure. We saw that many shuttle buses from other hotels were coming and picking up people but despite the fact that the scheduled hour was passing we couldn't see the Crowne Plaza bus. We went that area back and forth with our luggage probably a hundred times and finally at the end of that area - far from any other shuttle bus- we saw a bus with the name of the hotel. The driver had was lying at his seat and was almost sleeping. When we asked him why did he stop there, he told us that he got confused because the pick up point had recently changed!...and of course he wasn't interested in trying to find us despite the fact that we were the only passengers that had booked a seat for this hour. When we finally got to the hotel, 2 hours after we had arrived at the airport, we told the receptionist what happened but she wasn't very interested for our problem and the worst part is that the room that they gave us had a back view of the hotel where the hotel's garbage were thrown and next to a school full of children yelling and playing when going out. The person from the hotel who had received our agent's email for a nice room obviously ignored it! When my husband saw that, went down to the reception again and asked for better room and finally we got a nicer room with a pool view. Mr.Alli and Mrs Marianna at the reception helped us with this problem. This room was wonderful! The other setback was that the schedule of the shuttle bus to the centre of Rome was not convenient. Also, the room was really hot and there was not any airconditioning but it was very clean(every day it was cleaned thoroughly). Breakfast was really good. Also, the staff at the breakfast lounge was wonderful (I think the woman in charge was called Veronica-wonderful person-and really polite and helpful) and the staff and food at the hotel's restaurant was also very good. We met another driver from the one that picked us from the airport who took us to the Vatican area, who was really polite and suggested us where to eat and what to see. Pool area was good but there wasn't good service there.
