We sat at the pool area and drunk two beverages before leaving the hotel but when we saw our bill we realised that the prices were almost two times higher than the ones at the catalogue that we had seen before ordering. We told it to the waitor who asked us for his apologies and brought us a new bill with the correct prices. So, if we hadn't asked for a catalogue before ordering we would have payed the beverages twice their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Decent!”
Reviews.Author: djibrilliant
Reviews.Content: Large conference hotel, further from the city centre. Stayed 4 nights, enjoyed decent typical buissness hotel rooms and professional service,They could use a full renovation though. Breakfasr buffet is nice and you can get good quality at dinner as well. Location is quite convenient and can be reached fairly easy. Front desk is very efficient and kind. Propably would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Gaetano M
Reviews.Content: A one week vacation in Rome with our children in August 2011. We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza. Great pool. Hardworking staff, grazie Veronica and Rafaelle! We will be coming back for sure! A presto! Gaetano and Silvia (Montreal, Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Ros12
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days prior to and following a cruise. Reception was a disaster! Only one person checking guests into the hotel. Food in the Restaurant was poor and service was not much better. Staff clearly needed some training with the exception of the lady in charge at breakfast who was wonderful and couldn't do enough to help. Pool area was excellent and food and service at the pool bar was very good - but it was closed during our stay after the cruise. Too far out for a trip exploring the sights of Rome. Not what I expected of a Crowne Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Champagne Service”
Reviews.Author: m_shazad84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and it was a pleasant experience, the hotel staff were great, very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, spacious, and the hotel provides a free bus shuttle into the city centre which takes about 20mins, But be aware there is no bus between 12pm and 4pm. The last bus is at 9:15pm. A special thanks to Davide Grilli who sent a free bottle of champagne as it was my mrs birthday but as we dont drink alcohol they were more then happy to change it for a non alcoholic drink. Breakfast times are very ideal as on weekends it is served till 11:30am. Veronica added a special touch with a big smile and greeted us every morning and even wished my wife happy birthday. Breakfast was a good experince compared to the food in rome as it is very expensive and not up to standard. Be aware eating in is double the price so ask first. There is a bus outside the hotel which takes you into the city centre for 1euro but you have to purchase ticket from hotel. Do not eat at the restaurant next to the hotel as it is very expensive and the servie is very poor we waited over an hour for french fries and they do not serve pizza during the day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it is worth the money. Ps Italy now has a city tax which you pay on departure for staying in Italy. The rate is 3euro's per person per day.

Reviews.Title: “Last night in Italy a welcome experience!”
Reviews.Author: pjlandis
Reviews.Content: We used our priority points to book this hotel. Very nice hotel room in we asked for an upgrade and they had already upgraded us to a 2 room suite. The bed was very comfortable, the room clean, we had two baths and balconies that overlooked the huge pool and grounds. We were not looking for a great location since we were flying home the next day. A great perk is the shuttle service (12 Euro per person) to the airport the hotel offers. This was such a welcome service to us since we came in the subway and taxi, not fun. The restaurant and bar were very nice with live piano music to add to the experience. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Prelude”
Reviews.Author: Julian A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza prior to embarking on a Mediterrean cruise and were thoroughly delighted with the accommodations, service, and competent staff. Rooms were well appointed, the restaurant was first rate, and the entire staff was very helpful, courteous, and professional. On future trips to Rome, we would consider the Crowne Plaza our "home away from home".

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza St.Peters - an oasis of calm in bustling Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gordon R
Reviews.Content: Fabulous 4 days in Rome, this hotel could not have been better. Great rooms, clean, stylish with every facility that you might need, with the added bonus of a lovely peaceful garden, excellent swimming pool and top class spa. After hours of fighting the crowds in the city, great to come back to the calm of the Crowne Plaza, relax by the pool with a glass of Santome Prosecco and to enjoy the hospitality of Signor Grilli and his superb team. Very few hotels in Rome can offer this quality of service along with the oasis of calm that helps to make a visit to this fabulous city even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience !”
Reviews.Author: SojournerScotland
Reviews.Content: Too far from anywhere. The worst check out I have had in any hotel in the world !!!! Would not go back again

Reviews.Title: “One night precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: cknic_11
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean/comfortable rooms, and friendly, competent staff. Would have preferred to stay closer to City Center and the Vatican. Shuttle was nice but we like the freedom to come and go when we want so used it only once..taxis otherwise. Lunch was good but expensive. Ate a good dinner at a nearby restaurant...service not so good. Only complaint was with the hotel shuttle service to the Port..The driver had been told to wait for more riders coming from another hotel but those people had been directed elsewhere..After an hour, we left; rode around Rome for another hour and finally met up with the missing and left for the port. Once there we were told to get off the bus away from the docks and to collect our luggage. The driver then left with no explanation. Would have been nice to know that the hotel shuttle was not allowed into the area where the ship's shuttles were and we were to get there on foot! .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for families & very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Furhana
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights - had a very pleasant stay. The staff are always friendly and helpful. Shuttle service is very handy. My only suggestion would the shuttle have late evening pickups from the airport as we arrived on an evening flight and had to take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Below average Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: HT-Birmingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights recently on a trip to Rome. Firstly we entered the lobby and it felt a bit like a cattle market! There was a big Russian tour group checking in, and there wasn’t any kind of queuing process!! Not what you really want to see when you arrive. As a Platinum member I tried to stand in the dedicated queue, which wasn’t much help. After about 20 minutes we were able to check in! We did get a sorry for the delay but that was about it. We were issued out keys and that was that. I had booked a standard room, but not sure if I was placed in upgraded room, as it did have complimentary water, chocolate, in addition to the standard tea and coffee. The room itself was well appointed with flat screen TV, safe, ironing board, robes and slippers. Could not fault the room. House keeping was a bit hit and miss and wasn’t consistent. One day we wouldn’t have the tea replaced, the next the shampoo wasn’t replaced, another day our dirty towels were left on the seat, the next we had additional rubbish left from another room (an empty tissue box and dirty glass!) Breakfast wasn’t that fantastic for a 4 star hotel. They had about 3 hot dishes, and various cold meats, breads, cereal, 2 types of juices. Would have expected something like an egg station at least in a 4 star hotel. The waiters again were hit and miss, some days they would ask if you wanted tea or coffee, other days wouldn’t get asked at all. So best to go help yourself! Other amenities at the hotel included the swimming pool, which was a nice relief from the Roman hot weather. But don’t expect a lot from the life guard. Most of the time, when he was there, he spent playing on his phone. If I had children I would look after them myself! And help yourself to towels! The hotel also ran a shuttle service from the hotel to the Vatican in the morning and then hotel to the city centre in the evening. This was actually the best bit of the hotel! The drivers were always helping and welcoming. The shuttles were always on time and always got a seat. Overall I think reception did let the hotel down. Other than the queuing problem with the tour group, they never seemed to every have enough staff on, so you always had to wait, even to ask the simplest of questions. The night before checking out I asked where I could check in online for my flight. I was told in the business centre, I asked if there was a charge and was told there wasn’t for checking in. I went to the business centre (which is opposite the reception), logged in and then was told I needed an access number. Surely the receptionist would have known this?? I went back to reception and asked another member of staff who advised me I had to pay?!?! When I said his colleague just said it was free, he pulled a face. When I said I'll just talk to her again, he gave me an access code. So personally, I would pick another hotel next time. Practical points - If you haven’t booked breakfast, then you can purchase it cheaper if you book ahead at a cost of 14 Euros, opposed to 18 Euros per person. Pick up a shuttle timetable from reception when you check in, and get the receptionist mark the meeting points on a city map. If you plan to get the last shuttle from town then get a card from the driver, which guarantees your place on the shuttle. If you do need to get a taxi then it roughly 10 Euros to the Vatican during the day, to the airport it’s about 50 Euros. The hotel does run a shuttle to and from the airport at scheduled times at a cost of 12 Euros per person.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Rome away from the bustle of the city centre”
Reviews.Author: JohnK_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is handily placed for visiting the centre of Rome, either by shuttle bus or taxi. Rooms were well equipped and more spacious than central Rome. Even though the shuttle was a 52 seat coach we only managed to get on to the coach on 1 out of 3 attempts.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect interest if something goes missing.”
Reviews.Author: steve r
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Peters on August the 1st to the 5th this year and whilst i can say the hotel is nice enough and the food is not too bad should anything go wrong you may find yourself in a different situation. I arrived to find our room not ready and the check in staff were as helpful as they could be and suggested using the spa and the pool until it was. We left a case with the front desk guys and took a laptop bag and rucksack down to the spa as they fitted in the lockers down there. Figuring we needed a little cash as we had no room to check drinks against i took 30 out of 300 euros and went upstairs to lounge around for a while. Once we checked in we gathered our things and went to the room, it was then i discovered i didnt have the remainder of the 300 euros so i returned to the spa thinking i may have left it in the locker but no sign at all. I reported it to the staff in the spa and to reception, however i didnt call the police thinking the hotel would try to do something and who wants the police trailing around a hotel anyway. However nothing was done at the time and since returning the hotel sent me a mail saying here is a goodwill gesture of 25,000 point (1 night in a crowne plaza as a goodwill gesture) i replied saying it simply was not good enough i lost a huge portion of my holiday money within hours of arriving, alas no reply to that. I contacted the group directly and the final response i have had from them is the hotel says there is no evidence of theft but i can keep the 25,000 points. That to me says there was NO theft (so i must be lying) but have the points anyway........its this kind of attitude that makes me mad, i should have called the police there and then at least i could have claimed it on my travel insurance!! Sorry St Peters, nice enough hotel but terrible customer service when it mattered most

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vinnybob54
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel during our seven nights in Italy. The service was very good by all the staff that we encountered. The rooms have irons and ironing boards, which was a big plus for us. The dinner buffet was very good, and the breakfast buffet was outstanding. There is an ATM in the lobby that dispenses Euros, so it is safer than using one on a street corner somewhere. It would be a very long walk to the Vatican from the hotel. Our tour bus drove us there, so it was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Only Average”
Reviews.Author: DavidH18
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Rome for 5 nights as part of a trip to Italy. I stay at a lot of IHG properties, Intercontinental, Crowne Plaza and Holiday Inn's due to my job. This hotel is not CP standard, probably OK to be a Holiday Inn. The decor is very 1980's, the rooms are extremely dated with thw worst air conditioning I have ever come across. Considering that Rome was uffering a heat wave, 37/38 degrees this caused a big problem. There was no club room which was dissapoining to me. One of the restaurants was closed leaving only one restaurant in the hotel. The shuttle bus was a positive but essential as the hotel was in a poor suburb of Rome with no ammenities within 20 minutes walking distance of the hotel. We got our meal free one night as the service and selction was so bad. We only stayed here is it had a pool otherwise we would have stayed at the intercontinental in the centre of Rome

Reviews.Title: “Standard tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizzylizzy
Reviews.Content: This is a standard tourist hotel. Rooms are not very big and show some wear, but adequate and clean. A free shuttle to St Peter's square (20min) is the major transportation to city center attractions. There is not that much around the hotel (quite residential). Several buses stop in front of the hotel and you can use them (and subway) to go to the city center too. The buffet in the restaurant is fine, not fancy but not pricey either. Staff is very friendly and willing to help. The hotel rate is quite attractive (and I got a buy1 get 1 free rate) and seems to be used by quite some travel agencies - I saw several bus loads of US travelers during my 4 days there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CandGEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff of the hotel were excellent. They were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was very comfortable, clean and well serviced each day. Breakfast was included in the deal we took and it was fabulous. Plenty to choose from and lovely,friendly, hard-working staff - would highly recomend the breakfast. We took the shuttle option from the airport, provided by the hotel - excellent value! (e-mail hotel to make arrangements) We used the free shuttle bus provided by the hotel into the city on several occasions (3kilometres) and we found the driver to be most helpful and very pleasant. We chose this hotel because of the swimming pool as we were visiting in the middle of August. It was fantastic to come back to the hotel after a morning of sightseeing and take advantage of the pool. The downside of this hotel was we felt the restaurant prices to be very expensive and also the drinks!!

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we were hoping for!”
Reviews.Author: jodie114
Reviews.Content: I was a little sceptical after reading some of the recent reviews, but i found them really unfounded. The room we had (2 doubles) was beautiful, modern and spacious, on the ground floor overlooking the pool. I found the staff very good, and efficient with any query we had - the breakfast was amazing, we didn't book it at the time but was too tempted when we arrived so pre booked for our stay and was so glad we did, the international mini newsletters were a lovely touch for my footy mad hubby! One thing i will say is the pool, is beautiful but recent reviews were correct, it is freezing, even though we were there in 38degree heat... and just a warning the kids pool is 0.7m deep, but the main pool starts at 1.4 and goes up to 3m so was useless to my 8 yo who is unconfident if he cannot touch the bottom. You do have to get buses, but we very quickly sorted this out, and never once got a taxi, enjoying the sights to and from our destination. All in all, if we ever return to rome, i would have no reservations in booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The pool is great, very big and with temps topping 34 C, a big hit with the kids”
Reviews.Author: milly094
Reviews.Content: Good points: pool, staff, cleanliness, Less good: bit far out which for us with kids aged 7 and 12 (who were not up to venturing out in the v hot temp during the day) meant relying on the hotel bar and restaurant for food and drinks. At 6 euros for soft drink or beer or plate of fries, the costs added up. Best to stock up on some supplies from the spar when you're out and about. We also spent a lot on cabs as shuttle bus times didn't always suit us. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful with any requests and all in all we had an enjoyable stay and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: longhair9
Reviews.Content: We chose the Crowne Plaza mainly because it has a pool, the idea being a nice cool dip after a hectic day sightseeing, this proved a very good idea due to the heat at this time of the year (August). It is positioned a little out of the city centre but this did not pose a problem. There is a taxi rank on site, the hotel runs a shuttle bus into the vatican area am and the city centre pm. If you book tours at the hotel the tour company will pick up and return. The hotel was excellent in most respects, the restaurant was spoilt by the lack of vision shown on the menu, (for instance one night it was all fish dishes) fortunately there is an excellent restaurant next door, five minutes walk. But all in all we found the hotel to be excellent, the staff were very helpful, friendly and there were no language problems. Rooms were spacious and comfortable and we would have no hesitation in returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for getting out of busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: vivedetravel
Reviews.Content: The shuttles to and from airport great. Took advantage of city shuttle if it worked with our schedule, if not only 12 euro to get in city, not far at all. I loved getting out of busy Rome and into a huge great pool and relaxing on property. Had a great work out in their gym, wonderful breakfast. Absolutely no free Internet though. This hotel is ranked right where it needs to be. Taxis right outside the door for immediate assistance.rooms clean and bedding nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break with children!!!”
Reviews.Author: rjhmt
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a few days in Rome and found this hotel to be exactly what we were expecting having read all the reviews on trip advisor. Yes, its a little dated and some of the furniture is slightly worn in areas but the bedrooms were spotlessly clean and beds were lovely. We checked in very easily and were given inter-connecting rooms which we had previously requested and the lady at the desk was very polite and friendly. Rome was heaving and extremely hot so the pool was an absolute god-send - very large for a city hotel and wonderfully refreshing after a morning of sightseeing - our children absolutely loved it. We never used the free shuttle but taxis were always readily available and cost just over 10 euros to get in to the city centre. By joining their loyalty programme on arrival we also received free internet access. I would definitely return to this hotel if ever coming back to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “We will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: Having visited Rome a few times before and having stayed in the centre, this time as we had the children were with us we opted for a hotel with a pool. Really pleased we did, everything was great, even the fact the hotel is a short ride from the 'sights' did not spoil our trip. We found the staff very accomodating and willing to please, even when we asked a change of rooms the request was dealt with both with a smile and very quickly. Breakfast was excellent as was the evening buffet that was good value. The hotel pool is a must in August with the childen. The hotel has a good ambience and is comfortable and welcoming after a long day seeing the 'sights'. Our advice would be to join organised tours of the main 'sights' and remember EU citizens with photo ID can get discounts especially the children. Special mention is of the hotel's great staff (too many to mention), especially Stefano the bus driver who was not only informative but very helpful as were the staff in the excellent spa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visiting Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Pythonicus
Reviews.Content: Super family room. Great pool. Free shuttle into Rome in 10 minutes. Restaurant expensive, so eat in Rome. Good parking. Lovely area.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for your belongings”
Reviews.Author: Tienschneider
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so far away from everything. If one only has three days to visit the city, it would take much of one's precious time for traveling to the city. The hotel provides free shuttle to the city, but the waiting time is not worth it. There's nothing to walk to. As soon as I checked in my room, I took my earrings of to go down for a swim, no more than 30 minutes later, I came back to my room and my earrings disappeared after the extra bed was set up. I called the front desk and was told that they have to talk to the housekeeping and will call me back tomorrow since it was after 8PM. The next day, no one called me so I called the front desk again, and was told the same thing, again, no calls. The situation was repeated every day until the day i checked out, I was told by the manager to go to a police station and report the theft and that they cannot do anything to help me. I left without my $500 earrings.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL.”
Reviews.Author: Martin C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times, both with my wife, and with friends. Over the last few years, I have indulged myself, and taken to visiting alone for what I call my annual chill weekend, my wife is happy to get rid of me! I love the location, easy to get into Rome itself, but far from the madding crowd, and nice and peaceful, with lovely surrounding gardens. The facilities are top class, from the large, if cold outdoor pool, refreshing in the heat, to the indoor pool and spa. As for the hotel itself, it is perhaps a little 70's in decor, not a problem for me, and is clean, the rooms are very good, lovely large bed, and usually good views, no complaints at all. The bar area is more than adequate, but can get busy at times, the staff are very friendly, and do their best to serve everyone, but you may wait a little while, there is usually some live music, not to loud to stop you talking, Overall, my experiences at this hotel are very good, whether you are alone, or with people, it is a good choice, staff are friendly and helpful, and I feel very at home here now. I am looking forward to my next trip already! The bar and food are expensive, but then so is Rome, so bite the bullet and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: KidFlavio
Reviews.Content: What makes the Avenue Crowne Plaza a great hotel is its wonderful staff. Everyone from the front desk staff to the room service employees to the housekeeping staff all do a wonderful job and treat you like a valued guest! Good customer service in these days of cutbacks is very hard to find. They seem "to get it" at this hotel that a satisfied guest returns and pinching pennies and being cold guarantees someone will not return. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “YES!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robyfla
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel!!! Fantastic staff!!! Room was very clean, much better service than other hotels I have stayed. Ive been to different hotels and the staff here looked out for your every need. I would highly recommend the Crowne Plaza to anyone who wanted to visit Rome and we will certainly be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Check in personnel as skilled as a New York scam artist”
Reviews.Author: Ray G
Reviews.Content: I had trouble checking in to this hotel because the hotel claimed they did not receive my booking through a hotel broker. Oh, they would give me a room alright but ..." you will pay more if we don't get the booking confirmation" even though I had a confirmation of the booking. They claimed that it was only a confirmation from the booking agent and did not confirm that I had a booking with them. ( Wha...?, Hellooooo!) These guys really could work the streets of New York and get rich. Come to think of it... maybe they are already. Stayer, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Warning!! Do not stay here, even for the pool!”
Reviews.Author: Dalia E
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here from August 10 to 13th, 2011. We had two rooms, one for myself, wife, and two children, and another for my parents. Everything from check-in until departure was definitely not up to standards. The front desk staff was rude and unhelpful. They attempted to charge us more than the booking price (through Hotel.com). Their only response was, "You must pay extra!" They offered no alternatives. Lobby is littered with trash. The food in the restaurants and room service was HORRIBLE and overpriced. Better food was obtained by street vendors in Rome! The entire decor of rooms, lobby, hallways, and restaurants was circa 1970's and dirty. The hotel is extremely far away from anything meaningful, and the surrounding area is not safe! Crime is everywhere just outside the hotel grounds. Not only is this hotel not up to standards for a Crown Plaza, but is pales in comparison to even budget hotels in U.S. such as Red Roof Inn! The outdoor pool is decent, but even this cannot make up for a very bad hotel. You are WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, probably visit it again”
Reviews.Author: SkyE5
Reviews.Content: Good location although a bit off the city center, public transportation is available just down the street. Hotel is indeed a bit outdated, hopefully will get refurbished soon. Positive: - large and clean guest room - pool & fitness area - shuttle service - breakfast No negative remarks.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be taken care of....”
Reviews.Author: Sofie022
Reviews.Content: The first impression of hotel and staff was very good but everywhere in the hotel we discovered lots of things which needed reparation or a general renewal. The shower button was gone, the toilet didn't flush well, the tap in the bathroom hardly ran.... The halls are covered in dark red-brownish carpet, would be so much nicer with a bright colour or even no carpet. Everytim we mentioned a break down to the managing staff we were helped out immediately! The free bus shuttle is a good option but doesn't cover the trips enough, we had to take taxis a lot of times (easy because they wait outside the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Adestri
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good service and great rooms, with king size beds, and big bathroom. The only negative point is its location, if you like walk, because is far from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Rome St. Peter's was a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ermsPhoenixAz
Reviews.Content: Stood at this hotel from 7/16 thru 7/19/2011. Very nice and comfortable rooms. Really enjoyed the breakfast even though we only had it one day because of excursion trips we had to leave the hotel pretty early. I like the shuttle bus going to the Vatican or the mid city area but only wished it was later when the last shuttle picks up people in the city. I believe it was like 9:15pm. The location is not really near anything, like cafes, clubs, restaurants Though I heard the restaurant next door was very good and reasonable. We just didn't have enough time to go there and eat. All in all, very nice grounds,pool, fitness gym and spa. I would probably stay at this hotel again though just wished in had more things to do in their neighborhood. .

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel and location to explore Rome.”
Reviews.Author: gehnash
Reviews.Content: Just completed an amazing four days at the Crowne Plaza, This hotel is superbly situated just 15 mins by hotel courtesy bus to the Vatican or downtown Rome. The room was well furnished, spacious and spotlessly clean. All staff that we spoke to were very friendly,helpful and efficient in dealing with our requests, from check in, concierge to house keeping. The hotel pool was excellent and a great way to relax after a hard day sightseeing. There were always sunbeds available even when it was busy. The hotel runs a bus to and from Leonardo Da Vinci Airport. It's 12 euro per person each way. I recommend you telephone the hotel to arrange this to pick you up before you arrive. You are then taken straight to the hotel. Taxi costs about 40 Euro !! Very very convienient. I would highly recommend the Crowne Plaza to anyone who wanted to visit Rome and we will certainly be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry but not up to usual Crowne Plaza standards”
Reviews.Author: yabbadabba
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from 20th July and have to say that I was totally underwhelmed by the experience. As a Priority club Platinum member I stay at Holiday Inn or Crowne Plaza hotels virtually on a weekly basis and this hotel is probably one of the least welcoming. The whole check in experience was very poor and I was made to feel more of a hassle to them than a guest!! And this was by the evening Duty Manager - someone who really should know better! The original room I was given was not suitable and when I asked to move rooms it was clear that this did not please the Duty Manager - so much for welcoming, friendly staff!!! We were a party of 2 adults and 2 children and despite asking, every day we were given a hospitality tray for only 2 people. Corridors and rooms are a bit dated and need renovating - if this hotel wishes to honestly reflect the Crown Plaza brand. I actually think that it appears more like a Holiday Inn than a Crowne Plaza. The hotel's location isn't too much of an issue for visiting the sights of Rome - but it is an issue if you wish to walk to a local restaurant as the selection of restaurants within reasonable walking distance is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but strangely grimy.”
Reviews.Author: is1groovygal
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what other hotels are like in Rome, because this is the only one I've stayed at. The decor was modern, yet many things were worn out like the carpets and furnishings. Many surfaces, like the granite in the bathroom, and the reception counters were grimy. However, the bedsheets, towels, and robes in my room were plush and clean. The in-room entertainment (including local TV) costs extra. I don't recommend the in-room internet, unless you have your own laptop. It's really slow and hard-to-use. You have to get a bus or taxi to go to any shops, cafes or sights. The staff were very friendly, accomodating and most spoke English. We were even treated to an upgrade upon check-in :)

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: vincent_anania
Reviews.Content: Hi, We are a family of 4. My kids are 11 and 9 and we had the trip of a lifetime. The hotel was indeed beautiful and the staff was very friendly and very courteous to our needs, expecially to my children. The buffet is incredible and the spa and the gym and the pool is first rate. I woiuld highly recommend of stayingl here. It is a bit out of the city centre but getting a taxi is the way to go. Yes you pay anywhere from 10 to 15 euros but as the saying goes you pay what you get. We found it so convienant to go where we wanted to go. The men in the lobby are so helpful in getting you taxi as well. A first class hotel and a job well done! I will definitely come again! Vince Anania and Family from Niagara Falls Canada

Reviews.Title: “1mile from vatican with free shuttle service and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: travelbugAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome 3 nights at Crowne Plaza befire embarking on a mediterranean cruise. We found the hotel very nice, rooms were a bit bigger than normal standard, the bathroom was not very practical as they were a bit small and need a refresh. Staff is very friendly, food is ok. Breakfastvery big selection There is a free shuttle bus into Rome. Next to the hotel there is avery good italian restaurant witb very good value for money. Review to be fpind on redtaurant sectipn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Comfortable and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeM2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not close to city sites, but has a "periodic" complimentary shuttle service. Local busses 98 and 881 will get you to the Vatican and you can walk from there. The hotel pool was great and towels were complimentary. The rooms were large and well equipped with ample information. Conciege and reception were helpful throughout and breakfast was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cee302
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 12 to the 16th. Excellente! all the way. Free shuttle to the city center. location is very good and the staff is right on the money. I will recommend this hotel to future travellers.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: flamblam
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, it was worth the money. The breakfast is delicious and the hotel staff and service were good. Location to St Peter Square and all the touristic places is good also We would consider coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to be based in as a Tourist in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sanmenon
Reviews.Content: We reached the Crowne Plaza after a long-ish drive down from Venice via Florence and San Gimignano, with very low expectations after a series of bad hotel experiences through Italy. The Crowne Plaza was surprisingly the most economical of our hotel stays in Italy, and we were obviously worried as the more expensive hotels in the other cities had turned out to be hole-in-the-wall sort of establishments, and the one place we enjoyed was a billing disaster. The Crowne Plaza St Peters was a welcome departure from bad hotel experiences in Italy. The staff were friendly and accomodating, the hotel itself was excellent, the room was brilliant, the shuttle bus to the Vatican and the old city a boon for tourists and the food was good. The Crowne Plaza St Peters made us feel good about Italy and rescued what was threatening to be a holiday spoilt by bad hotels. We spent 5 days here and came away extremely happy and satisfied. The only complaint is that they kept refilling the drinking water in the rooms with sparkling even though we had repeatedly requested for still water and even left a message on the desk saying "still water only". Small issue, really.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza - a welcome break from the Roman heat”
Reviews.Author: michaelmal1
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed in the Crown Plaza for a week from 12th July. The hotel was very pleasant and the best feature was the swimming pool and spa. We used the pool every day to recouperate from the sightseeing and it was very welcome. The beds were also very comfortable and we booked the american breakfast each morning to start the day off well (14euro each). We used the hotel's free shuttle bus a few times which is very useful for getting into Rome for the evening. The only drawback was the last return time was 9.15pm which was too early. Nevertheless we managed to get back every night using the public transport (we got the week public transport card for 16 euro each- great value - covers tram, bus and metro as many times as you want). We used the shuttle bus from the hotel to the airport (12 euro each) but I was a bit concerned about the airport to the hotel as the times were restricted so got a taxi instead rather than fight our way through Rome with suitcases. We did a lot of the normal tourist trips, St Peters - including the trip to the top of it which is well worth the. We also went to the catacombs which was very interesting and well worth a trip - (get the metro to to St Giovanni and then the 218 bus to Via Appia - St calixta catacombs were just off Via Appia only 8 euro for adults. The best place to go each evening is trastevere and we found a delightful restaurant, Hostario Del Moro, Vicolo Del Cinque, with a fantastic owner Tony. He really made everyone welcome and seemed to get a lot of return business. The pasta and pizza were excellent. All in all the Crown Plaza was a very pleasant hotel and provided a great break from the Roman summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good facilities but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: straightupntruthful
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a weekend to meet friends and enjoy the sights of Rome. Plus points Lots of facilities Courtesy bus in/out of Rome Pool Negative Corridors often littered with disgaurded room service items Expensive drinks in bar I.e 6 euro for a lager Breakfast service poor Front of house understaffed resulting in lots of waiting to check in/out For the price the facilities were good but lacked value for money ad front of house was poor and gousekeeping left something to be desired. I think netter value for money could be found elsewhere in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Decent Business Venue, better placed hotels for leisure”
Reviews.Author: MartinBancroft
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in June 2011, stayed one night for business purposes. The hotel is easy to reach from FCO airport and is located reasonably near to the Vatican. The other attractions of Rome are across the Tiber and from this hotel a 12 euro taxi ride. There is a bus stop near to the front entrance of the hotel, and there is a hotel shuttle service into Rome and to the Airport. This has an associated fee, but as I did not use them I am unaware of the cost. I had a standard double room on the 5th floor that overlooked the front of the hotel. The room was of a good standard and contained the larger than average bed and tea and coffee facilities. 8/10 Staff were efficient and helpful. 7/10 Breakfast - 6/10, ok, but could do better. Business facilities - 7/10 Cost - £160 room per night fee. Value 6/10

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Staff in out of the way location”
Reviews.Author: Mialane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here redeeming our points with some of my girlfriends. To our surprise a bottle of champange was waiting for us. It was my friend's birthday (which we didn't even mention to the staff- they noticed it on their own by looking at our passports at check in). I love when companies go out of their way to make your stay special. The Pros: Lovely Hotel Nice Spa with indoor pool Nice outdoor pool Great room EXCELLENT staff The Cons; Location wasn't within walking distance of anything we were interested (except the nearby resturant, which was delicious). The buses can take you anywhere. The pool was busy and no chairs were available.......but hey, that's summer for you.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible ending to a fabulous vacation”
Reviews.Author: nursing2313
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel didn't have air conditiong anywhere except the rooms, and those didn't work properly. The hotel was dirty. Our room was on the first floor on an alleyway with a broken window lock. The air condition didn't work, and I called the front desk to have someone to come look at it, they did and didn't do anything. When I came back late that night the AC was still not working. When ask to have a new room I was quickly told no. My mother had to get a little upset to get another room. 1 a.m. in the morning we are dragging our own luggage to the new room, that AC was no better and the staff acted like we were bothering them. I told them to have another room for me the next day. They did and the AC was ice cold. However, there were bed bugs in this room. This hotel should be condemned!!

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a summer holiday in Rome this is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: PAO008
Reviews.Content: I spend the best holiday ever in a European capital city and this was thanks to the courtesy of the staff, the location, the amenities, the SWIMMING POOL of the Crowne Plaza St Peter's hotel in Rome. My wife and I spend there 5 beautiful days (and nights) and we really enjoyed that coming back from an exhausting day of sightseeing we could have lay on the beautifull swimming pool, very relaxing!... BUT the most exciting has been the pool party on the last night where all the guest where invited and we ate, drank, and dance (not untill late as my wife said, but she's youger then me ....) thanks to all the staff of the CP in Rome Paolo

Reviews.Title: “A terrible way to end a wonderful vacation.”
Reviews.Author: 1985dawg
Reviews.Content: After finishing a 10 day cruise with Celebrity, we spent our last night of our wonderful vacation at the Crowne Plaza. The hotel was booked through the cruise line. We were very disappointed. The rooms were smelly and the hallways were hot and smelled like smoke. The air conditioning did not work properly in one of our rooms. The rooms were very large however the hotel appears to be in need of an update. The hotel was also very noisy at night due to a lot of tour groups staying here. It was not very centrally located. If you were planning on doing any sightseeing, you would have to use their shuttle service or take a cab. The shuttle service is free but it drops you off in out of the way locations that are often hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: cunorbust
Reviews.Content: The room was updated and clean and the coffee maker included instant coffee for the hot water (apparently standard for Italy inside a hotel room). We enjoyed the hotel itself including the room. The spa / workout area was very strict. The hair net must be worn if you enter the pool, even if you don't go under water. I have short hair and figured this rule would not be enforced for people with short hair. After I 'forgot' twice I was told I would be asked to leave if I did not follow the rule. I guess they prefer everyone to look like a Monty Python Twit of the Year. The front desk has a variety of staff, two front desk staff employees were excellent and the rest of them should follow the lead of those two on how to provide excellent customer service. They apparently prefer to bring two pots of coffee to the lobby and once it is gone or cold then that is it. When I noticed it was cold it took 15 minutes and multiple requests to get it refilled with hot coffee. Other requests for directions, etc. were similar with some of the staff happy to help and others on the staff preferring to do nothing or provide little more than an attitude. The shuttle goes to the Vatican and another stop closer to the center of town. This was very handy and useful. We used this shuttle both directions on the first day and the second day we took the public transportation to the Southeast part of the city near an outdoor market and walked back toward the center of Rome. I would probably try to find a different hotel if/when we go back to Rome or if we did go back I would have expectations for a "Holiday Inn" experience versus a "Crown Plaza" experience. We parked our car on site for no charge, it was very safe and close to the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Scratch - Honestly!”
Reviews.Author: MLORD13
Reviews.Content: Background: From Australia, travelling with my family visting Europe. Booked & paid in advance for 2 'Superior Rooms' at the Crowne Plaza Rome St. Peter's @ 240 Euros per room, per night. Ok lets start...... The hotel grounds/gardens are good, fresh and well manicured. However looking at the building as you arrive you get a sense of 1970 and if you like 1970 then this is the place for you. As you enter the main reception area the theme continues with dated reception area where there was around 10+ hotel patrons waiting patiently to speak to 2 hotel staff that were clearly under pressure. Once it was our turn to be served we went through the check in process quickly and efficiently. Armed with 2 x electronic keys for each room (magnetic barcode type you swipe) we got into a small and dated lift - hit the floor number and proceeded to our rooms. We successfully accessed one room but not the other as reception miscoded the access keys so we needed to go back down to reception and get the keys recoded. Entering the rooms I have to say I was completely underwhelmed. The bathroom was so small and so dated it wasn't funny. For example the chrome tap looked like its been there for 20 years, to be honest I have seen better in public toilets. The shower was a step in style over the bath complete with plastic shower curtain that is so close to your body it clings to you. The shower tap cover had broken/fallen off and was sitting at the bottom of the bath tub. The top of the vanity mirror was dusty and had/has cob webs. The sink is, well, small and congested with limited space for 2 cosmetic bags. Each of the 2 rooms housed 2 double beds that were comfortable, dressed with clean linen and 2 types of pillows that were firm and soft so you could chose what you liked. We also received some sprays for the pillows that provide for a restfull sleep which was nice. There was a work table that was so small you had to put the telephone on the floor so you could plug your laptop in. On the upside the internet connectivity is great with high speeds. Located on the wall was a small LCD television that delivers local TV and some English speaking channels. Be warned that if you want inhouse movies that will set you back 23 Euros but you'll be so bored at this place you'll gladly spend the 23 Euros to break the bleak monotomy of the hotel as there are no activities in this resort. The breakfasts are good with a decent buffet, lunch was OK but forget the dinner menu as it is so limited it's not funny that is unless you want to spend 35 Euro per person for the dinner buffet which is average at best. Keep you money and walk around the corner to the local restaurant which is cheaper, higher quality food with a far superior menu. Note that on Monday's the local restaurant is closed so you either go into the city to eat or stick with the hotel food. The swimming pool is 1st class, its large with shallow and deep ends and its long so you are able to swim to your hearts content. Once you have worked up an appetite or need a cold drink then there is a bar adjacent to the pool area but be warned, there are 2 guys staffing the bar that work in slow motion and I mean slow motion. For example we ordered a ham and cheese toasted sandwich, 2 wines, 1 beer and a coke and that took from start to finish 45 mins. The patrons were clearly getting frustrated as they waited to be served as was I. The bar inside the hotel operated efficiently at night and was accompanied with a pianist who was good. I could go on but really I have had enough. In summary, a dated hotel with below average rooms that aren't worth the money and a menu that sucks badly. For a Crowne Plaza Hotel, this one is bottom draw. PS: I forgot to mention the cockroach my wife killed in the corridor :( Had we not paid in advance I would have checked out straight away but them's the breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marja-Alain
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, a little bit far away from the center, but there are various free shuttle bringing you in the Vatican or center Roma. A few nice restaurants suggested by the front desk. Superb pool and spa. Nice breakfast. Nice bar, with perfect service and a very first-class pianist. Only issue, when we landed at Ciampino airport there was a strike of taxi's driver, and it was very complicated to find our way to the hotel (probably because we do not speak Italian). On the other hand no problem from and to Fiumicino airport, there is a paid shuttle from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: MimiS_03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my husband to celebrate my 40th B-day. Staff was helpful. Housekeepers kept the room very clean. Really comfortable bed. May not be a 5-star luxury but it is a very solid 4 . About 10 minute bus ride to St. Peter's Square on Bus route 881 or 98 or the Hotel shuttle bus. Oh, an FYI, transfer to the 64 bus at St. Peters to go the Termini or other major sites. FYI....don't be afraid to use the Roma bus system to get around. The buses come quite often. It may appear that it's free but it's really one euro p/p. Be careful you can get a 50 euro fine for not having a ticket. Oh, the 881 stops running at midnight....so you'll need to cab it after that time. Having a pool is a great addition!! After all the touring, it's really nice to take a dip in the pool in the middle of the day to regroup before heading out for the night. Lastly, back to location. As a couple who was happy to get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life, being off the beaten path was perfect for us. BUT if you like the night life EVERY night, crowds of young people, and drinking the night away, staying around the Spanish Steps area may be a good idea. Otherwise, this hotel was very comfortable to come home to.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay at the crowne plaza st peters rome - Franco is our hero!”
Reviews.Author: margirathbone
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with my sister for a three night break at the Crowne Plaza St Peters Rome. I had a number of queries before we travelled as we were arriving in Rome late at night - the staff I emailled couldnt have been more helpful with directions to the hotel, bus numbers, metro stops etc. On arrival we were upgraded to a lovely spacious room, given maps and timetable for the complimentary shuttle bus into Rome and greeted with a warm welcome. Our first day out was wonderful, the shuttle bus dropped us very conveniently at the back of St Peters Square, an excellent stating point for our day of sightseeing. We stayed out quite late to see the Coleseum at night and as such, missed the metro back to Cornelia, our nearest metro stop to the hotel. Catching the replacement bus service from Termini station bus was relatively simple, but when we got to Cornelia we couldnt work out what bus to get to the hotel. I rang the reception and to our delight, Franco, the guy on the desk, came in his own car to collect us and took us back to the hotel! Service above and beyond the call of duty in our view! On to the hotel itself - food is reasonably priced, drinks likewise as expected in a hotel, bar staff very attentive and professional. On our last day we relaxed by the outdoor pool which was a fabulous treat. There is a spa at the hotel, but we didnt have time to try it. all in all we had a great time in a lovely hotel. So many thanks to all, especially Franco - our hero!!

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to get back”
Reviews.Author: trina37
Reviews.Content: Curteous, knowledgebale staff , throughout the hotel. speaking a number of languages Outside pool great on a warm sunny day, and if you want a heated pool, this is inside. a Roman bath ( inside) is a surprise, something that must be discovered for oneself. Excellent restaurant, try local/regional/ national dishes, or speciality dishes, you can of course get burgers , chips etc, No they won't taste like they do at home ( your not at home). Any way, why miss out on part of the culture, food and wine is as much part of Italian culture as the Vatican and the colloseum., and as regional as Rome is to Lazio, as Venice is to Venito. I also think this is a fabulous hotel for a girlie, pampering weekend, with it's spa facilities, you can be pampered from top to toe, as much or as little as you want. I needed to change some GBP into Euro's When you get off the bus ( the morning Vatican service) walk straight to the main road,(Vatican wall in front of you, turn right, walk to the underpass for S.Pietro, before taking the underpass, opposite you will see a yellow sign at a booth which say's change, it has a western union sign as well i changed my money here, to change a £20.00 note i was given 22 Euro's, at the Forex change booth between St peter's square and the Hotel columbus about 500m away where i enquired 1st, i was offered 12 Euro's, you will also find the souvenir items at the shops on the way to the underpass are a lot cheaper, although exactly the same as those slightly nearer to the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Full size pool, large rooms, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: lafayettein
Reviews.Content: Great location for a cruise start/finish. Shuttle to city center or cab to metro. Tour Rome in the morning then spend the afternoon at the pool, then back to the city at night. Regular american sized rooms. Service excellent. Hotel has a first class restaurant with tables in the garden and next door is a family owned place that was a lot of fun. Being able to swim laps was a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent room and facilities”
Reviews.Author: DHAL21
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Rome St Peters for 4 nights for our anniversary and thouroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was great and it had 2 double beds which meant my 13 year old son had one to himself - he was happy to say the least! The hotel facilities were excellent and the pool was a bonus. They even provided clean towels on arrival at the pool. We used the airport shuttle both ways and it was very efficient and cheaper than a taxi even for 3 of us at 12 Euros each. Even better was the free shuttle bus into the centre of Rome which we used a number of times. When the times didn't quite suit us we used the local buses at 1 Euro each that stopped directly outside the hotel. When we arrived back from our first full day we found we had been left a complimentary bottle of wine from the manager for our anniversary which was very much appreciated and a very nice touch! The bar area was pleasant and had some live piano music and the service was excellent. Overall we had a great time and I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone else. Thanks to all the staff there and we would definately come again if we visit Rome. June 2011. Kind Regards,

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: Skinney
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights in early May when the temperature was in the upper 20's C. No air-conditioning with excuses varying from not allowed to put it on by law until June and "Broken". Room and all amenities therein was queit and comfortable.Hotel was not full. Had to travel over three floors to find an ice machine that worked. We don't eat in Hotels so cannot comment on food. Generally poor value for money. Had to pay an exorbitant amount for Wireless which is free in most three star hotels in UK. Mally

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel but a long way out”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza St Peter's for 2 nights in May. The hotel itself was great - large comfortable room with all the usual mod cons (flat screen TV etc). Our main gripe is its distance from Rome. We took advantage of the free shuttle bus, but it goes to the Vatican in the morning and the city in the afternoon, so if, like us, you want to go to the city in the morning you have to take a taxi or public transport. We stayed on a weekend so some of the buses didn't run, which meant we had to take a bus and the metro to get to the Colosseum - it took us about 1 hour to get there!

Reviews.Title: “Tidy place”
Reviews.Author: boodera
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel not to far out of the centre,hotel ran free shuttle bus to the centre, only stayed one night the hotel was booked by Iglu cruises so they also deserve a pat on the back.Mind you Rome is not cheap expect to pay over £60 for dinner and bottle of beer costs around £8.Our only drawback was waiting in a queue for half an hour to check in

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: OneInaMillion50
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here on 2 separate occasions while on a Mediterranean cruise leaving from the port of Italy, and were very happy that we stayed outside the main hub of Rome, and NOT in the city limits. A very nice priced hotel, with a great breakfast buffet. Only 45 minutes from the port of Italy, and 10-15 minutes from Vatican City. I had heard that it took as long as 90 minutes to travel from Rome to the port at Civitavecchia, but because we stayed just outside the city limits, getting to the port was easy. When we returned after our cruise, we took a day long Rome tour, ending at Vatican City, and the trip back to the hotel couldn't have been nicer after a long day of walking through history. Value priced rooms, and a very helpful front desk. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: jooliee
Reviews.Content: All the staff we came into contact with were all very polite and very helpful with informing us on how to get into the city, providing maps etc. We were room only, so didn't eat breakfast until we were in Rome itself. We didn’t eat at the hotel because we thought it was quite expensive to eat in the restaurant (18 Euros, or 14 if booked in advance), but we were eating on a budget! The drinks in the bar were also expensive, but it’s no different to what you generally expect in hotels! The room was fantastic! We stayed in one of the family rooms - very spacious, with complimentary bottled water replenished everyday and cleaned to a very high standard and we had a lovely view over the pool. The hotel was a little further away from the tourist attractions than we expected, but there was a bus stop just outside the hotel, with regular busses, and bus tickets were just a euro each way and stopped just down from the Vatican. The spa looked great, although we only used the pools as we were out in the city the majority of our time there. The pools were fabulous, the only comment I could make is that the outdoor pool was very cold, although it was only May! The hotel provided a shuttle bus to and from the city, but the times didn’t fit into what we wanted to do. There were taxis available when you needed one, with some helpful drivers, one of which told us an excellent restaurant to go to. Beware of roman driving, I was terrified! Be careful round the attractions, we almost got caught out by a man outside the colosseum who made conversation then came very close to getting a bracelet round my wrist – which he would no doubt have charged me for! Another helpful tip if you’re a first time visitor to Rome, the green man on pedestrian crossings doesn’t always mean it’s safe to cross!! All in all we both loved every minute of it, and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Rome St. Peter's should love its crown!”
Reviews.Author: Irish_EyesNJ_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible; had there been an option to give it 0 stars, I would have gladly done so. The staff were rude and unhelpful--simple interactions (check in, wake up calls, directions) seemed to be a hassle for the staff. Our room had a broken doorframe in the bathroom with exposed, moldy wood. In addition, our shower curtain had MOLD on it--the housekeeping staff was unconcerned and no effort was made to fix it. There was extremely weak water pressure in our room. Two drawers broke in the dresser in our room; they remained unfixed during our stay. Breakfast buffet is not worth the money; save it and go elsewhere. The room service menu is lacking in the basics. The shuttle bus is not as advertised--you can be dropped off near to the Vatican and in the "city centre" (not close to the main sights) in the evening, but that's it--no Vatican pick-up in the evening and no city centre drop-off in the morning, which made it difficult to get to the Colosseum/Roman Forum/anything in the morning. The hotel is VERY far from the heart of Rome--15 minute drive, 30 mins on the bus, about 45 on the Metro. Pluses: airconditioning was effective and the outdoor pool was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel a bit impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Markus619
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite big. I was given a large room but a somewhat dark with a side view of the swimming pool. Air conditioning was not working well and somewhat noisy. There was a complimentary good sleeping kit with essential oils that promote good rest. Breakfast was good with a good variety of foods. Lunches at the restaurant were good, too. The spa is nice with an overcrowded whirlpool, good sauna and steam bath and a big indoor swimming pool. The only problem is that we saw the pool boy sweeping the water left by people around the pool back into the pool itself. A little dirty... Car Parking was free. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: USABunch
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed here for 3 nights while touring Rome. It was a great place to come back to and unwind. Our kids enjoyed the pool and especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet. The hotel also provides a convenient shuttle bus from the hotel to the center of the city. The last bus leaves the city a bit on the early side and gets very crowded with guests trying to get back to the hotel, so if you plan on using the service, get to the stop a bit early to ensure you can get a seat on the bus. The staff was very friendly and spoke english well which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base”
Reviews.Author: TigersGreat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two nights. The hotel is clean and comfortable, provides a good breakfast and has a coutesy bus into Central Rome (15 minutes). Not in the heart of Rome, but a good base to work from.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and service make this a superb hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Willard7
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is a little out of the way and a 10 minute taxi ride from the city centre, the excellent staff, customer service and hotel facilities more than make up for it. Every single member of staff was friendly, helpful, efficient and all spoke fluent English which was a great help. Rooms were spacious, bright and clean. The outdoor pool was smart and not too busy. Breakfast was good with a wide variety of foods to choose from. Also, the hotel offers a complmentary shuttle bus service to the city centre and to the Vatican which was very useful. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: Toyota54
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself spent two weeks at the Crowne Plaza Rome-St Peters. The room was very nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant had a good selection of food with another restaurant available next door to the hotel. The indoor pool was beautiful and available to hotel guests without any charge. Bathing caps are needed to go into the pool and are provided by the pool staff, again, without any charge. The outdoor pool had just opened for the season and was spacious and very clean. For transportation we used the public bus. The 881 goes to the Vatican and connections can be made to the Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, the old Jewish Synagogue and other sites. The 889 brings you to the Metro. The Metro allows you to get around Rome quickly. Transportation tickets can be purchased at the hotel desk for one Euro each. The one ticket allows you to ride the bus and transfer to the Metro if used to transfer within 75 minutes. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “What a Grand Hotel and a Great Find”
Reviews.Author: dsul
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living and am usually on the road 30-36 weeks out of the year and this year our territory was extended to Rome, Italy. I usually only stay in the Holiday Inn chain which also includes Crowne Plaza and without sounding bombastic I am very well equiped to evaluate hotels. Since this was our first time in Rome, I searched many of the Holiday Inn hotels, Crowne Plaza's and Intercontinental Hotels within the confines of Rome. I wanted a good hotel inasmuch as I was also bringing along my boss...which adds a lot of tension in deciding on which hotel!!! I finally decided on the Crowne Plaza, Saint Peter's, which is just outside of the Vatican. It looked nice on their web site but I also knew that web sites can be misleading. I knew that our flight from the States would be early and all it took was one fax to the hotel to make sure our rooms were ready when we arrived....and they were even though we checked in before Noon. I was amazed at this hotel....the foyer was stunning, the rooms extra large, the internet workedlike a charm, they had a wonderful American style breakfast buffet, their outdoor pool, which you could easily see from the balcony in my room was spotless, the grounds were impeccable and I loved the amenities in the hotel so much (and I have so many I could probably open a store) that I asked for extra each day. When I entered my room there was a box of chocolates (nice touch) and two free bottles of water...another nice touch. Room Service was a tad pricey, but so was all of Rome with the dollar in comparison to the Euro! This hotel does offer a free shuttle to various but for me and my boss it was so much easier to grab a cab. Another nice service was that there are always cabs in a specific section just for the hotel guests. However, with all of that said, I judge a hotel by one major factor and that it the staff. If the staff is not good then for me the entire hotel is chalked off of my list for future trips. I have to be honest and say that this was the finest staff I have ever experienced. Regardless of my questions they were friendly, professional, remembered my name after I initially checked in and even the General Manager made it a point to introduce himself to me.....I have never seen a staff like this in the States....bravo to whomever trained this staff. Finally, after all is said and done and I was finished my daily business you will never know how wonderful it was to come back to the peace and quiet and beauty of this hotel, have a nice massage in their modern, underground (yes underground) spa and take a dip at night in their indoor poor. Would I recommend this hotel.....no a shadow of a doubt in my mind. Will I be back to this hotel.....each and every time I am sent to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel even if it is a little far out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: BootsUK
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel and had a great stay. Despite being a little further out of the centre we found this to be a bonus - a bit of peace and quiet after a hectic day in Rome was very much welcomed. The staff were very friendly and we couldn't fault much with the hotel. Transport We took the airport shuttle to the hotel which costs €12 each (cheaper than getting a taxi). The shuttle itself was great but the signpost to 'bus hotel' wasn't very clear. Come out of the arrivals hall, turn right and keep going right to the end - the Crowne Plaza bus is right at the far right. We took the hotel shuttle bus to and from the centre a few times which we found very convenient, especially as it was free! We had no problems getting onto the bus but we turned up early (10min ish). There is a public bus right outside the hotel, which we didn't use but looked very straight forward. We walked to the underground which was around 15min away and fine. On the walk up to the underground from the hotel we walked past a lovely modern restaurant which we tried and was very reasonable (and busy with local). Taxis aren't expensive either - about €10 to Vatican and €15 to the centre of Rome (even at night time). Hotel Spa This was lovely and great that its a children free zone - nice, quiet and relaxing after a busy day of sightseeing. Restaurants / bars We didn't eat in the hotel - to be honest the restaurant food looked rather bland. The hotel was really great and after 6.30pm they give free nibbles with drinks, a really nice touch. The bar had a nice atmosphere. The bar man on duty over the weekend (1st May) was great, unfortunately I didn't catch his name, but I would pick him out as particularly having good customer service. We ate in Arturo's next door to the hotel which was lovely and inexpensive. We walked up to La Nocetta but this wasn't open on the evening we chose. instead we walked up the road just out of the hotel to the right (up the hill where the bus goes), took a left and found a great modern restaurant on the right - v inexpensive (€40 for 2 incl starters, main and wine). There is also a McDonalds (we didn't eat here!). We also ate at Ristorante Il Chianti by Trevi Fountain which was really nice but a little more expensive than the other restaurants, but worth it. Rooms We got upgraded as I'm a priority club member which was fab. We had a room over looking the pool which I felt was one of the better locations. It had a good sized balcony and was well equipped - as you would expect from a Crowne Plaza. The only downside was the rooms are quite thin and we were a little disturbed by noisy neighboursa. Also when the main light switch was on there was an annoying buzzing noise. That said it wasn't a big problem and the main thing was the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “First Class "American" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slg_one
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is a first class "American" hotel in Rome. I booked 2 award nights using Priority Club points, and to our suprise, as Platinum Elite we were upgraded to a Suite. What a Fabulious room; actually 2 rooms. 2 Awesome balconies; 2 bathrooms and flatscreen TVs. The buffet breakfast was good, and if you pay for 2 mornings in advance its 14 euros per day (4 or 5 euro discount per day). Yes, as others have said, it's not in the center of Rome. But hotels in the center of Rome don't have all the amenties that you get at the Crowne Plaza, such as the pools, spa, restaurants, bar, etc. We stayed at a hotel near the Spanish Step and it had location, but none of the amenaties that we Americans expect. Also, they do have a courtesy shuttle that runs quite often to the center of Rome and Vatican City (the shuttle schedule can be downloaded from their web page). You can also take a bus (only 1 euro/pp) to the Metro that will drop you off in the center of the city (very easy and cheap!). Also it a short walk to the nearby Villa Doria Pamphilj - the biggest park in Rome (way bigger than Villa Borghese). It is a bit of a harrowing walk because there are no sidewalks on Via Aurelia Antica, but once you've walked around rome for a while you get used to the cars speeding by you. If you want to stay in the comfort of an "American" hotel in Rome, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “In a country far far away there's a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Janina87
Reviews.Content: Apart from the cockroach that we found in the bathroom once (and succesfully killed) we liked the hotel.  We spent the weekend in Rome, but hardly were in the hotel as we were at the many sights of Rome most of the time. The hotel is quite far outside of Rome but there are bus shuttles quite often.  The room was spacy with two queen sized beds (we would have preferred one bigger bed...) everything was clean.   I think I would try to get a hotel closer to the city centre next time. But aside from that and the cockroach it was a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: anthony_montgomery
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Rome we were delighted to be staying in an excellent hotel, with great facilities and very friendly staff. The location of the hotel was not an issue, as the free daily hotel bus service into Rome was ideal. We also used the regular local bus service which stopped outside the hotel. It was great to have access to a gym and spa as well as the outdoor pool. This was a bonus with a teenage son, who also enjoyed the good breakfasts!.Although the hotel was busy, it was not noisy. Our room was spacious, very clean and had a lovely balcony. We are now looking forward to another visit this June.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Service”
Reviews.Author: Tor_Travel_Guy
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel is located a little far from the city centre but this is a good thing as Rome can be quite congested. If you’re looking for a quiet place to go for dinner there is a restaurant right next door to the hotel. The rooms are big and decorated nicely. Unfortunately, the service at the hotel was very disappointing. First, the toilet in my room did not work (it would not turn off) and the technician had to come up three times to fix it – each time becoming more nasty then the last time he was there – and made it seem like it was my fault that the toilet did not work. The front desk staff were not friendly and seemed like it was difficult for them to answer questions about their hotel service. The rooms were noisy as I could hear the people in the next room and then people walking above me. Apparently, the hotel had a gym/spa in the basement but it was difficult to find. I called down to the gym before going and was told they close at 11pm so I had enough time to go as it was only 8pm. When I went to find the gym the lady in the gym told me to take a special elevator on the same floor as my room however; I could not find it. So I went down to the front desk and was informed that the gym’s elevator was located on the ground floor around the corner and down the hall from the main elevators. Unfortunately, the representative also informed me that the gym was closing at 9pm and not 11pm due to work but I just spoke to someone and was told it was 9pm. I didn’t get to work out and no one apologized for the confusion. When checking out – I completed a comment card with my bad experience and no one from the hotel contacted me or apologized for the bad service. In summary, the hotel is decorated to four star standard but the people working in the hotel need to work on their customer service skills as they take away from the overall experience of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy59
Reviews.Content: I'd like to first start by saying Rome is by far not my favorite city in Italy, but the Crowne Plaza St Peters, was the best hotel we had on our trip. After 4 days of cold cuts, and terrible coffee for breakfast, I was delighted to see scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, and ham on the buffet as well as the regular traditional European breakfast items. We were on a tour and our agenda was fairly aggressive so we had little time to enjoy the hotel amenities, but they looked fabulous. i could have stayed there a few nights longer, to just relax and enjoy the hotel. The rooms were quite large and had wonderful views of the grounds. We had a nice sofa and a couple of chairs to sit and enjoy our morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.......”
Reviews.Author: MichelleN06
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome over the Easter Weekend with my husband and young daughter, the hotel itself is lovely, we had room only rate, if you wanted breakfast it was an additional 18 euros per person and the hotel restuarant is extremely expensive to eat in, we decided that we would see what the area surrounding the hotel was like for restuarants and whilst there is not very many, it is still much cheaper than eating there. We came out of the hotel, turned left, walked past the outside opera house and into the little town there and found a chinese restuarant which was very cheap and two bars which are even cheaper and the staff where very friendly. We made use of the hotel shuttle to and from the city centre, be prepared for a shuffle to get on the bus (returning) people push in even if you have been waiting for a long time and some are not very friendly!!!! Overall a very enjoyable weekend in Rome and would most definately go back, but a word of advice if you have budgetted right down to the last penny, which we did and you come to check out and don't want a shock!!, then make sure you budget for the city tax which is 3 euros per person, per night.

Reviews.Title: “MERAVIGLIOSO!”
Reviews.Author: Allison38
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Rome on three occasions but this was my first time with girlfriends. It was a uniquely special experience because we were celebrating my friend's birthday (She is now the equivalent of two 20 year olds) in a beautiful and historic city and in a fabulous hotel. We each had our own sumptuous and spacious room and I slept like a baby every night - no small thing considering our days were spent pounding the Roman pavements (visions of sugar plums dancing in our heads) in search of fashion forward treasures. After all, a girl needs a good night's sleep to recoup and start all over again the next day! The hotel staff were warm and friendly and really went out of their way to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. Davide, the hotel manager, in particular really went out of his way to make us feel like we were visiting family members rather than hotel guests. His hospitality definitely made our stay in Rome one we will always treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent food and staff, bit too far from the attractions”
Reviews.Author: EssexMinx07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. To be honest I don't know if I misread the location, but I was a bit disappointed that it wasn't closer to the sights of Rome. We ended up spending a lot of money on cabs into and out of the city. The courtesy bus that took you back to the hotel at night from outside the 'polish church' should be in one of Dan Brown's books as a lost symbol as we could never find it! The bus only takes you to the Vatican in the morning and the main city in the afternnon, they are pretty far from each other which I didn't realise. Watch the taxi's at the vatican if you want to get over to the colesseum, they will rip you off, usual price around 14 euros. To get back to the hotel about the same. By the way when you step foot near the Colleseum, be aware you will get ambushed by men dressed as Gladiators who promptly ask to take your picture, well tell you they are taking your picture, then not too nicely demand 20 euros for the pleasure, do not engage them at all! You have been warned! Our room looked over the car park and main road. The balcony was pretty shabby and the room was quite small as well as not being very well sound proofed. We had particularly noisy neighbours who we complained about, the staff acted on our complaint very swiftly but you could literally hear their every word. I expressly booked this hotel for the spa, but we spent so much time sight seeing we never used it, but it did look nice enough when we checked it out.
