The pool wasn't open til May which we didnt know. In the main restaurant, the Osteria, don't just think you are limited to the menu. We asked for whatever we fancied and the staff accommodated us to the best they could. We expect excellent food service and quality and this restaurant did not disappoint. Room service was a joke, 20 euros for a sandwich! All in all if you want to embrace a romantic stay with a glass of wine overlooking Rome's skyline this is not the hotel for you. For a place to get your head down and be out of the hustle and bustle, then its fine. Rome is extremely expensive, so be ready to fork out. Lunch with a bottle of wine near to the Vatican cost 120 Euros and we were not eating extravagantly at all. We stopped off for a coffee, two coffees, a bottle of water came to 20 euros! Apart from this, Rome itself is truly amazing. I personally would have chosen somewhere near the Spanish steps to stay, to truly enjoy and embrace the wonderful energy that is Rome x

Reviews.Title: “Overall - average hotel. Let down by a series of little things.”
Reviews.Author: Cathe
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from 4 nights at this hotel. Mixed feelings, really. The good points: The staff at the hotel were lovely and very efficient - faultless. The cab rank in the car park outside makes getting a cab very fast. The spa area (indoor pool, sauna, steam room, jacuzzi) was clean and well-run. Take your flipflops with you or you'll have to purchase some there. The rooms were a good size and well-equipped. The not so good points: The whole place had the feeling of trying to be somewhat grander but they'd missed the mark and just made it dark/gloomy instead. The first things you see when you arrive is a poorly maintained driveway and badly lit reception area. Easy to fix if they chose to do so. The location is outside the centre of Rome and this shouldn't be an issue with the use of the hotel's free shuttle bus. There's just one problem - the running times don't reflect your needs as a visitor: the shuttle starts at 9am, so you get to your starting point around 9.45/10am which is half the morning gone, especially if you're looking to get St Peters and the Vatican covered. The last shuttle back leaves town at 9.15pm, which is too early considering that most restaurants only open for dinner at 8pm. This means you're either looking at a 20 euro cab fare or 50 mins of metro then a bus. Transport suddenly becomes a bigger issue at the end of a great day of sight-seeing. The bathroom was clean generally but spoilt by small issues like dirty grouting and mouldy shower curtain. Food in the Osteria restaurant was just ok - the quality was just ok, the options were not particularly Italian and at 25 euros, it was frankly expensive for what it was. Noise was an issue on one night, soundproofing should be better between rooms. The hotel could be brighter and really superb. As it is, I'd say this was a 3 star with excellent potential. We did have a good trip but I wouldn't reccommend the hotel for the location alone unless they change the shuttle schedule or you're prepared to get cabs in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: varietyclub
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay at a wonderful hotel. The quality of service was excellent with warm, friendly staff who made our stay highly enjoyable. The hotel had everything we needed and more! Mike

Reviews.Title: “Outside City but not an issue”
Reviews.Author: Alan056
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay here with no issues. Good sized bedroom with 2 double beds, very comfortable. Large bathroom, with ample towels / robes. Quick check in/out, and great service from concierge when required. Plentiful choice at breakfast buffet, with very good service from all staff. Nice ambience in bar in evening. Although hotel few miles from city, prompt and fairly frequent service from courtesy bus to Vatican am / Centre pm is available. Didn't use the pool or spa areas but both looked very good. Watch out when 'buzzing' for taxi from the hotel, in every case we used them they had their meter set to charge band 2 instead of 1. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off not being right in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: luxsey
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here for two nights at the beginning of April for my 40th Birthday. I am a Priority Rewards Member and I got two free nights in one of their suites from a special offer they ran last year. As I didn't pay to stay here I am not going to be as critical as I would have been if I had paid 320 euros a night. The suite was nice and spacious and lovely beds. Bathrooms ok but not the nicest I have experienced. Hardly any English speaking TV channels not that you go on holiday to watch TV but it is nice to relax in front of after being out all day. View from Balcony wasn't that great as looked down into the back of the kitchens and store areas (probably because we weren't paying). The ' suite extras' weren't included such as the free mini bar, chocolates, movies etc. This wasn't mentioned on the website when we booked so we ended up getting to use the mini bar for free after a complaint to the manager as to be honest we would have taken a standard room in the Intercontinental in the centre of Rome. However I was impressed by the way Georgia on reception dealt with my complaint. We ordered room service on both nights as after a day walking in Rome we were too tired to go out. Food was good especially the cheese platter which my husband thoroughly enjoyed. I used the Spa once- wear down the slippers from the room or flipflops or they will charge you 5 euros for a pair of their flipflops. It wasn't the best or nicest spa I have been to and as previously mentioned no under 16 year olds allowed. As also suggested, it would be good if they allowed children in at set times mainly when the outdoor pool is closed in winter. It didn't bother us not being in the centre of Rome. On arrival we left our luggage at the Train Station (4 euros for 5 hours) to save us going all the way back to the hotel and coming back in (the day we arrived there was a public transport strike, we had planned to get the airport bus from Ciampino to the metro station and stay on till Cornelia and then walk to the hotel.) We used the hotel's shuttle bus to take us into the Vatican and then caught it back later on in the day from the centre. It didn't take that long to get into the centre from the hotel either on the metro or using the hotel's shuttle bus. On the whole we had a nice stay (being free made it that bit better!). I would recommend the hotel if you get a good deal. In the summer months it would be ideal for sightseeing in the morning then coming back and using the pool in the afternoon. April we found was a lovely month as it was warm, not hot but sunny and hardly any queues.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ignace_borde
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable rooms, enjoyable atmosphere, great pianoplayer in the bar that invites for a cosy drink at any time. Some improvement topics : I could not bridge the whole week with only one shoe shine spunge (no replacements), and with only a small washing towel on the first day. A lot was compensated by the pleasant surprise at the occasion of my birthday, though ! They call this "customer intimicy"... Thanks !

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay in ROME”
Reviews.Author: niksagg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the very first day of our honeymoon trip. We went to various place after this like Florence, Venice, Paris etc and had stayed in best of hotels but the hospitality we had in this hotel was amazing. People say its little far from main town but its actually not. Good connectivity of buses. You can travel free in buses till no one catches you....haha...well we travelled free all 4 days...lol...so its a very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “The Crown Plaza made our stay memorable.”
Reviews.Author: parvez81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crown Plaza St Peters for 4 nights with my partner. It was a romantic getaway for us and we were also celebrating our birthdays.   The General gave us a bottle of champagne and cookies in the room on both my birthday day and also the same was given to my partner on her birthday day. I found this gesture to very nice from the management.  From breakfast to dinner almost all the staff were aware of our special day and this made us feel very special.   The hotel itself is located in a very quiet and safe area. You can walk from the hotel to go to the Vatican City or you can also take the free shuttle service. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle service from Hotel to Rome City and from Rome City back to the hotel. The bus is very comfortable, clean and air conditioning. The hotel has also an airport shuttle service which I will highly recommend to take. I did the mistake to get to the hotel on my own when I arrived in Rome and we had lots of problems on our way. we did not know if the hotel had a shuttle service from the airport but on our way back we use the shuttle service which cost 12 euros person. That is Hotel and straight to airport without any hassle to take the metro etc and metro will cost you more anyway.   Bar:   The bar lounge is very nice, modern and relaxing atmosphere and staff seem to be very knowledgeable and caring. The bar staff had a very positive CAN DO attitude. There is a pianist who plays in the bar lounge area every evening.   Breakfast:   It’s a full English breakfast at 18 euros per person. Its really nice and you have lots to choose from. On the buffet they have only scramble eggs but you can also ask your waiter for either fried eggs or omelette. They also have sparkling wine included in the breakfast but we did not take any.   Lunch:   We were having lunch everyday in the city so cannot tell but I guess it must be good.   Dinner:   We ate in the buffet restaurant every night and it was delicious. Every night they had  different soups and the main course as well were a different one every night. The buffet is at 25 euros per person and its really worth the price.   Room:   Our room was on the 4th floor and was overlooking the car park. There was a spacious balcony and the room was always clean. The bed was massive and very comfortable. Unfortunately my girlfriend found the pillow to be too soft but I guess we could have asked for a different type of pillow. You have complimentary tea / coffee facilities in the room and also bottles of water which I found to be very convenient. There is a flat screen hanging on the wall and you get numerous channels for free including sky sports 1 and sky sports 2.   Internet:   Internet is chargeable but just to let you know that there is a computer next to the elevator on the ground floor with free internet access. so feel free to browse and reconfirm your   On a special note I would like to thank (Mohammed or Ali). I am not sure of the name but he works at the reception at night. He was our first contact with the hotel staff and we met him about 20 minutes away from the hotel. It was on our arrival day and we were lost on our way to the hotel and thankfully we met on the road him as he was on his way to work. He was very nice and even help my partner with her bag. He has a great CAN DO ATTIUDE and for me he has done the extra mile. Thank you again for your help that night.   Also, everyone I have interacted with at the reception and restaurant were very polite and professional. The hotel staff also speaks different languages.   To conclude the Crown Plaza St Peters was one of the best hotel we ever stayed and will recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne-Plaza was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: wilson_dina
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome for the first time in March with 2 really good friends for my 40th Birthday. I was pleasantly surprised to enter my room (which was not that expensiv) and find a generous and beautifully decorated room and bathroom- with a private balcony. In addition, as a surprise my friends had asked the hotel to do something special and within 10 minutes of entering the room a gorgeous tirimisu and a bottle of champagne was delivered for us to celebrate coming to Rome for my birthday! The hotel has a courtesy bus which is free to guests and taxi's are available to take you wherever you need to. The hotel is located on lovely grounds and you can relax without all of the hustle and bustle of the city centre after a busy day of shopping and site seeing. There are 2 restaurants in the hotel and my room came with a free breakfast which was not only convenient; but the hotel provided quite a bit of variety as well. The gym was free and I made use of it at least twice during my 4 day stay (and it was not crowded). Special thank you to Manager Mr Davide Grille who was an absolutely fantastic host and should be proud of the great service his staff provided during my stay! You would not be disappointed if you decided to stay at the Crowne Plaza St Peter's if you decide to visit the lovely Roma! Dina Wilson, Bermuda

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: denandearl
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Rome. The rooms are immaculitly clean, the breakfast was superb and a wide variety to choose from, the staff are so friendly and polite and alway's with a smile. The bus service from the hotel to St peters is fantastic and alway's on time. It was my Partners birthday that weekend, we did'nt tell the hotel this, but when we returned back from a day's outing we found a bottle of champange on ice and chocolates waiting for us in our room, a wonderful touch by the General Manager we thought. Can't wait to go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel with friendly efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: remipuri
Reviews.Content: as tour director have stayed in 100s of hotels worldwide but the experience with this hotel was very satisfying. at 10am room keys for 70 people were ready when check in time is 3pm. conference went off without a hitch thanks to personal attention by the banquet staff. Breakfast is a huge delicious spread. location is very close to st peters,vatican,and hotel has a free pick up and drop several times a day to historic places and the airport. shopping streets are very closeby and hotel has a taxi stand in the compound itself what more could a tourist or business traveller ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Four days of happy blissful stay”
Reviews.Author: sanamis
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza turned out to be a very decent hotel which combined comfort and class. We were part of a large group of Indians who had gone to participate in a seminar and also for sightseeing in Rome. The efficiency of the hotel was manifest right from the point of first contact when each one of us was handed over a room key immediately on entry, without having to wait for the formal paper work (which were not neglected either). We checked in on the forenoon of 16th February and stayed on till the morning of 20th February , though some of us left a day earlier.There was all round satisfaction about services of the hotel. The concierge especially was very helpful in guiding us about various matters , whenever we contacted. We stayed in Room # 232 , a delightful room with a wonderful view of the hotel's garden area.Temperature outside was freezing to the unaccustomed Indian skin but the hotel's central heating system kept the interiors warm and comfortable. We had a conference in the same hotel. The venue was 'Constantino' ; a meeting hall below the lobby level which was well furnished and decent. Food was very good and breakfast spead was generous everyday. Even the best of facilities come with some aberrations and Crowne Plaza was no exception.Here is a list of some things which were not right. One of our colleagues said he lost some cash in the room . We had our own doubts about this and thought he would have lost it somewhere outside but not in hotel room. He insisted it was in the room.The hotel ofcourse had provided safe deposit lockers in every room which worked fine.But loss of cash (or anything for that matter) inside the hotel room ; even if it was kept somewhere outside the locker ,is a bad thing , if it actually happened. The lifts were only at oneside of the long corridor. Guests staying in rooms on the extreme other side (# 201 , 202 etc.) had to walk quite a distance to reach the lifts. Power went off in our room (and some other rooms on second floor) for sometime one morning. Whenever such a thing happens in any hotel , the supply is restored within seconds from an alternate source. Not here. We were without power for about ten minutes. The housekeeping phone sometimes went unresponded. By and large , the stay in this hotel was rejuvenating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, nice rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kelpl11
Reviews.Content: My wife an I with 5 other couples spent 3 nights here and we enjoyed our stay very much

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: MorgunnLucas_OH
Reviews.Content: Spent six delightful nights. Not in city center, so very quiet. Free shuttle (morning Vatican, afternoon Piazza Venezia) or public bus just outside entrance (tickets sold at front desk). Excellent piano bar. Large clean room with fluffy towels and lovely bed. Hotel meals quite pricey, but delicious restaurant next door and others within walking distance (ask at front desk). Helpful staff. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “displaced from city center, but OK”
Reviews.Author: drecus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located outside of the city center of Rome, and that is its biggest flaw. Otherwise, it is OK. The staff at the reception is friendly, as are the maids. The room is spacious, the bed and the pillows are perfect. Cleanliness is pretty good. The bathroom is a bit outdated, as is the room interior. They need redesigning. There was a big terrace in my room, which was nice to sit and rest. The TV has a medium-quality selection of programmes, and if you want to watch a blockbuster movie, you have to pay way too much for that (some 23 EUR). The TV is flat-screen, but relatively small. The heater in the room can be used for heating in the evening, during the night and in the morning, but it blows cold air during the day. In the closet is an iron and ironing board, which I find very practical, and was a pleasant surprise. The breakfast was pretty good, served from 6:== AM to 11:00AM, and on weekends till 11:30AM. I find this excellent, because I enjoy a very early breakfast, and this is a rarity in hotels, usually in other places it is served at 7 or 7:30AM till 10:00AM, so this i a big plus for this hotel. The location is partly compensated by a courtesy hotel bus to the center of the town which drives you from 8:00 til the noon, every hour, to and from Vatican, and from 4:00PM to 9:00PM to and from the city center (via delle boteghe oscure No 16). This is a great way to go to the city without additional expences for the taxi service. There is also a bus to Fiumicino airport, but only once daily, leaves at 7:15AM every day. If this is not a good time for you to go t the airport, you can use an official taxi (the white car) and get to the airport ifor 40EUR. When you get to the airport and want to get to this hotel, use only the white taxies, and agree on the price in advence (also possible for 40EUR), because some other driver-services can take you 70-110EUR, and even more. All in all, a good hotel, I would stay in it again the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected and definately far from the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LilTink13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located way too far away from the main attractions - even the Vatican! It's not within walking distance to anything... which made our stay here a bit disappointing. We ended up having a go at the bus but after the frontdesk people gave us the wrong route number/bus to hop onto, we ended up having to cab it. Although it may have been an honest mistake... They had free internet downstairs in their lobby area which was a huge plus and definately used. The breakfast that came with our booking was delicious- the pool area, bar, and all dining facilities were great. They have tons of cabs at the ready to take you wherever you want to go which was greatly appreciated - you simply push a button! The room was fairly clean, it was billed as a non-smoking room however we noticed several ashtrays strewn about the room. I was disappointed at the hotel and room pictures and the actual room itself, definately not the same! However, it was clean, the bed was decent, and the bathroom was useful. We got decent sleep and our luggage was taken for our cruise with no problems in the morning. The main fuss: if you are going to check out JUST the Vatican - then sure, stay here. But if you want to see the heart of Rome, stay somewhere else... it's just TOO far away!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience from begining to end”
Reviews.Author: carly802
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic expereince at the Crowne Plaza Rome, the staff were extremely helpful and did not make you feel a fool for not being able to speak the local language. The food in the restaurant was lovely and the hotel in general is kept to a good standard. The hotel offers a free shuttle into Rome itself which saved on taxis, just another great perk. I would like to go back in the summer to expereince the outdoor pool! Fantastic weekend made faultless by the CP Rome - thank you

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a short or long break managed by a great team!”
Reviews.Author: kikinovela
Reviews.Content: I came to Rome to spend the new year with my partner and we stayed at the Crown Plaza St Peter's for 8 days. We had an incredible time there. The hotel is situated close to the Vatican and it is a good place to start your visit of Rome. There is a free Shuttle bus leaving from the Hotel regularly which takes you to the Vatican in 15 minutes. From the Vatican you can then reach most of Rome's landmarks by foot. At the end of your visits you can get the Shuttle bus back from the pick up place. The pick up place is siutated in the cenTre not too far from the Coliseum. This service is very handy and it makes it very easy to plan your days, and it is free! It was very nice to be back at the Hotel after a day of visits and sightseeing. There, we could relax and rest. There is a spa with all the amenities, an indoor pool, sauna, jaccuzzi, gym, massages... Our room was overlooking the outdoor swimming pool which is amazing during summer time. It is surrounded by Pine trees. The Hotel restaurant serves very good italian food a la carte or Buffet. The service is outstanding and the staff is always very polite and helpful. The morning breakfast was a real treat ! There's food for every tastes and the staff is very efficient and friendly. The rooms are very clean and big. The beds are urge and sooo confortable! Our room was overlooking the pool which was very nice. We love the soaps and shower gel in the bathroom. The Crown Plaza is a great Hotel with a great team which will make sure your stay is enjoyable.Everyone is very friendly and helpful. I really recommend this Hotel for a short or longer break. It is the third time that we are staying there and we absolutely love it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and not too far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: AidanDemha
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean and the people were friendly and helpful. The hotel does provide a shuttle to take you to the city center (in the afternoon) and the vatican (in the morning). The pick up locations are a bit tricky to find. The shuttle itself is pretty nice and they run on time. We were waiting inside because it was cold out and they left without us! So, it's best to wait outside. The rooms were nice and clean and recently renovated. The bathrooms were kind of out dated but they were clean. The resturant was horrible and the room service was as well. They are way overpriced and the food is not worth it at all. We couldnt even eat one of the meals we ordered. It is best to eat in the city and then come back to the hotel. I think the majority of people that stay here are business travelers. Overall it was nice and quiet and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoVenturi
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel many times and the last one was at the beginning of january 2011. Everytime I am so glad to be back here and I consider this hotel as my second house. The beds are just amazing and so is the morning breakfast! Staff are extremely welcoming and helpful but never invasive. The SPA is just great and the staff there is highly professional: you should definitely go for some treatments there. Shuttle to St Peter's and to the city centre is just so efficient and convenient. I would strongly strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: m0ec
Reviews.Content: The hotel has large rooms. The rooms look good but the bathrooms are very dated and look completely out of place. The hotel is located a little out of Rome central and is a little difficult or inconvenient to get into and out of central Rome. A shuttle is supplied free from the hotel or you may get a bus or taxi from outside the hotel. I redeemed points to stay in this hotel. If I had paid, I would rather stay in central Rome or close to a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “give it a try”
Reviews.Author: mimi089
Reviews.Content: stayed here from 21/1/11 - 24/1/11, I had read a few mixed reviews but in all honesty we found it to be fine. The staff were helpful and pleasant, all things considered a good place to stay. Ok a bit dated and tired looking, however our room was clean the bed comfy, my only quibble was the room was a bit cold,we had breakfast each day, which was good value . Excellent public transport from outside the hotel. In my opinion the shuttle bus could serve both vatican and city centre on each trip and it could run all day. each trip

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tagliarihelbling
Reviews.Content: Good price, good service, good rooms. The hotel is not close to the city center or to the Vatican, but there is a regular and free charte bus for both sites.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the distance from the centre, other factors more than made this a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sohorandies
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel choice for many reasons. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms were lovely, spacious and very comfortable (especially the beds which were lovely). The food at breakfast was delicious with lots of choice and the spa was a real treat. I'm very grateful for the shuttle (and exceptionally good public transport) otherwise this hotel would have been a bit too far out. To give balance to the praise, I felt that the corridors to the bedrooms were out of date and smelt musty. If it had been left to me I would have turned around and walked away from the hotel before seeing the room on the strength of this. Fortunately my partner perservered and i'm glad he did. The room was lovely with lots of space, storage, comfort and a lovely balcony overlooking the grounds. I was not overly keen on the bathroom (again it was outdated and had some work to be completed, but very adequate) and there appeared to be a problem the hotel was trying to overcome with ants, however they did appear to be on top of the problem. I hope I have given a balanced view and would recommend (and indeed stay again at) this hotel, but it is worth weighing up the location if you have children or do not have confidence to travel.

Reviews.Title: “pick another hotel”
Reviews.Author: meglord
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there were dead ants all over our room, even in the bed. We left for a couple hours and returned to find live ants all over the room. The beds are horribly uncomfortable and the bathrooms are very dirty. We were moved to another room which has yet to have warm water. We have tried what they suggested and have showered at different times of the day which has not helped. We are trying to move to another hotel and they won't let us without losing the points we used to book the room. The hotel is located a good distance from town and even though we are good travelers and have no issue taking the bus system or metro we find it very difficult to go back and forth to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “MERAVIGLIOSO!”
Reviews.Author: Lafuma
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 wonderful days in Rome in this excellent Hotel. I would go back now! Nice and quiet room, clean, spaciuos, with balcony and we also had a nice garden view.. Beds are amazing...I never slept so good in my own one!! Good american breakfast, very nice staff and even if it is a shuttle away from Vatican City and the center of all, it is a very good deal. Actually the shuttle service is very accurate and always on perfect time. The driver Stefano mervellous, nice and kind of a tguide himself. The price is very good for such a category of hotel in a city like Rome. But the spa is the best! Give yourself some time for the spa...afetr walking and walking it is the best present you can give to yourself! The restaurant of the Hotel offers local specialities, last night we were there there were some personality form the Vatican...so it must be popular also locally.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Beave8920
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a travel group for two nites. The hotel was very nice and had all the amenities. The rooms were nice size by european standards and very clean. Nice lounge and resturant on site. Staff was friendly and accomidating. This location is about 15 minutes to central Rome - near all the sites. This hotel would be the equilivant of a 4 star hotel in the states.

Reviews.Title: “Rome - It's got to be done”
Reviews.Author: Mazza203
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff from check in thru to check out were great. Loved the room upgrade! Beds comfy and loved the Sleep Kit. Quiet location. Free bus from hotel (as it is a bit out of the way) to Vatican during the day and to the City Centre during the evening. Breakfast good - good choice and hot and tasty

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Room!”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Candler
Reviews.Content: We chose the Crowne Plaza Rome St. Peter's after a recommendation from a friend and I have to say we were not disappointed. We were visiting for our anniversary which we mentioned when we booked our Room! We were extremely happy with the room and service we received. The first night we had some complimentary wine and chocolates delivered to our door which went down very well (and won me some brownie points!) The room itself was excellent and the bed is the largest I have ever slept in (see photos below!) There is a handy complimentary bus which is laid on free of charge and is operated on a first-come first-served basis. If its full (or you miss it as we did a couple of time!) there are also local buses that can take you into Rome's centre which are really cheap - ask at reception and they will point you in the right direction! I have to say that we were treated very well indeed and couldn't fault the Staff, Service or Room. If its a special occasion I would certainly recommend this Hotel, and don't forget to mention it upon booking!

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive!”
Reviews.Author: thetraveller089
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay, although I would not write home about it. The reception staff were uninterested in being helpful and generally the eye for detail should be better. The bellboy was surly and the room keys never worked so I was always at reception trying to get another one. Whilst the hotel is not that central, this should not have been a problem as the hotel provides a complimenrary bus service. However, it does not run that regularly and picks-up from a less than central (or easy to get to) street. The buffet restaurant was very nice, particularly for the first night if you arrive late. I felt very disappointed with the hotel, as for the price you just don't get value for money. I would expect free wifi and a warmer welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: zoetalbot
Reviews.Content: Sorry Crowne Plaza but I have to write this. Stayed here from 24th-27th Oct based on the reviews read and the service we have received from other Crowne Plaza's. We were checked in by a miserable man at reception who couldnt even muster a smile and didnt tell us anything about the hotel/facilities. The corridor smelt on floor 3 by the service room of vinegar?? The decor in the corridor was dark drab and dated.The room itself was ok size wise but the bathroom was dated and there was enough wardrobe space for 1 person (there were 4 of us) so for the 4 days we were there all of our clothes were draped over the furniture. The patio door did not lock and was left open by the cleaner on our 2nd day!! The indoor pool is NOT open to children (our children were very upset) and we met 3 other families trying to get in with there children at the same time-the outdoor pool was shut (i do have to add that we had a message the second day saying our children could use the pool between 4pm and 6pm on that day-we got back to the hotel at 9pm!! The courtesy bus get very busy so make sure you are outside at least 20 mins before-we were asked by the driver to take our childrens (age 4 and 7) seat belts off and sit them on our laps-I dont think so!! Its was our 10th wedding anniversary-i didnt receive any champagne or good service like the other reviews???? Overall this hotel is very over rated and I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, great hotel for birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: Redlilley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Rome for my 40th birthday. The Crowne Plaza certainly made me feel special with a surprise delivery of champagne (compliments of the general manager) on my actual birthday, lovely. The hotel itself is a little out of Rome but about 10mins walk to Cornelia train station. The trains are really user friendly and very cheap making Rome easily accessible. the buses also stop immediately outside. Crowne Plaza, St Peters is extremely well kept and very clean. Our room was large and quiet. the hotel as a great pool and fitness faciliites, two good restaurants and a sociable bar in the front entrance. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. I would really recommend it as a great place to stay in Rome. Some general tips for Rome. Take the tour at The Vatican museum and the Sistine Chapel its about 20-25 euro's each plus the entrance fee of 15euros's. If you can book online before you get there as it saves you have to queue. Do the tour of the Coloseum and Palantine Hill, its amazing and the guides really bring it to life - we picked up a tour when we got off the tube, which was easy and well worth doing. Pre-book Villa Borghese, before you arrive - truly beautiful. Visit the Pantheon, we didn't need a guide it was self explanitory. Eat at The Royal restaurant opposite the Coloseum, good food, reasonably priced. Eat at Gianni's restaurant if you can find it, near the rive, great traditional pasta. Eat ice-cream near the exit to the Sistine Chapel, it's 5euro's each but absolutely enormous and delicious. Take an umbrella. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “If it's your Birthday make sure you stay here, Wonderful place.”
Reviews.Author: Monster927
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on an Insight Vacation Tour the hotel was their choice. We checked in on Sunday and Monday was my 60th Birthday. There was a knock at the door around 4pm, It was room service; I told them I did not order and thing. He told me it was compliments of the Management, when I opened the door he had a bottle of Champagne and a plate of Italian cookies! I thanked him and thought the tour director had something to do with it. When I asked her, she said, "No I had nothing to do with it". The next morning I went to the front desk & thanked them for making me feel special, they told me "birthdays are special". What a Wonderful Place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Auslas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to starting an Insight Tour. We found the hotel bus to the city, which dropped off at St Peters in the a.m and closer to the Vittorio & Emmanuel museum in the p.m, very useful. The bus is first come basis, so be early to the waiting areas. The local shopping area was a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel, which we found to be an acceptable distance. Our room was a good size, very clean and the beds very comfortable. The breakfast choices were excellent. We ate in the hotel restaurant twice and thought the meals were overpriced compared to restaurants in the city. However we had chosen to eat there for convenience and we got what we paid for. Reception and restaurant staff were very helpful ,and luckily for us, their english was much better than our italian. We would certainly recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alwaysreadyfortravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. We had a large room with a balcony. There was a couch, chairs and plenty of room to relax. The indoor pool was a very relaxing. The water was warm and there was even a fireplace on the pool deck. We had breakfast at their restaurant and it was very good. There is even a small bar in the lobby that had live music on Sat. night. You'll need to take a bus or taxi to get to the main Rome attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Business benchmark”
Reviews.Author: Mauro_Vedo
Reviews.Content: I've always been to St. Peter Hotel when in Rome for business but from now on I think I'll stay here with my wife and kids whenever I'm in Rome for leisure. It's not the "real Italian deal" in terms of experience, it's a business Hotel, lacking the rustic touch but if you're in Rome and are looking for a clean, large room, quiet, great breakfast, nicely located hotel this is the deal. It has a nice Spa, tennis courts, gym, bar, restaurant and buffet plus many more amenities. It's not downtown but I've found the free Shuttle Bus very convenient and handy. It would cost you half the price than downtown Hotels and it comes with many more amenities, the only big downside is that being a bit off-center it doesn't make it the perfect stop for going back and forth from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “CROWN PLAZA - SIMPLY SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: DAVID-FIRENZE
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend in Rome at the Crown Plaza Rome St. Peter's. I had a fabulous stay. I was there for business but the entire staff made me feel like i was in vacation. Friendly, polite, and warm attention by staff upon check in was very noticeable. Room was luxurious and simply beautiful. Friendly and professional staff made our stay as if it was my home. Very comfortable linen and pillows were divine. Very nice a rich breakfast buffet, and great SPA. Simply superb, best we’ve ever had in ROME

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: sibby
Reviews.Content: Very impressed by friendliness and courtesy of all the staff. Every effort was made to get the extra guests into Rome each morning if the 1st coach was full. Not sure they can always offer that, but perhaps with quite a few families in August, they brought out the 2nd smaller coach, so the remaining guests weren't left stranded. Rooms very comfortable, beds amazing. One thing worth considering if you visit in August - the floor-standing air conditioning units seemed old and not really up to the job! We were lucky that the week we were there, towards the end of August, was not unbearably hot, but we still ended up having to leave the balcony door open each night, to keep the room tolerable. We were at the front of the hotel (North West facing) and the room was just far enough back from the road not to be too aware of the traffic but we could still catch it in the bachground. The back of the hotel - the rooms facing the pool in their main picture, would have been a lot quieter, but as they faced East/South and got the sun all day they would have been impossible to cool down, even at night, so we opted not to change rooms. Breakfast selection quite good, pity the coffee was always cold. We eventually found the self service coffee machine tucked away in the dining room, which dispersed hot coffee, so problem solved. They ran out of the most popular breakfast rolls very early on (each day) and had none left to replenish the baskets. Breakfast room seemed a bit understaffed for August and tables took ages to clear at peak times. All in all, we welcomed the chance to get out of Rome each evening after a day sightseeing and to have a cool drink on the balcony at sunset. Would stay again, but would reluctantly have to consider carefully if it were during the hot months.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Mostermo
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth time at the Crowne Plaza St Peter's and once again we know why we keep going back to this hotel every time we visit Rome. The quality of the rooms and the service is second to none. Beautitful outside space, well maintained gardens and stunning pool and spa facilities. Incredibly friendly staff who really can't do enough to make your stay hassle free. Great courtesy bus service into the City which is a 10-15 minute journey depending on traffic. We enjoy being able to relax after a day in Rome and this is the perfect spot, not too close to the City's hustle and bustle, but not too far away either. Drinks are a little pricey but the champagne and oysters at 8 euro per person is fantastic value for money. We don't eat in the restaurant as a rule but have heard very good reports. We can definitely recommend Arturo's restaurant which is just at the end of the driveway to the Hotel - but warned though Saturday nights can be very busy and you may wait a very long time to be served. We will definitely be back to the Crown Plaza St Peter's - well done IC Hotels and all the staff at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suburban hotel with downtown shuttle”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugVA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good option for keeping down the price of a Roman holiday. Located in pleasant suburbia, the Holiday Inn Crowne Plaza is large and comfortable with responsive, service-oriented staff. Rooms are nicely remodeled with a modern touch. We said "no thank you" to the buffet breakfast, which lowered the rate and allowed us to sample local cuisine. Line up early for the free shuttle that only runs to St. Peter's and the Vatican in the morning and to downtown Rome in the afternoon. (We heard that people fight over seats for the ride to the airport, so we took a taxi at a more convenient time.) There are various transportation options--public bus, metro. See the concierge. For dining out, walk to the Gustosando Restaurant, which is about a 10-20 minute walk in the direction of the subway/metro. It was recommended by the Front Desk staff as a good Italian restaurant with almost exclusively local patrons. The food there was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely peaceful haven”
Reviews.Author: daihi
Reviews.Content: visited ths hotel late August. found the atmosphere very relaxed.excellent pool area,loungers available any time we went, saw staff freeing up loungers to cater for people. spa area was excellent and quiet. great place to chill out, hardly anyone using the indoor pool. Breakfast buffet had a plentiful supply of items,even late on. fresh squeezed juices, cereals,breads,fried items, even my kids could find enough to please them.i found the Bars and Restuarants a little pricey.we found a gem of a bar around the corner to the left of the hotel entrance. Panin Arte had a wide selection of reasonably priced sandwiches, salads and drinks with friendly service. the hotels location was not a problem nice and quiet, comfortable rooms and Rome easily accessible by either the complimentary shuttle or frequent buses passig the hotel. bus tickets are available at reception and bus stop to right of the entrance. when i return to Rome i will go to crowne plaza first choice.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic city centre hotel with a warm and friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: KiriSG
Reviews.Content: As a parent of two young children I recommend the Crowne Plaza Rome St Peters without hesitation. The staff made sure we received a warm a freindly welcome and were highly attentive to our needs - all of them - throughout our stay. The reception, bar area and restaurants are all well maintained and are light, airy and roomy. The food in the restaurant was very good and the prices sensible. The room we had was spacious, extremely well equipped and above all else clean. The bathroom was a great size and again offered every convenience I needed. The Swimming Pool is in the beautifully maintained lush green gardens behind the hotel with again very attentive, efficient and friendly smiling staff on hand. There is a lifeguard constabtly on duty which meant I could relax whilst my daugthers played in both the main pool and the shallow splash pool safely. The hotel is convenient for the city centre and the metro is but a short walk away. Ask at reception though and they'll tell you about their shuttle service into the heart of the city. Our Roman Holiday was made even more relaxing and enjoyable because we stayed at this hotel. I am happy to recommend it 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for an easy comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Martin191280
Reviews.Content: Originally booked through an agent as we wanted a hotel within our modest price range. Couldn't have been more delighted. Room was clean and well equipped. Breakfast was so good we never needed to eat again all day. Staff were friendly and helpful. There is on site transport into the city centre if you need it but if not the bus/metro is near by. The on site facilities were also excellent so we were able to relax each night after a hard days sight seeing. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRSFATTYBelfast
Reviews.Content: hotel wonderful. a bit out of the city bus just a bus ride or tube stop. great indoor spa and pool no children allowed to indoor pool so very peaceful room great size with large balcony overlooking outdoor pool food fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou Thankyou”
Reviews.Author: bow57
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled around Europe with Globus. We stayed in 14 different hotels on the trip, and I would have to say that the Crowne Plaza St Peter’s was one of the best. The rooms where as advertised on the net- spacious, modern and 4 star. The hotel made us feel very relaxed, which is not always the case when you are part of a bus tour. They added the little extras that made us feel very welcome. The staff in the restaurant and the hotel where exceptional. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base to relax and enjoy the sights that Rome has to offer”
Reviews.Author: jamesclgh
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in numerous Intercontinental hotels (Crown Plaza, Holiday Inns and Express) as part of business travel in the UK, my high expectations were definitely met with friendly staff, a good standard of cuisine, and space to relax and enjoy the sun. Having booked our week long stay through the company website I'd choicen the family rate, which included Bed and breakfast, free kids meals from the childrens menu, internet access and pay tv). On arriving at the hotel prior to usual check-in we were offered a good clean room on the front of the hotel. After a few days in the heat (30-34C) it was definitely a benefit having the cool morning balcony. I would agree that the bathrooms are small but clean and functional. We avoided using the TV to begin with but the latest kids movies available they were great for a few hours when too hot outside. The restaurant food was of good standard and the buffet offered good value with a wide selection of italian and roman dishes which was complemented by a themed menu Wed-Sat one week a month. Tex Mex in our case, included an enormous T Bone which another couple were enjoying. My only concern was the kids menu was a bit limited for a full week. (Just a quick note on eating in central Rome, the quality did vary and most cases the better restaurants are actually more expensive than the hotel but the pizzerias are good value. Always check your bill as I found the wrong value for a dish was quoted and inflated the price, maybe an accident once but twice was a bit odd. Queried and resolved immediately both times with apologises). If you don't like cats/birds eat inside, as the local felines or pigeons are looking for scraps. The Breakfast buffet service was well managed and provided a good spread catering for all tastes, american and continental. We did find some problem with getting hot water for tea on a couple of occasions, just ask again. Obviously the hotel is not in the centre but its not far away. The free hotel coach(es) were first come first served, running regularly in the morning and evening. I didn't actually see anyone miss out though as if demand increased they had a couple of coaches. There was a bus service at the entrance to the hotel with the metro not far but we didn't need to use them. (note though that metro is 1 euro each, <10 yrs are free). Taxis back from the centre were only 12-14 euros and not as bad as expected from comments I had read. The outside pool was great and surprisingly deep, 6ft to 12ft. The seperate childrens pool was also clean, with water temperatures a refreshing break from the heat. We didn't use the spa so can't comment. On our last day the 1960 italian olympic team were having their 50th anniversary reunion in the hotel. The gold medal water polo team posed for a film crew. In most cases the staff were good speakers of English and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Finally the taxis to and from the airport were both reasonably priced as there is a fixed city rate of 40 euro currently. There were 4 pcs which could be used in the lobby if internet access was needed at an extra cost but I did notice that some of the machines were not disconnected from customers using them, so be careful about accessing your secure accounts unless you log off probably. I didn't try using a laptop but similar to the paytv access they might be a bit slow. As a whole I thought the hotel was good value for money but the one expensive item seemed to be the soft drinks, compared to local shop prices they were 4 times the price. Obviously this isn't any different from a hotel in the UK but something to look out for, personally if hotels didn't try to rake margins on these areas they would have less people staying in their rooms after purchasing from the supermarket and increasing there income in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “At a distance”
Reviews.Author: fufty
Reviews.Content: After 3 nights at The Colonna Palace in central Rome ( see separate review ) we moved here for 4 nts, as we were trying to accomodate our 18 yr old son who was seeing Rome for the first time, and felt he would be ready to leave the city centre and chill by the pool. As Priority Club members We booked on the ICC site and took the package which included unlimited internet etc. - a great bonus for entertaining teenagers! The first room we were given was quite small and hadn't nearly enough storage space for 3. We asked for something else and were given a two-roomed suite with furnished terrace and two bathrooms - fantastic! Breakfast here is worth getting up for - everything from cava to cake! Lovely FRESH fruit, FRESH coffee and the full cooked monty. The hostess and staff are all lovely and you can linger as long as you want. I had read previous reviews about the lack of sun-loungers, so made sure I was down early to claim some. This is a problem which could be easily resolved as there is plenty of garden space around. We had lunch on arriving at the pool bar, which was lovely - not cheap, but hey, this is Rome and nothing's cheap!! After that we never needed lunch a the breakfasts were so good. Don't be fooled by the name of the hotel - St. Peter's is a pilgramage away! Some reviewers said they walked it to the city centre but they must have brought hiking boots! The courtesy bus is a must. We used it one morning for St. Peter's and every night for the city centre. To be sure of a seat be down 15 mins before departure. We always used a taxi back - anything between 13 - 15 Euro. There is a local area with a few shops and a restaurant. On exiting the gates turn left then left again on the bend. The front desk were extremely helpful. We had trouble printing boarding passes and they couldn't have done more. A really enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, very friendly staff, nice rooms, perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Sybil17
Reviews.Content: Maybe a few km from the centre, but easy to reach with taxi or minibus from the hotel. The staff was friendly, the food was nice, the rooms were large and clean, the beds are soft... Very nice stay !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff - quiet location - 15 Euro taxi ride”
Reviews.Author: TheHolidayHopper
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a short break to Rome, wow what a city - so much to see and do - take some comfy shoes! Stayed at the crowne plaza as Rome is noisy - This hotel is set in the outskirts of town (south west of centre) it has a good shuttle bus service (free of charge) which runs every hour, if you didn't want to use the bus service there are bus stops outside the hotel and an on site small taxi rank. The taxi's typically charge you about 15 Euros to get to or from town. The staff are really helpful and couldn't do enough. Most rooms have safe's in them and the kingsize bed was so comfy. The hotel is a little dated and the corridors were darkly painted. but cleaniness wasn't as bad as some of the other reviews made out. Breakfast was a little repetative with no beans for a fried breakfast! Overall was nice and pleasant. For the perfect start to your Rome break, exit the hotel and turn right, walk along Via Aurelia and make your way to town in the park - it is so pretty!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money "Dolce Vita" style in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: Moore38
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has an unbeatable good value for money, brilliant service and extremely friendly and attentive staff. They made me feel welcomed and everybody was very professional. The rooms were of a good size and very clean. The beds were extremely comfortable and had a good night sleep. Was very pleasantly surprised by the breakfast buffet, fresh ingredients, and as I have a special diet requirement I was very pleased to find items I could eat, such as dairy or gluten free. The staff was very polite. It might not be the closest hotel to the centre but who cares when you are in a walking distance to a metro station and you have the hotel shuttle to and from the centre available. Definitevily would recommended it as a place to stay when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool , large rooms but needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: Sexyjen27
Reviews.Content: We our spent our first two nights at this property and found the rooms to be very large , with comfortable beds and nice size bathroom. The pool was excellent but was wait was horrible at the pool side bar and not enough lounge chairs to for everyone. On the plus side they have a wonderful bar and fantastic piano player nightly.. the location was also a plus with a convenient shuttle. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable but hard to get to”
Reviews.Author: pjvieira
Reviews.Content: During our last spring break vacation, we went to Rome and stayed at the Crowne Plaza, on Via Aurelia Antica. The good: The hotel was decently priced, and reasonably appointed. Comfortable, clean beds. The rooms were not new, but were in good condition. The staff spoke English and were, at least most of them, very helpful. When we checked in, we were offered a "pay in advance breakfast" option, which we refused, since we wanted to venture out and try local breakfast fare. That quickly proved to be a mistake. Most of the places to eat breakfast were very far from the hotel. Not only that, but they offered the standard Italian options of a pastry and a cappuccino. Our young kids, used to a bigger, American-style breakfast, felt sick after eating that much sugar first thing in the morning. We wen back to the hotel and asked if we could still buy the breakfast option and they accommodated us. VERY expensive, but also very good. The bad: The worst internet service I have experienced in any hotel in the last 10 years. Not kidding. In the last 10 years. Bad services 10 years ago were still better than this. If you plan on using the service to do anything other than checking your text emails, forget about it. We had about 100 pics we wanted to upload to share with family. It took.... 43 hours to get it done!!!! Two days. the hotel is far from everything. Sure you can walk to a subway station. Not close, but you can walk. However, that is a treacherous walk. There is no real sidewalk, and you'd be walking extremely close to one of the most dangerous traffic on Earth. We tried a couple of times only to almost be decapitated by a scooter's rear view mirror. Not worth taking the risk. The hotel, apparently, understands that and provides a regularly scheduled shuttle that takes you downtown, and also picks you up. If you don't mind being on their schedule, it is a fantastic service. If you want to be in the middle of it all, you should probably consider a different hotel. All in all, this was a very good place, especially with a family. Large rooms, good service, clean environment. It is also very, very quiet at night. Far from the city, but the shuttle service is very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: THREOslo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has what I would call "Rome-syndrome" - noone cares if the standard is poorer that one should expect from a 4-star hotel. There will always be plenty of tourists visiting Rome, so they don`t seem to care whether the tourist are happy or not. The hotel is a dark, a bit smelly, worn out and far away from the centre of town. Shuttle bus is OK. We used it and had no problems with it. In the morning it takes you to the Vatican. In the afternoon you can visit the historical part of Rome. It saves you about 20 euro by taxi each way. The service was excellent - both room service, reception and the transport to the airport. Food and drink prices are ridiculously high, quality- the exact opposite. Swimming pool is nice and clean. Unfortunately there is onyy about 20-30 sunbeds for a really big hotel ... The so called business centre is tiny, has a computer and printer. Always busy. I don`t think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service. Would NEVER come back!”
Reviews.Author: Calvin_Anna
Reviews.Content: Where do i begin!!! From never functioning internet that would bounce you out every 10 minutes and one day required 4 calls in order to get a new code and report a problem to only be told "WE NEVER HAVE THESE ISSUES" and it never got fixed. To norrible service at the reception desk and restaurant and bars where you are blatantly ignored and no one even lets you finish the sentence before walking away. The best though: the day prior to our arrival we stopped at the desk to book a taxi for the next morning. Response":" You should get up earlier and walk to the corner and you should have any issues getting a cab!" REALLY?!?!?! Yeap - really, that was the top of the pop for me, and if not for severelly discounted rate that i paid being an associate of the same company i would have definitelly swtiched properties mid stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, small and unclean bathroom, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Jks73
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay at the Crowne Plaza. I stayed here with two young children. We had a double room for four. The bedroom was of average size. The beds were extremely comfortable. However, the bathroom was far too small. When you took a shower the sink ended up wet and the sink was placed almost on top of the toilet. There was no room to move. There was no extractor fan so the bathroom was full of steam. There was mould in the corners of the bath and the shower head looked like it had never been cleaned. The shuttle runs from about 9am 'till midday to the Vatican City. From 4pm 'till 9pm the shuttle runs between Rome centre. Be warned though, places on the shuttle are not guaranteed. It is not first come first on but those who push to front get a seat. If you don't get a seat then you are left to wait for next shuttle - or you can get a taxi for about 10 euros. The breakfast was fine, it wasn't the best but it wasn't too bad either. The staff however were not friendly. Tea and coffee were not offered to you at the table which I would have expected for a hotel of this rating. When I asked for a pot of hot water for tea the waitress on duty was clearly put out and the hot milk never arrived. The night before we were due to leave I asked the concierge to book a taxi. She quoted 75 euros. This was more than the company I had used when we arrived in Rome. When i questioned the quote she said this was the only company that she knew of in Rome that did airport shuttles. I asked her to contact RomeCabs.com for me. She refused and said that I must call them myself from my room. I decided to get a local taxi from the taxi stand in the morning instead. This only cost 36 euros for six of us. The chap at the front of the hotel was great. One night I ordered room service for the kids. A margarita and fries cost 20 euros. The pizza was poor considering this is an Italian dish. The restaurants around the hotel were better and the bars at the top of the road far cheaper than the hotel. On the plus side, the hotel was cheap compared to those in the centre of Rome. The pool was a plus point for the kids. Shame there were not enough sun loungers to go around. If you want a sun lounger get to the pool early.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: berg2405
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome for a psychology conference and stayed at the Crown Plaza. I found the accomodations to be excellent. The rooms were comfortable and big. I had a pool side room with a nice view of the pool and grounds. The pool and spa were great. The morning breakfast was great. The staff were friendly and spoke fluent English. There was a daily shuttle to and from the hotel that allowed me to visit key sites in Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel to the new or seasoned travelor. The accomodations at St. Peter added to my enjoyment of Rome. Dr. Berg, Riverside, California

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Roman suburbs.”
Reviews.Author: capedoc
Reviews.Content: Ignore it's name. This is the same relation to the Vatican that Hotel Westminster in Paris has to London. If you were to walk there it would take you a good half hour. But that is where the bad ends. The good stuff here makes up for it. On arrival, the facade is a bit dated. And the corridors are weirdly blood red, reminding me more of the shining than hotel new Hampshire. But the rooms are updated with a top notch entertainment system ( albeit a strangely small LCD). On our package, we were allowed unlimited wireless as well as all the movies we could eat (including the naughty ones) which was a true blessing. There was good quality wireless throughout the hotel, allowing breakfast to be a troll through the NYT. They do provide a selection of papers; English ones being the ubiquitous IHT as well as USA today. There's also a digest of news for various nationalities available a breakfast. The breakfast was included and good quality; I particularly recommend the mozzarella balls. (also known as buffalo balls). There is a free bus service into town, which we would use to get in, then we would taxi back (€10-15). But the main piece de resistance here is the pool. In Rome the temp got up to mid 30's and with kids it was the best reason for staying here. after a heavy days vaticanising, sweating from extreme walking and extremer confession, believe me, they will thank you for it. A couple of other bonuses are free parking and a nocturnal piano player adding to the ambience. you.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard of hotel”
Reviews.Author: NMG01
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, friendly hotel with excellent facilities for families. I know that some reviewers have concerns about its location, but with a free courtesy bus (or ~12 euros by taxi) it is only about 10 mins from the centre of Rome. The outdoor pool (25m) and accompanying facilities makes the distance from the centre worth the extra journey (or cost) - this standard of hotel and facilities would cost double what this hotel costs if it was city central. I and my family really enjoyed this vacation and would certainly go back to the Crowne Plaza on any future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to be useful”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: We opted to stay at Crowne Plaza due to availabilty of rooms for Priority Club points. The location- called St Peters is misleading, as you need a shuttle bus to get there, but it did offer some service to St Peters. Check in was chaotic. Too many demanding guests and limited reception staff. Once checked in, things settled down. Hotel is large and our room was quite a walk from the reception. Many foreign tourist - seemed mostly to be American families. On weekdays the hotel seemed to migrate to mostly business mode Things we liked: Shuttle service to St Peters Comfortable rooms Plenty of internet access- but not included Things we did not like Slight remote location - nothing seemed within walking distance except new convention center. Taxi- park remote from hotel entrance and frequently were less cooperative than expected. Check in - not enough staff working most times we passed the front desk. Room value - I based this on the rate quoted- I would not have stayed there. Internet- extra charge Shuttle bus - it is first come first serve. Not adequate space for the demand on our weekend and the schedule is really surprisingly limited for such a big hotel in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Good price-quality”
Reviews.Author: KNJJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed it a lot. Rooms are spatious and clean, with balcony. Breakfast with large variety (too much choice!). Staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a large swimming pool and spa to relax after a long day of walking and visiting. You can take the free hotel shuttle bus to St Peter's in the mornings and to the city center from 4pm. Last shuttle service from city center at 9pm, but the way back with metro and bus only takes you about 20-25 minutes. From midnight till 5am there's a night bus with a stop in front of the hotel, very easy. Tip: Buy a Roma Pass !! It costs 25 euros per person and includes transport on metro and bus for 3 days AND two entrances to the most famous historical attractions (Colosseum, Forum Romanum...). And very interesting fact: it allows you to skip the long waiting queues as there is a special entrance for holders of the Roma Pass. You also get discount for a 3rd, 4th... visit.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Couple45
Reviews.Content: outdoor swiming pool ( a must for hot Rome in summer), outside center (some hours shutle bus), a lot of bussines people but still peace, nice service / if you want a Rome hotel with pool and normal price ...

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations for a Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: RudraPalash
Reviews.Content: We were offered a room in the semi-basement/ground floor section where they have conference rooms for corporate clients. This area has been recently renovated and they are offering rooms in this area if you are ravelling with children. It did not feel safe to be next to corporate seminars rooms where various people are walking in. Also, being in a semi-basement area, it was somewhat damp and unhealthy. The bathroom is small and there were ants crawling all over the floor. It is located quite a distance from the metro station. You either have to catch a taxi or get on a public bus. If you are returning late, you could be in for a taxing time. It does not offer you shuttle service to downtown Rome in the mornings. There is a shuttle service close to St Peters and coming back in the evenings, you have to get the public bus. Bed was okay and amenities were standard. We got room service for dinner - the food was below standard. The service was poor; the waiters in the breakfast room were downright rude. The staff at reception were okay but did not volunteer any information to make your city trips more pleasant. We had to catch the train to Pisa one day which we ultimately missed - I wish the staff had advised us about the morning rush hours when we talked to them. They were not friendly at all. The only silver lining was that the ATM worked and we did not have to run to a bank. This was our fourth trip to Italy and we never had such unpleasant hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Extemely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: giji365
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremly beautiful with elegant rooms. Breakfast was good. Helpful staff. A very comfortable and soothing experience. Broadband is charged here.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza St. Peter's”
Reviews.Author: jussurfin
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel inside and great service! We had the buffet in the restaurant one night and it was the best food I had on my whole trip in Italy! The place was immaculent and everyone was helpful and friendly. I have already recommended it to my friends and I want to go back. Do take the local bus which picks you up right outside the hotel to the vatican. (#881 for one euro) Use the ATM for the cheapest exchange rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, Very nice has every modern comfort nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveler12000
Reviews.Content: We like this hotel and it has all the conveniences and cleaniness one might expect. The staff were helpful, the breakfast was good and we liked the convenient shuttle that we took each day to the Vatican area, not to mention they will take you to the airport by bus for free, at least to FCO they will. The Crowne is out of the way but it is nice to get out of the hussle and bussle. We stayed there 5 nights and it was a very nice hotel. Each morning we would get on the shuttle and it would drop us right at the Vatican. We would go over to the other side and if you want to catch a hop on hop off bus it would take you to every site. We loved Piazza Navona and the Coleseum/Forum area. Great fun.

Reviews.Title: “The place is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: drdsplay
Reviews.Content: Celebrity Cruises reccomended this hotel. It is very overpriced, dirty, broken down and the the food is awful!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!! Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pinnacle08
Reviews.Content: Many people now rely on reviews to feel confident when booking holidays these days. After reading great reviews about this hotel we decided to book for my 40th Birthday celebration. Looked at many other hotels in the centre but it was the pool that won us over. WE ARE SO GLAD WE STAYED HERE. Fantastic hotel, clean well equipped rooms lovely outside pool area which was great after a day sightseeing with teenagers!! From the buzz of the city to the peace and tranquility of the hotel pool. Beware though on a rainy day children under 16 are not allowed to use the indoor pool!! Luckily we had gorgeous weather. Had lunch at the Osterio restaurant one day which was lovely. Drinks are very expensive, as expected. The Hotel run a good courtesy bus service which is invaluable, saved us a fortune in cabs. The hotel staff are friendly & helpful and the manager put a bottle of bubbly in our room on my birthday. All in all a fabulous time at the Crowne Plaza. Rome is breathtaking....will definately recommend hotel and city and can't wait to come back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place for a base when exploring.”
Reviews.Author: DCZE
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 14 day and made our travels from the hotel. The breakfast was very good although it could use to "change up" every couple days, the beds were sooo comfortable it was tough to get up! The bathrooms were just big enough but not too small. No dressers though... a couple of drawers for the "smaller stuff" and a couple of shelves we used for clothes. The food was very good and we just adored our bartender (Stefano). The staff knows enough english to be helpful. The buses... we never did figure those out. The shuttle was nice but could use a few more pickup/dropoff times. All in all... it was a GREAT stay! Oh yeah... the jacuzzi... not even luke warm. My sister ended up with a rash on her leg. Didn't smell like they use chlorine.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: edondon
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel for tourists. It is almost entirely set up for large tour groups, seminars and conferences. Meals are reasonable but don't fall for the buffet at 25 Euro unless you check it thoroughly first, often is it is food that one would not necessarily choose to eat. We found many of the waiters the rudest and least attentive of any on all of our 10 weeks away. They often followed the policy of "out of the way I am coming through" rather than respecting to where the guest was going. They would never get a job in Singapore or Switzerland!! Rooms are fine but having booked in for an extra night before a tour, we discovered that the room we were given had a broken door on the bathroom, so that it was impossible to close. Eventually, it was repaired to a satisfactory standard but this should not happen especially when one is paying almost 400 AUD for a room. One positive is the pool, spa and sauna, these are excellent. The location of this hotel is almost 14 km out of central Rome and is quite difficult to get to when using public buses...beware of bus H64, that is if you can find it!! If you arethinking about walking in the area of the hotel, forget it as the footpaths which are often in direpair,are so narrow that one has to walk in single file. Also there is only one proper crossing in the vicinity of the hotel, all of the others are the flashing amber light style where you have to take on the traffic before it stops. Very scary. Overall, not a hotel we would ever return to.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but way out of town”
Reviews.Author: PC_UKLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well equipped with gym, indoor and outdoor pools. It is in a quiet location but a long way from the city centre and even St Peter's! They operate a limited small shuttle bus service to and from St Peter's in the morning and the city in the afternoon but get there well before the departure time as several people were unable to get on five minutes before it was due to leave. The rooms are fairly spacious with balconies and are typical of a Crowne Plaza. Would look elsewhere when staying in Rome again though due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adrian B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in mid May. We flew into Ciampino and decided to take up the car arranged via the hotel at 60 euro. At the end of our stay, the taxi from the hotel to the airport was 35 euro. We had booked a suite, and were not disappointed, it had 2 bathrooms, 2 balconies and one of the biggest beds I've slept in. Breakfast was OK and stays open until 11:00. The restaurant has a buffet in the evening which we didn't use, although we had a look at it. At 25 euro each we thought it was not good value. The chioce was limited, and we preferred to eat at local eateries. For example, there is a restaurant next door to the hotel which was fantastic. Very roomy inside, good hosts, and lots of local families dining. The bus shuttle service was OK. In the morning it drops off/picks up near the Vatican, and in the afternoon/evening it drops off/picks up near to the Area Sacra. Transport was not an issue though, as there is a public bus stop directly outside the hotel & a taxi from the vatican to the hotel cost 11 euro. We will visit Rome again in a few years, but would stay in a centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you expect from a Crowne Plaza property”
Reviews.Author: fb249
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at beginning of our Italy tour. Found what you would expect from a Crowne Plaze property. Nice facility, pleasant rooms and good breakfast buffet. Could not get ATM machine to work which was a minor inconvience since this was beginning of tour and planned to change our money here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but sleeping quality can be poor.”
Reviews.Author: Valinka
Reviews.Content: I ve chosen the hotel with the help of Trip Advisor and was thrilled by the review. In a total of 10 nights, I should have changed the room twice because of noisy - drunk - guests, coming back at midnight from the lobby bar. Being polite, I did complain only once - because the neighbours were as noisy as wild boars - , and the room I was proposed after a request at the staff, was itself noisy due to some thumping in the water pipes, it was three days before departure, I prefered to keep like this ( Maybe worse ! ). Food is correct, but on half board, the choice of the evening menu can be too scarce after some days. It was even a shock to see some people eating sandwiches+crisps+diet coke, when correct italian food ( wide choice of antipasti and italian starters ) is available, as well as correct wine ( you can order per glass ). The staff makes all possible to help , be friendly and welcoming for guest with underage children. There is a complimentary shuttle bus that was usually only half full, but you will find yourself accustomed to to city bus quickly, if you want to give a try. Price of the drinks at the lobby bar are over priced, a pity. If you are a family planning to visit Roma with family and have calm nights, turn away. If you plan to have funny time, not caring of other guests ... it is for you.

Reviews.Title: “What's up with the A/C”
Reviews.Author: karw
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nites with spouse when we joined a Tour. Clean and had all amenities of US chain but no air conditioning yet it was high 70's to low 80's in temp. Toilet seat was not attached correctly in bathroom making it difficult to use. Mattresses were low and slid. Bank card machine wold not accept my card which cost me 4 international calls only to find it was not my card but the machine itself. Good buffet breakfast but coffee cold. Dinner buffet nice but pricey @ 25 Euros per person which did not include drink.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, good location, quite rooms”
Reviews.Author: Katmul
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week at Crowne Plaza, on our honeymoon, we got a good "room only" deal on the internet. On arrival we received a room upgrade without asking as I had put on our booking form that we were on honeymoon. Our room had a balcony and overlooked the tennis courts, lovely and quite and got the sun most of the day.
