The service in this hotel is excellent and when we reported that our balcony door wouldn't lock they sent someone round immediately to fix it. There are two restaurants, one an all day walk in restaurant and the other a more upmarket evening retaurant. We availed of the €25 all you can eat buffet on two occasion but unfortunately the food was barely luke warm - the only downside to this hotel. It's location is good, in a nice quite area, however there is a regular bus shuttle service laid on by the hotel which takes you into the centre of rome. There is also a very frequent public bus service just outside the hotel, and a taxi rank on the hotel grounds. Overall, we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: MichelleGD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our way to a Med. cruise. The hotel is VERY nice-- updated, quiet and clean. Rooms are much like those found in American hotels. CP restaurants are rather expensive though. Public buses are just to the right of the entrance and are very user-friendly. Vatican was about a 20 minute bus ride without transfers. We used Zelit Limousines for airport to hotel + private 3-hour Rome tour + hotel to cruise port -- rates were quite reasonable, vans were clean and they were punctual. I would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Trips333
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and was exceptionally impressed by the level of service given. Only problem is the location but the shuttle bus is convenient and free. The restaurant staff were very accomodating and added items to the buffet when the selection was limited. The room was reasonable although dated in terms of fixtures. Great value for money with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: angelbuffyfan
Reviews.Content: We liked the large room with balcony, and bathroom. The staff was courteous and helpful. We were very comfortable. We chose this to be out of city center and noise, while being close to the Vatican. It isn't as close to the Vatican as we thought, and you had to take the city bus to get there (the hotel bus passes by it, but doesn't stop). The hotel courtesy bus runs on a schedule and be sure you stand on line early, otherwise it will fill and they won't let you on. The indoor pool is only available to 16 and up, so my 12 year old and 15 year old were out of luck. The outdoor pool wasn't open yet. the breakfast was pricey, but very good, and my girls loved it. the internet expense was high, but sometimes you can grab a lobby computer with time left on it. the only dinner restaurant lacks the Rome feel, and isn't family oriented, but the concierge offers a courtesy taxi to a neighborhood restaurant. It was great! Arturo's next door is also wonderful, but it is closed on Mondays. If you take the Metro, ask for specific instructions on which direction, and what exit to walk out of, otherwise you can be disoriented for a while (or lost like us). Overall, we were content, and while some things disappointed us, we were glad to be in a spacious, comfortable room in a quiet area. Also, while there is a courtesy taxi to and from the airport, it is only once a day. You can arrange through the hotel, for a private car to pick you up. It is however, expensive. Take smaller luggage to avoid the Minivan expense. The alternative is public transit, which is not a nice way to begin your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and great staff....”
Reviews.Author: rocketpants
Reviews.Content: Just to say a big thumbs up to the staff at this hotel, nothing was too much trouble and the quality of the hotel itself was superb. We couldnt have chosen a better place to stay! Many Thanks x

Reviews.Title: “this hotel has many many possibilities to make you feel good”
Reviews.Author: lifeisustawalk
Reviews.Content: My wife, my daughter and I spent approximately one week (the holy week) in this hotel and I must admitt that we really enjoyed our staying there. Although Crown Plaza is a little bit away from the center of the city this was not any problem at all since we were able either to use the hotel's bus (needs some more routes so that it would be comfortable and work for all its clients...) or to deal with public buses' services. After all I am saying that everything was under control..furthermore one thing that i would like to say to the people who want to stay in crown plaza is that it has great breakfast which you can have from 6 to 11 o'clock...this was really great for us who sleep a lot but we also had to get up early in the morning of the last day in order to catch our flight! If you want to work with internet you'd better take your laptop with you, because during vacation the only two pc available are working all-day by young girls and boys! The indoor swimming pool and jacuzzi are a very good solution for you when you want to relax after a full touristic day and are totally well-preserved although the depth is disappointingly too small(only 1,2m,so I wonder why children must be at least 16 in order to use this pool!)...Anyway,be ready to make a real healthy circuit with roman bath and sauna if you want ! We also recommend 'Arthuro's' restaurant which is nearby and serves nice italian dish. Roma is a city with many nice places to see and if you stay in a nice hotel like this things are getting easier.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service and attitude of the staff at this hotel is appauling.”
Reviews.Author: Taelane
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I traveled from Ireland along with a wedding party of 9 others for our wedding in Rome.On arrival at the hotel my fiancée requested a French polish as her nail varnish had spilled in her handbag and distroyed her nails.Normally we would not get fussed about something like this but as it was for her wedding we taught they might be some bit helpful instead they just kept saying " we cannot help you".I find it hard to beleive that the beauty therapist working at this hotel could not find 15 mins in the two days before the wedding.this is customer service at it's very worst County Kerry Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Rome St' Peter's: a dream turned into reality”
Reviews.Author: wiskinson3085
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Crowne Plaza Rome St' Peter's recently to relax, enjoying myself together with some friends of mine. The first impression was absolutely great; the hotel is well located ( in a couple of minutes by bus you can get the beautiful St' Peter's Church, just brilliant) because isn't far from the city centre but at the same time is surrounded by a lot of greenery in a relaxing and peaceful environment. The staff (i've to mention the speed and the efficiency at the check in and the professionality at the Osteria restaurant, in which i had the pleasure to taste delicious italian dishes, and at the Bar il Palco as well. Stefano was just amazing) was friendly and welcoming. Especially Alessia at the front office desk was very helpful and kind. i give her ten stars. Moreover my room was just perfect: clean, with a lot of space and extremely cozy. On top of that the room overlooked a fantastic pool in a marvellous italian garden. i thought to be in paradise! A great value added is represented by the wellness centre (St' Peter's SPA) in which i discovered with pleasure an indoor heated swimming pool as well as a sauna, a turkish bath and a tub. My experience at the Crowne Plaza was absolutely positive, my stay was unforgettable and delightful. I've to say thank you to everybody in there to make it happen.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: kikinovela
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Hotel St Peters in Rome last week end. We had an amazing time there. So romantic. The service was outstanding. The view from our room overlooking the swimming pool was stunning! The spa was great especially after a long day of sightseeing in Rome. There's a shuttle service which takes you right into the centre of Rome, very handy! Amazing service, amazing food, amazing location! Nothing else to say, just perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base to explore Rome, very good service in all areas of hotel”
Reviews.Author: LWhitehead
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in Rome during for a six nations game, the hotel is an ideal location for sightseeing take advantage of the free shuttle bus to the centre of town for for 1 euro travel 10 mintues on the bus right to the Vatican City. It was great to go slightly out of town after a day of crowds in the centre of Rome for some peace and quite. Lovely grounds and the outdoor pool in the summer would be a huge plus point. All of the staff in the hotel we came accross were very helpful and friendly, we had a great local restaurant reccomendation for one evening. The restaurant in the hotel is good to eat in but great to get out and explore some local restaurants too. The rooms were spacious and clean and breakfast a good start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “If I could live there everyday I would.”
Reviews.Author: musashiColumbus
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience! I've stayed in many places all around the world and I have never felt so at home and pampered as I did at Crowne Plaza Rome. The staff really know how to make you feel like a king. The restaurant had excellent service and the food was great. The spa was great as well. A superb place to relax in the jacuzzi or sit by the fireplace reading a book. The gym was pretty good as well. To sum up, if you're going to Rome and you want to be comfortable and taken care of at an afforadable price this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Really Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: orange66
Reviews.Content: Jeez, this is an uninspiring and ordinary place. If you are looking for a special hotel in a special city, there must be better options. This feels like a decent Airport hotel, but I hate airport hotels, so read into that what you want. Food is overpriced. It was okay compared to hotel food around the world, but you are in one of the top foodie cities on the planet, but everything on offer was tired and prepared by a bored kitchen just going through the motions. The Decor is out of date, and all very burgandy. This is a boring hotel, staffed by bored people. You won't find a cockroach in your bed, or anything nasty, but, I don't know, its all a bit, meh.... This probably used to be a very glamorous, La Vita Bella, Sophia Loren lounging by the pool sort of hotel, and with a bit of love and cash, it could return to its former glory. Ian Schrager, where are you???

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: doc077
Reviews.Content: nice, comfortable rooms with good amenities. Rooms were large, beds were spacious. Reception & other staff were cooperative & courteous. Location is a bit away from city center but shuttle is convenient. Breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Is time to relax”
Reviews.Author: Easy2travel007
Reviews.Content: I was guest at Crowne Plaza Rome-St. Peter's Hotel & Spa hotel on 2/13 and 2/14/2010 for rest and relaxation. I found the hotel being modern, well kept, and clean. The staffs from front desk personnel to housekeeping including bar and restaurant are well organized, friendly and professional. The hotel location from airport it’s easy to reach by train and bus. There is bus stop located right outside of the hotel with several different bus lines which takes you to different parts of the city including underground rail system. I took the bus to Vatican city and saw the Sistine chapel by Micheal Angelo and Stain Peter's church, which were fantastic. If your room rate does not come with breakfast, the hotel gives a special price of 14 Euro (instead of 18 Euro) a Full American breakfast buffet including eggs to order if you wish. I highly recommend trying the breakfast buffet. At night they have a piano player in the bar area which take you back in time with beautiful Italian, French, and English songs. The workout room is clean and new equipments. You can relax at the swimming pool area which includes Jacuzzi, steam room, and sauna. I enjoyed my stay very much, and I will go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: sarina210
Reviews.Content: hotel was very nice staff very nice as well- had a bus that goes into the city center for free several times per day-

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with great staff - thin walls”
Reviews.Author: lexycal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from February 10th - February 13th. The staff was great. Everyone knew English and were very helpful. The picture of the lobby on their website is slightly more enhanced than what you will find in person but still very nice. The rooms are standard, but the bed is exceptional. The reason I gave the room 3 stars is because of a couple things. They had slats up in the bathroom as the ceiling but if you look through the slats (easily done) you can see the disrepair behind them. It makes you wonder what else could be lurking there. Also you could hear through the walls/door pretty clearly. I wouldn't say to not stay here because of that but if you do have a loud neighbor it could become annoying. We didn't do the spa, but it seemed really popular especially for couples. They have a great free shuttle service to the city and cabs are readily available. They have a huge outdoor pool and an indoor pool, well worth experiencing if you want to just hang out for a day. There restaurants served great food and drink. As well as there are two restaurants in walking distance with superb service and food.

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Catmum67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my wife's 50th birthday. It's a great hotel in a quiet peaceful location 20 minutes from LDV Airport (fiumicino). Taxi fare is 40 euros - watch they don't take a detour! Hotel staff are excellent. We were checked in by Manager Francesco and upgraded to executive room 478 at rear - very quiet. Breakfast is taken in the conservatory restaurant overlooking the pool - all you could wish for to eat. The other restaurant is the Osteria which is excellent. We ate there several nights and the waiter Salvatore and Maitre D Veronica were excellent and so helpful. All the staff were indeed most helpful. The only proviso was the old chap in Il Palco bar who was obviously confused (!) over prices. There is a complementary bus from hotel to centre of Rome which runs until 20:15 and is very good. There is a public bus stop outside hotel on right take 98 or 881 direct to Vatican or central Rome - only one euro! tickets at reception. Great restaurant recommendation in Rome is Domiziano on Piazza Navonna by Parliament Building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location, but be prepared for extra travel costs!”
Reviews.Author: froberts84
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a good location, but be warned that, unless you use the hotel's free courtesy bus to and from town (about every 1.5 hours), you will pay an additional 10-15 euros per taxi ride (30 euros return)!...They say it's within walking distance of the Vatican, but it will take you about 45 mins to walk there (and some of the route doesn't have a pavement). Clean, spacious rooms and friendly, helpful staff. Also, if you fly into Ciampino Airport (where most no frills flights fly into) it's between 50 -60 euros in a taxi to the hotel (The hotel do offer a courtesy bus to the airport, but not this one!). We pre-booked our taxi online and they charged us 45 euros. All in all a reasonably priced, nice hotel - no better or worse than you would expect from a large chain. There's a nice restaurant next door - can't remember the name, but as you come out of the hotel entrance take a right and it's right there!

Reviews.Title: “always excellent”
Reviews.Author: amfitryon
Reviews.Content: i stay there with my wife and another couple on 16-1-2010 for four days.we enjoy the hospitality,the helpfull stuff,the excellent spa-yes there is in Rome spa-and the big rooms.We return there fourth time and we don' t count the distance from the center [about 2 klm.-15 euro taxi].But,there is bus station on the door of this hotel and a lot of taxi inside in the parking area of the Crowne Plaza.Don't afraid the distance,is very easy,because there are a lot of avantages in this hotel,like green,indoor and outdoor pool,piano bar,safety [very important for Rome],modern construction,modern big rooms with balkon,free shuttle bus to the center and v.v.ten times daily and finally excellent stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza St Peter in Rome - an experience to repeat!”
Reviews.Author: AlexLondon79
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to have a last-minute city break between Xmas and New Year's eve and decided the best choice was Rome. Having only few days to hang around, we realised it was worth spending few pennies more and go for a hotel with a good location. Hence our choice for the CP St Peter. Apart from the astounding position (this hotel is few bus stops away from St Peter Square) we enjoyed every single aspect of our stay: rooms are spacious and cosy and every comfort is offered, the environment is airy and light and the staff extremely kind. A large car park ensures you don't have to stress out for parking your vehicle, the restaurant is superb and offers a great option of italian dishes. Our only regret is having missed the SPA and the swimming pool, however we will definitely try next time we happen to be in Rome. Overall, I definitely recommend this hotel as both venue and staff will make you thorougly enjoy your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AvillaBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We decided to book our Christmas break at this hotel. From the minute the taxi pulled up we knew we had made the right choice. The hotel was very well situated and very clean. Our room was spacious and well appointed and we overlooked the swimming pool. The staff are amongst the friendliest and most helpful I have come across during travel for both business and pleasure. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and am looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: travlingal51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a cruise. The hotel was not near downtown, but they had a free shuttle. You had to wait for the pre designated time for the shuttle to take or pick you up. It dropped off in kind of a confusing area to find your way back to, but we managed. The rooms were large and clean with NO air conditioning. Maybe this is because we were there in November, but our room was VERY warm. The only recourse was to open your sliding door for a while, which we did until the mosquitoes got bad. There is a nice breakfast in the morning, the price for it was high though. Our travel agent negotiated in advance to have it included in our room charge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect End to an Italian Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 5 hotels during our honeymoon in Italy. This was the last hotel we stayed at. We have everything positive to say about this hotel with one minor exception of the location. The hotel itself is everything you'd expect from a Crowne Plaza. The staff was great, lots of dining options at the hotel, indoor swimming pool, Roman bath, sauna, spa-everything was great. If Rome wasn't so great, we would've spent a day enjoying the facilities. Our room was amazing! We were upgraded for our honeymoon! Thank you to the management. Also, we received complimentary chocolates, cookies, and wine. Thank you again! Very modern room and the accomodations were clean and comfortable. We enjoyed not being in the city and sat out on the quiet terrace. The location is ok. Use the complimentary shuttle to get into the city. If you get a Roma Pass, you can also hop on public transportation for free. Cabs are pretty pricey from this hotel. We spent our last day at Vatican City, so this hotel was a great place to stay for us. If you like to get away from city noise, travel with children, appreciate large "American" style rooms- stay here. The hotel is great! For any travelers, go to the spa and enjoy the facilities! We did! One last note, we ordered room service here and it was great! Safe Travels

Reviews.Title: “Real nice place if you want an American Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jimboitaliano
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great staff, clean and spacious rooms and all of the comfort of being in a hotel in the USA. There is a good restaurant outside the gate to the left. The public bus is very easy to take. It drops you off either at St. Peters or near PIazza Navonna. If you do stay here do not go back to Boise and tell your friends that you were in Italy. Tell them that you were in a hotel in Boise but eveyone spoke with an accent.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: jacklyle34
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day ahead of the rest of our tour group and were greeted like old friends. The additional day was booked directly through the hotel and the reservation staff was attentive and easy to work with. The front desk and bell staff were warm and gracious. Our room was large, clean and very comfortable; The shuttle service into and back from the center of Rome was a welcome amenity. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet as well as the lobby bar/cafe. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Airport Transfer, Sight Seeing, Eating out, in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cheekywelshmonkey
Reviews.Content: Airport Transfers. After reading previous reviews about getting from ciampino airport to the hotel and the need to get a bus then several connections on public transport, I booked a car to pick us up. I did this via the hotel, it was 60 euros and well worth it. Guy in a suit driving a mercedes. On leaving the hotel on the way home, we took the bus outside and then the 64 bus to the Train terminal, then the terra nova bus. If I had to do it again I'd get the free shuttle bus into town then find a bus stop with 64. Eating in and around the hotel. Hotel food very average. Out side the hotel there are 2 "local" restaurants. The hotel to the right was OKish... nothing exciting and expensive. (bread was off), then theres one to the left past the petrol station on the left.... slightly better than average. Getting into Rome - Shuttle bus is excellent Seeing the sights Get to the Vatican early (before 9.30) avoid massive queues. Avoid the Collisium between 11 and 2 - due to queues - also lots of hassle from touts pushing tours saying stuff like "its an hour queue from here", only took 30 min and 12 euro to get in. Best bit about Rome...... the Sant' Eustachio coffee shop near the Pantheon. Absolutely, absolutely THE best coffee Ive ever tasted ! Hope the above helps

Reviews.Title: “Best Crown Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: memecindy
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here on Priority Points. It is not near anything including a little café for breakfast. But we had the best room ever. The beds were very comfortable, the room extremely quiet. The restaurant was terribly expensive. The lounge was excellent with a w onderful piano entertainer nitely. The drinks actually were standard price. There is a free shuttle bus into central Rome that runs frequently but the bus fills up fast and people push and shove even if you are 1st on line. The public transportation bus is just outside the property and the hotel staff can sell you tkts and give advice of route for bus and metro. There is a lovely spa, hot tub and indoor pool to rejuvenate your tired feet. Even tho it is out of the central Rome, it is nice to come back to a quiet place where you don't hear all the street noises.

Reviews.Title: “Perilous Bathrooms at this overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDTravelerrrr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us by Celebrity Cruises for a 2-nite stay prior to our Mediterranean cruise on Equinox. No doubt our excessive charge was due to Celebrity's booking. Since we've had previous negative arrangements with Celebrity's bus arrangements pre- and post-cruises, we opted to book our own travel arrangements to and from the hotel.....thereby adding even more costs to the booking. The worst part, however, was the hotel bathrooms. By European standards, their size is adequate but the large-size bath fixtures combined with the very slippery floors, make them extremely difficult to navigate. The bathtub/shower has a very high side, making things even more difficult. Our son and daughter-in-law were also on the cruise with us...younger people who are very active and agile...on the morning of the cruise, while attempting to exit the shower, our daughter-in-law slipped on this hazardous floor, fell and hit her head on the toilet....so hard that the toilet seat was broken and as we learned later, she broke a major bone in one leg. The hotel's handling of this event could best be described as chaotic.....they sent the doorman to invesigate. He said that the leg was not broken, though later xrays showed that it was.....needless to say, although our daughter-in-law made it to the cruise, it was a very painful one for her.....the leg was never set in Rome or on the cruise due to a variety of circumstances and more than 2 weeks later, she is finally getting the needed medical treatment near her home in the USA! We won't return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; definitely NOT in the center”
Reviews.Author: LarryJ917
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers here have noted, the "St. Peter's" appellation here is a loooooong stretch. I'm not sure how many Metro stops the Crowne Plaza is from St. Peter's, but it's a few. That said, we enjoyed our stay, although we spent a lot on taxis and public transportation. We had a spacious room on a quiet floor. Everything was quite clean and the cleaning service super. The restaurant is OK but expensive; still, it was a good place to have dinner the first night. The entrees are only passable steamtable food but the antipasto, salads and desserts are great. Breakfast, at 18 euros, isn't cheap but it is very good. One complaint: If you say you're serving until 11:30, don't start moving the food out at 11:15. I deserve the same breakfast if I show up at 11:10 as someone who comes at 9:10 for my 18 euros. Desk personnel are a little indifferent but most of them get you your information ... eventually. We didn't use the spa or pool so I can't comment. Nor did we use the shuttle, simply because it doesn't run very often and we didn't want to be tied to a timetable. The room was big, well-furnished, and pretty typical of a Crowne Plaza everywhere -- they won't knock your socks off with their splendor, but they're nice enough. Over all, I liked the place. But DO NOT imagine that if you choose this hotel that you are anywhere near the center. Get out your bus and metro map and be prepared to use it a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bettyboopmemphis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October. The room was clean, had a nice balcony overlooking the tennis court. It was hot at night when they cut the air conditioning off. Had no trouble getting wake up calls or towels. The front desk staff, for the most part, were rude. Once I came to the desk to ask a question about the bus and the staff person was talking to someone else so I waited my turn. when he finished he just completely ignored me! Other staff were milling around and no one said "may I help you?" I finally raised my voice and got their attention. There were similar incidents like that. I don't know if they are sexist or racist or just RUDE!!! The night staff was a little better except for the tall, thin grumpy one. Ugh!!! The piano bar in the lobby was a nice place to go for drinks in the evening. Fabio, the bartender, is very nice as is the piano player. I enjoyed evenings there and they stay open until 1:30 a.m. We never had a problem with the shuttle. You cannot get it from 12:00-3:00 because of lunch. It was never overcrowded. We took the bus into the subway stop much of the time because it was so convenient.. You could walk there (in terms of distance) but the narrow streets with no sidewalks makes it prohibitive. Don't try it! The bus service is iffy after 10:30 p.m. and one night we had to get a taxi. The driver took us back to the Vatican and all around, pretending he didn't know where we wanted to go and when I became extremely agitated he took us to the hotel, mumbling about how he has a family to support. I did not pay what he asked and got out. I peobably shouldn't have paid what I did pay. Look out for that kind of thing but it really doesn't happen much. I went to the breakfast buffet once-18 euros for waht is essentially a continental breakfast with some sausage (ugh) and runny eggs. The fruit and juice (and champagne) were great. The staff is good about helping to arrange tours and we took one to Capri that was excellent. You can get to Florence by just taking the metro to the Termini and buying a ticket , then just hop on one of those stop and go sightseeing buses that comes outside of the Florence station and you're good to go. All in all I liked the hotel but would probably stay closer in town next time. It was quiet at night. Each morning at 7:00 a.m. the church bells would chime then play Ave Maria. It was a nice touch. The restaurant next door is pretty nice. Great seabass! They are very friendly and accommodating. We never used the pool or spa. I would stay again if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MaddyFlan
Reviews.Content: First thing you need to know about this hotel is that it is located nowhere near St.Peters. I believe they are doing this because gullible tourists like me will think they are close to the center of town and therefore will book with them. Only way to get to the center of Rome is via a shuttle they provide and/or a $15 taxi ride into town. The shuttle however runs every hour but it is not always on time so you find yourself sometimes waiting up to 45 minutes just to catch a ride back to the hotel. Oh, and if you are not an early bird, you can also find yourself without a seat on the bus as there is only one bus and too many guests. You cannot walk to any place from this hotel and there is only one restaurant (and not a good one) nearby. Do not listen to all the reviews here about great staff service either. They were simply non-responsive. Simple requests for ice and towels went unanswered; wake up calls were never made. Requests for recommendations for nearby restaurants and/or transportation were met with a shrugging of shoulders followed by a pursing of the lips. No answer; no service. Rooms were regular standard american fare; nothing spectacular (don't let the website photos fool you; most of those shots are public areas and they don't quite look like that anymore). Only good thing I can say about the hotel were the baristas in the cafe who served our caffe each morning with a smile and a good story.

Reviews.Title: “good quality hotel. staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: planehopper_8
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Rome via Ciampino airport. Took Terravision bus to Termini and taxi to Hotel. Cost of bus 8 euros return. taxi 30 euros.Bit of a trek but was expected. Arrival at hotel no poblems with check in..we had prebooked through Alpha rooms...got great rate... Had booked double room but we were a little early so offered twin which had 2 queen size beds. Tea,coffee and water free. Had mini bar which was ridiculous prices...but they usually are. All rooms have balcony we looked over front of hotel and outside dining area. The back of the hotel overlooked pool areas. Breakfast was brilliant..Hot included bacon,sausage, scambled egg,toast. any type of cereal, croissants,yogurt,fruit and continental meats.fresh juice..very nice. Head waiter a treat very smiley and pleasant. Beds soooo comfortable. Hotel has complimentary shuttle which drops you off in the centre of the historic part.Handy for open top bus tours. All attractions walkable but need a good map. The bus could have been bigger..think around 30 seats..this was on a first come first served basis...we were always very early so had no problem going,but coming back we seemed to always catch 8.10pm bus..Europeans seem to have lost all sense of wait in line (including some Brits) A lot of pushing in to get on the bus...was quite heated on some occasions..not what you need on hols. Bus went back and to about 8 times each way apart from one day that they could not drive into centre due to a demonstration.

Reviews.Title: “Its just okay - shuttle to airport is limited”
Reviews.Author: AngelesAvary
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it has an indoor pool and an airport shuttle. The indoor pool is not open for children, although the very nice outdoor pool allows children, but is only open in summer. And the hotel shuttle runs only twice - once at 7:30 am and 8:00 pm. Its a large shuttle, but its first come first serve so you have to get there early. The hotel is quite large, is not very quite, but the beds are comfortable and it is clean. The restaurant is expensive and the food quality quite marginal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Wdrob
Reviews.Content: My wife, in-laws and I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Rome on our trip through Italy. The hotel was very easy to find with the GPS. If you have a car this is the place to stay. It is easily accessible off the ring road around Rome and you do not have to drive into Rome. Once get to the hotel, park the car and do not attempt to drive in Rome! I've driven all over Europe and Rome is by far the worst to drive in. The hotel has a convenient shuttle every hour to take you into town for free and drop you not far from the Coliseum or you can take the city bus right outside the hotel entrance (to the right) to the Vatican. Transit tickets are available from reception. We ate dinner in the restaurant and it was okay. It was convenient and there is not much else around. The service was excellent, but the food was just okay. We all ordered the fillet beef. I would expect better quality food from a Crowne Plaza hotel. Both the menu and buffet wasn't impressive. For breakfast we skipped the buffet and had croissants and coffee at the bar; after reading previous reviews and seeing the price. Each night they have a piano player in the bar just outside the restaurant that was very good. We had drinks at the bar one night and enjoyed the ambiance. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “dreamy stay at the crowne plaza,”
Reviews.Author: beehive50
Reviews.Content: my husband and I were very nervous about that first trip to Italy. I chose this Hotel because of all the good reviews i read. I contact the Hotel a couple of time and they always answer mer very quickly. the rooms are very spacious and the large bathroom surprised me. the location is a little far from the center of Rome but the free shuttle make it works wonderfully. A couple of blocks away, we walked every night to find a busy street with shops and great restaurants, we were more than happy. We appreciated the pool after a long day walking through Rome and the nights were quiet with no street noise. One of the best hotel i have ever been.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - airport shuttle problem”
Reviews.Author: JeanineCharleston_SC
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza is a fine hotel with an excellent restaurant. The room was very clean and well lit. It was very good for a european hotel. The staff were very helpful. The one concern that I have is that they have a great number of American travelers who take the early morning shuttle bus to the airport and they only have one stop. The bus driver on our trip was courteous, but not helpful when we got to the airport. He obviously knew that the all the US Airlines were not in Terminal 3 (where he dropped us off) and was less than honest when we asked him about their location. We were befuddled for several minutes until we found a police officer who directed us the to spot where one needs to take a shuttle to Terminal 5 (You simply wouldn't be able to walk it with your luggage). It is my opinion that the Crown Plaza should make a bus stop at Terminal 5. Outside of that, the shuttle to Rome Center was fine and on time. The hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DuaneT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to a cruise. We had visited Rome before on another cruise and wanted to roam around Rome on our on this time. This hotel is not in or near all the sites we wanted to see, but the hotel ran and shuttle all day to the Rome City Center. From Rome City Center, you can venture to all the main highlights from the Forum/Colleseum to the South to Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps and the Pantheon is just a short walk. The Vatican is reachable by bus with a bus stop right in front of the Hotel entrance. We arrived early (about 8:00 AM) and no room was available so we had the hotel's breakfast buffet which was quite large for pricy if not included in your stay. Rooms were clean and had a small refigerator which was convenient for chilling soda or wine. We walked along a very narrow sholder to the local grocery market (about 15-20 minutes from the hotel) but if you catch the shuttle into Rome, there is a supermarket in the block adjacent to the bus stop where we picked up soda, wine, and bottle water. While the price was right, I would probably stay closer in the Rome proper.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Strak707
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful weekend stay at the Crowne Plaza in Rome, we celebrated my daughter's 18th birthday there and the staff made it such a special stay we can't thank them enough. There is such a nice family atmosphere at the Hotel and with the staff being so helpful it makes your stay even more enjoyable. The amenities at the Hotel are great and the rooms are very comfortable. The food in the Restaurant is amazing and the Restaurant staff were so attentive when we celebrated my daughter's 18th birthday they made it an evening we could never forget.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to visit Rome from”
Reviews.Author: The_Travller
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel was ideally situated for visiting most of the sites of Rome, with a bus stop located directly outside the hotel; it was possible to get into Rome with 20 minutes of leaving. The hotel receptionists are very helpful in providing directions and can provide the tickets for the train. For those who want to travel by taxi there are always plenty waiting in the grounds to take you directly to where any location. The restaurants in the area are good and very reasonably priced, some even provide an inclusive service to pick you up and drop you back at the hotel. The food in all we visited was very good and the service friendly. The hotel facilities are very good with a large out- door pool which is fantastic to relax around after a long day in the city. Our room was more than we could have hoped for and we both look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Our wedding was arranged perfectly!”
Reviews.Author: chantal1986
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago we have been married in Rome! It was the most wonderful experience. One of the highlights was definitely our celebration in Crowne Plaza. Around 19 houres we started with a cocktailhour, outside near the pool. Then we had a delicious 4-course dinner in the hotel's restaurant Jardin d'Hiver and later on we danced for hours in a great patio outside. The staff was really helpfull and friendly and the ambiance was perfect; place setting, candles, roses, music, fingerfood, everything was have been taking care of. The outside area was beautiful decorated and also the tables looked magnificent. There was not one complaint out of 34 guests who stayed in Crowne Plaze for the weekend. There was some trouble communicating with the City Hall of Rome for some last details of the ceremony (since we don't speak any Italian), but the Food and Beverage Manager (Maria; who aranged our celebration) didn't hestitate to help us with this. 'Everything for your convenience, so you can relax' she said. So sweet! And therefore also our ceremony went smoothly. She even arranged the wedding bouquet, wedding cake and hairdresser and made sure the musicians where there on time. Also the Meeting Director (Marco) was really friendly. We felt at home immediately and could not have asked for more. Our wedding was because of this great help even better than we could have ever imagined. Thank you so much Maria, Marco and Valerio! P.S. More professional pictures will be uploaded soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Zim12345
Reviews.Content: The hotel was what I expected from the reviews. The pool is the biggest draw card. It has to have one of the best pools in rome. The spa was great and very helpful. The rooms were excellent and nicely decorated. The free shuttle is not worth being advertised. If you get want to get onto it, you will need to wait at least 30 min before its due to depart. The local bus is better and more interesting. The food and beverage prices were a joke. It was so expensive that we bought our own drinks into the hotel. A bottle of wine that costs 6 Euros is being sold for 30 Euros. Would I go back, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in somewhat inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: leisure-traveller44
Reviews.Content: This hotel has spacious comfortable rooms, and we hardly heard a sound from other people in the 7 days we stayed (although had we been on a lower floor, the music from a wedding party might have kept us awake one night). We didn't use any of the leisure facilities and few people did make use of the large outdoor pool. Breakfasts were ample and varied with lots of fresh fruit. Really the only problem is that the hotel is out in a suburb, which means the neighborhood is quiet, but if you miss the shuttle (which stops at one place downtown approx every 90 mins but a longer gap at lunchtime) then it's a train and bus ride away. The shuttle worked well, and public transport did, too, but took much longer. On Sunday using public transport it took us over an hour to get back, compared to 20 mins on the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “So pleased I came back ... this really is a great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: FSGITALY
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Rome St Peters for the second time in August 2009 and I have got to say that I am very pleased we did. It was superb. If you too are lookingh for a modern, city centre hotel which is relaxed and wecloming especially for families, with excellent attentive service with a smile, then look no further than this one. You will not be disappointed. When we arrived, there must have been some big sports event going on at the time because the American swimming team was there - I guess they know a good hotel when they see one too – but even with the added people, security and entourages of coaches etc, the hotel was excellent and made sure that I and my family were made to feel especially welcome. The swimming pool area is where my girls spent most of the time and the grounds around the pool are beautifully manicured and carefully cared for. The grass is lush green and the plants and trees receive a daily watering from obviously attentive staff. The pool is quiet – except for the noise of children laughing and playing – which is pretty much the best sort of noise you want to hear at poolside. The pool is great too and always exceptionally clean. There is a constant life guard on duty which is always a great benefit to parents of young kids. The little splash pool - only around half a metre or so deep - is brilliant.. really safe and great fun for 40 something dad’s and their kids to play in! The room we were allocated was spacious, well furnished, light and airy and easily large enough to accommodate all four of us. The range of kids movies on the reasonably priced pay TV was super and kept my girls occupied nicely whilst the midday sun burned at its most ferocious outside. We ate dinner on one night in the open area restaurant to the front of the hotel and we were pleasantly surprised by the menu and quality of both food and service. Some Roman cousins of mine came to dinner and they too remarked just how good the food was! The choice and quality of children’s food was exceptional as evidenced by my youngest devouring her meal in record time .... something she does very rarely. The activity menu’s for children are another nice touch helping us keep the children occupied during the very short time between ordering and receiving your food. We decided to venture out into the mean streets of Rome one morning and made enquiries of the concierge as to where to go and what to see bearing in mind our young children. The advice he gave was brilliant – there’s a lot to be said for local knowledge – and we enjoyed our day out visiting many child friendly attractions using an array of modes of transport all as prescribed by our friend from the hotel. This hotel is really a great place for families to visit especially in the summer when the sun shines and the water of the pool glistens alluringly. In a nutshell, the Crowne Plaza Rome St Peters hotel is the place you should stay in Rome. From the moment we arrived and my daughters ran into the lobby screaming as only young children can to the moment we left we were looked after and thoroughly spoiled by the people who work at this really superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: TheCunnos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently as part of our honeymoon. Great service from the staff from the moment we first booked via email with the reservations department. They were very kind in upgrading us, the room was massive!!! All the rooms have balconies, and the air conditioning was a life saver in the August heat! To get into the city, there is a bus stop right outside the hotel, which drops you off right outside the Vatican. The hotel does sell tickets that can be used on the buses and trains. No-one on the buses seemed to know (or if they did, weren't bothered!) about validating the tickets so we did get a number of free trips! Be careful though, don't get caught out! Great leisure facilities, although in the sunshine the pool outside did seem to be very busy all day, so unless you get there early and put your towel out you will not get a lounger by the pool (not sure what nationality they all were?.......) The indoor pool facilities are great. You need to wear a swim cap (not sure why inside but not outside?) but if you don't have one they provide you with a rather fetching shower cap. Hilarious to see all these tanned and well built men looking as foolish as me! The hotel has a lovely bistro/ restaurant which we ate in every night. You can choose off a menu or have a buffet. Lots to choose from for about 25 Euros each, well worth it. One tip - book a table. This way you get to eat in the outside terrace, it makes it so much nicer, and they have live piano music each evening. Look out for the Cristiano Ronaldo look-alike waiter, he's a star!! Great breakfast selection too. Very busy each morning, but the staff were in control of it well. Overall a fantastic hotel with very attentive staff, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “overall very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfollett
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights in may with my sister. i think overall it's a good hotel. the price was decent, except breakfast for $25 each day (ridiculous). could use some updating to the interior.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: traceylou1972
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from this hotel and I can honestly say I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. No it is not in the centre of Rome but as a previous guest has mentioned getting away from the hustle and bustle and out of the heat this hotel ticks all the boxes. The pool is fantastic, a great place to rest those tired feet and enjoy a bit of relaxation. The curtesy bus is great but we found the local buses to be just as useful. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. The room was great and we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a premium room. Book this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “a Great stay at the Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: 1dws
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights pre cruise(wife plus 2 daughters 11 and 10). Arrived at about 1pm and were immediately given a room. After droping stuff off we made immediately to the pool, where both the Australian and US swim teams were enjoying a bit of R&R before the World Champs. We enjoyed each morning and early efternoon around the pool and did our sightseeing at Night. We took the courtesy bus to near the Pantheon each evening and caught taxis from ranks home later. they went from about 9 - 13 euros depending on time of night and where we got them. The hotel had a good breakfast buffet and we had lunches by the pool which ran to about 10euros for a main course. you can walk to shops and resteraunts along a narrow footpath outside the hotel just turn left out of the hotel, past the petrol station and along to the junction. You can go to the right and then up the hill to a shop ladden main street but best to do this after you have returned from central Rome by taxi, as you will then know the way to this area. Saw all the main sights and went to the Vatican early on the last Sunday of the month so avoided paying and went up to the Basilica 7 euros for the lift and then a number of steep steps to a great view at the top. would recommend this hotel for summer trips due to the pool and good A/c. Although 5 miles from the centre it only took about 10 minutes in a taxi, quicker when the driver wanted to practise being a racing driver!

Reviews.Title: “Rude, unhelpful and not what i call "customer service" - but the pool was nice”
Reviews.Author: kitkat10150
Reviews.Content: After a very turbulent flight and the taxi driver from the airport trying to rip us off, it was an unwelcome surprise to arrive at the Crowne Plaza St Peters to be told that our booking had been cancelled and that if we still wanted a room we would have to pay 210 Euros per night for our 4 night planned stay. This information shocked us to say the least, and we were very confused by the cancellation of our booking, which was made through an agent called BOOK IN HOTELS.COM - DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!! I had made contact with the Crowne Plaza several times over the week preceding our visit and was not informed by either the Crowne Plaza or our booking agent that our stay had been cancelled, despite having obviously paid up front. I asked the receptionist Connie what the Crowne Plaza could do to assist us with this worse case scenario of no hotel room, and they offered to contact the booking agent on our behalf but infortunately the call went unanswered. After this relatively mediocre attempt at assistance, it was obvious that we were becoming a nuisance and the receptionists were no longer interested in our plight. We were met with blank looks and shrugged shoulders, with the continuing offer of a special rate of 700 Euros for the 4 night stay, after already paying up front for our room.. We asked whether they could assist in finding us another room elsewhere as this was more than we wanted to pay, and were told all other hotels were fully booked (along with the Crowne Plaza) but we could have free use of the internet for 1 hour if we wanted to look for ourselves! I am aware that the cancellation of our booking was not the fault of the Crowne Plaza, however their response and attempt at "Customer Service" was appalling. They were simply not interested and we were made to feel like criminals as if we were trying to pull a fast one. The hotel could have at least informed us prior to our arrival that our booking had been cancelled and have been more understanding instead of at one point refusing to speak with us when we did not give in and go away, like it was clear they would have preferred. All in all, we had a pleasant stay but i would not stay at this hotel again or recommend to anyone who appreciates friendly customer service. The bar downstairs is the most boring bar i've ever experienced which is clearly why no one else visited it. Plinky plonky piano and hugely expensive drinks - not great! Previous people have recommended the restaurants nearby - i'd give these a miss - not very impressive, no atmosphere etc. Take a taxi to Trastevere instead, it's about 8 Euros and there are hundreds of restaurants and bars by the river, loads of atmosphere and hustle and bustle - proper Rome. The pool at the hotel was nice and there was always a spare sunbed which is surprising considering the amount of rooms. Breakfast - the good would be choice of toast, cereals, plenty of fruit, juices etc The bad would be the "hot" buffet - the sausages were about 2 inches long, the bacon was rubbery, the eggs were slushy and undercooked and all of the above were cold. I was told by email from the hotel that breakfast would be 18 Euros per day however when i was there i saw several advertisements stating that breakfast was 14 Euros. In a nutshell, if you're going to stay here, double check and check again that your room is really available and skip the hotel bar, hot buffet breakfast and nearby restaurants and try out the pool. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - clean rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Carrie063
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel almost three hours early, and our room was ready. The reception staff were helpful, friendly and efficient, and spoke perfect English. The room was very spacious, with a huge bed, and was very clean, as was the bathroom. We ate breakfast at the Hotel which was pricey, but there was plenty of choice, and was definitely very convenient. If you book an 'american' breakfast the day/night before, you get a voucher that gives 4 Euro's off the price. The bar prices were on a par with the prices of drinks in the centre of Rome. The hotel operates a shuttle into the centre of Rome, almost on an hourly basis, which is free and very convenient and holds 35 people. Get to the stop about 10 minutes early and be prepared to battle to get on it - other tourists have no manners, and if you don't have a 'if you can't beat em - join em' attitude you won't get a seat! There is a bus stop outside the hotel that takes you to the Vatican (But not on a Sunday!) and you can buy bus tickets from the Hotel (One Euro each for 75 minutes of travel!). You can also get a taxi easily as there is a taxi rank at the hotel. For a big hotel it was exceptionally quiet! There is also a spa and swimming pool but we were too busy in Rome and didn't have time to use them! A fantastic stay at a great hotel - I would definitely visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: SAPOID
Reviews.Content: Great for travelers with cars, as the parking is inside the hotel compound. Unlike many hotels in Italy where one has to pay up to 50EUR per night for a public garage. Parking was our NO.1 priority. The rooms had flat screenTV, mini sofa and chairs and a table. Extremely great deal for the money we paid. The breakfast was better than most of the hotels I've stayed in ever.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: layzuk
Reviews.Content: Arrived fairly late on the Friday evening. Took the express train from the airport to Termini station and then took a taxi to the hotel which came to 17 Euros on the meter (I suspect it would have been less, but there's a lot of traffic in the city centre on Friday nights). I offered the driver 20 Euros but as he had no change he was willing to charge me 15 which was a nice surprise, however I told him he could keep the change as a tip. Check-in painless, no one else waiting to check-in and friendly person at the desk, without prompting, he said he'd see if there were any upgrades available for me as a platinum member. I was given a slightly bigger room with a pool view. The hotel was refurbished in 2008 and the hotel has won awards for its refurbishment. This means the rooms are clean, comfortable and modern but are not as stylish as the Crowne Plaza London Kensington that was refurbished this year. The hotel is not within reasonable walking distance of the city centre, but you have a few options. The hotel runs a complimentary shuttle bus most hours, there's also a taxi rank inside the hotel grounds or the hotel can also advise on public transport (and sell tickets). The bus ride to the centre is less than 15 minutes. I only visited the city centre once in this trip (because I've visited Rome a number of times previously, staying at the InterContinental which is very centrally located). I decided to use this trip for relaxation rather than sightseeing and take advantage of the hotels facilities, particularly the pool area. The hotel has a very nice bar terrace and a reasonable (although not outstanding) restaurant. However, there's a very nice Italian restaurant located right next to the hotel, just outside the grounds. It's frequented by the locals and hotel guests in the know. It's well worth a visit. Overall, very pleased with my stay. I wanted a nice relaxing weekend and that's what I got. If you just want a city break, I'd consider something more central. But if you'd like to spend some time relaxing by the pool in addition to seeing the sights then you can't go wrong. Lessons to be learned: I should have taken a taxi direct from the airport to the hotel, this would have cost me 40 euros. This was more expensive than the combined train + taxi option but the direct taxi would have avoided Rome's Friday night traffic congestion. The cheapest option to the hotel is a combination of train + metro + bus (or 10 minute walk instead of the bus). You can find public transport info on the hotels website or if you need further assistance then contact them before arrival. The hotels free shuttle bus only makes one trip to the airport, mainly to cater for the morning arrivals from the USA. During the rest of the day the shuttle bus is used between the hotel and the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: vinceheath
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the hotel and as our room was not ready was directed to the pool area which made a great start to our 3 day trip. As promised our room was ready within 30 mins which was still 2 hours before check in. The staff on reception spoke perfect english and were helpful with bus tickets and directions throughout our stay. The rooms were clean and complimentary gifts replenished on a daily basis. Breakfast was more than adequate and better than we expected. We only used the complementary shuttle bus once as it only holds about people and some people choose to take up seats which although selfish to others is not checked. The bus to central Rome stops outside the hotel runs every 15 minutes or so and there is a taxi stand within the hotel grounds. We did not eat in the hotel other than breakfast but the restaurant to the right of the hotel was excellent. Overall an excellent choice and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris2234
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great 3 night weekend at the Crowne Plaza. We found the hotel and staff to a high standard. Our room was well appointed and in very good condition, comfortable bed and very nice bathroom. We were very lucky to have 3 days of great weather and made good use of the fabulous outdoor pool. We had dinner in both the Hotel restaurant and the restaurant next door each were very good. This hotel is 3km from Vatican City and 5km from the centre of Rome, the hotel shuttle bus is very good but is first come first served, there is a good bus service right outside the hotel which will take you to the Metro station in just a few minutes (we walked twice which only took 15 minutes). We are quite fussy about hotels but could find nothing of fault here worthy of mention, providing you don't want to be slap bang in the middle of Rome we can highly recommend the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with several "American" amenities..... would stay again”
Reviews.Author: amyb3517
Reviews.Content: Went with a tour group and the room was clean and smelled good (which I can't say for all of the hotels we stayed at). There were no surprises; our beds were clean and our towels were fresh. We went on this vacation KNOWING that the purpose of our hotel was to clean up and sleep, NOT to live in. Maybe others have different expectations, but I can say that it was a standard hotel. It was a few minutes out of the city~~ we took the bus for around 2 or 3 Euro. I would definitely reccomend this to my American friends, who may not be as versed in the "European" style of many of the hotels....... this one has it's own bathroom, a hairdryer, a refrigerator and an ice machine.... MANY of the hotels in Europe do NOT carry these amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not central ..”
Reviews.Author: Chez_London
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza, St Peters for a conference in June and I was extremely happy with the rooms and service that was provided. The breakfast was perfect, not only did they serve continental breakfast you could also have hot food, which is perfect if you’re spending the day exploring Rome. The swimming pool was an added bonus, when its 30 degree temperatures it’s quite nice to have a pool to relax by if necessary. The hotel is not walking distance to the centre, but they provide a free shuttle bus which takes you direct to the centre, the last bus back is 22:15pm but a taxi costs approximately EUR10. Although I liked this hotel, I’m not sure I would pay my own money to stay here, as I feel it is very expensive compared to what you can find in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “STOP your hotel search if in Rome. Experience the Crowne Plaza Rome St. Peter's; first class service all the way.”
Reviews.Author: Cinag
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star hotel in every way. My husband and I had the wonderful experience of being guests at the Crowne Plaza Rome-St. Peter's for two evenings this May. From the moment we walked into the lobby; we knew we had made the correct choice in a hotel. Besides having an immaculately clean, spacious, tastefully appointed and comfortable room -- the grounds are just beautiful groomed. The staff was helpful and eager to suggest places of interest and things to do while in Rome. The hotel provides a free shuttle service that runs back and forth to town several times a day. What we saved in taxi fares we able to to extend as a tip to the shuttle driver, who was genuinely appreciative to receive. ( We have found in past at other hotels; drivers acted as if they hated people -- they could not smile or speak to the guests.) Not that way at the Crowne Plaza ! As for Front Office staff - they are just the best. I want to especially make mention of Simonetta Bogudi. This woman is amazing, when I first met her -- she had been busy filling guests requests and reservations. When it was my turn --- she greeted me in a very professional and kind manner. Which would be difficult for many other hotel front staff -- the three guests before me in line were rude and very demanding. She did not let them affect her -- you would have thought I was her first guest that day. She was so calm and greeted me with kindess and respect. The Crowne Plaza will be our only choice hotel in the future; and meeting Simonetta played a hugh factor in that decision. We were so impressed that we will be returning for five evenings this month; and back again mid November for about week. Everyone was so kind, we are looking forward to our next stay. The Crowne Plaza will have our business forever !! We have recommended your hotel to others and a couple we told about you just ended a weekend stay on May 22. They thanked us and said if they ever find themselves in Rome again -- you will be their hotel also. Keep up the great job ! Sincerely, Gwyndalyn Cinaglia, from Crisfield, Maryland, USA

Reviews.Title: “good service but no choice”
Reviews.Author: yuyu09
Reviews.Content: we reserved room with balcony but received on the undergr foor without it very goo reception smiling and fast hooskeeping make minimum service..i never see such laizy service before good breakfast but no big choice... quality of food medium cofee s bad. good location, good- free parking very noicy morning time...i heared voice from other room their wack up call etc

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Crowne Plaza, Rome-St Peters exceeded our expextations!!!”
Reviews.Author: BEACHIE311
Reviews.Content: Ending a Smithsonian Tour at the Crowne Plaza, Rome-St Peters, my colleague and I extended our trip to enjoy Rome. The hotel personnel were accommodating in acquiring reservations for the Borghese Museum, and assisting us in our travel plans to Bologna. They welcomed us on our return. The breakfast buffet was extraordinary, the staff friendly and helpful...having the Times newspaper for us each morning was a real treat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TANH
Reviews.Content: Great staff -- bus to center that leaves frequently. Super staff. Friendly and helpful. Restaurant good, but not spectacular. Free Internet. Good workout room. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice !”
Reviews.Author: Heller50
Reviews.Content: We had rough time getting to the hotel from the train station,we had money stolen by our cab driver who was a licensed cabbie #2093. Once at the hotel things went more smoothly.Overall I felt this hotel met our needs . Although, I did think it was a little strange that children were not allowed in the indoor pool. We have a disabled son who is 19 years old and he was warned that he had to be 'peaceful ' in the pool(no jumping in the pool;,ladder only) They have a lot of rules about wearing shower caps and flip-flops as well.Which I thought was kind of funny since one gentlemen was nude in the sauna! We enjoyed our stay and the people who work there were friendly. We found a nearby family run, restaurant Bribante' which we highly recommend! Excellent Italian fare including fresh fish and excellent friendly service by the owner and his capable staff. And it was a short easy walk form the hotel. We ate there three times and noticed that other families from the hotel were there as well. It was a special treat every time!

Reviews.Title: “Friends, Romans and countrymen, avoid this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghMaltman
Reviews.Content: Reading other reviews of this hotel swayed me to book and I spent 4 nights best forgotten if that was only possible. I have just re-read the reviews and I can only conclude that either it is a different hotel or some people are easily pleased. This hotel is a tired, depressing, unlovely piece of 70s architecture with a colour scheme, particularly in the hotel lobbies, that could induce a migraine in sensitive souls, but let's not be too petty and instead, look at the location. One reviewer says it is in the centre of Rome and another says that it is a short stroll to St Peter's; it is in fact 5 and 3 kilometres respectively. The anonymous location is served by a busy and, being Rome, fast urban roadway whose pavements disappear, leaving the pedestrian horrible exposed to Italian driving skills. Anyone with the faintest suicidal notions should avoid the pedestrian option. It is therefore, not surprising that the little shuttle bus was so poular. This runs about every hour to and fro until 10.15pm with a 4 hour break midday. so what's wrong with that I hear you ask; well the combination of a large remotish hotel and a small bus means. as the hotel sign says, first come, first serve, everybody else is left standing on the pavement to wait a further hour or take a 16-17 Euro taxi trip into the centre. Inside, atrocious corridor decor apart, the hotel is generally quite gloomy, with little natural daylight, although the litlle conservatory was quite pleasant. Bedrooms are a decent size and the bed was comfortable and clean, but that smell, a sweet rancid smell reminiscent of putrifaction. Hot water too, was interesting; shower during the day, as most people don't, and you would be rewarded with hot water; shower first thing in the morning and it became an optional extra. The cost of the bedroom and bevarages was steep, but that appears to be Rome for you - no such thing as a credit crunch here, yet. On the plus side the staff were efficient and friendly, but they'd need to be keep this leaky old vessel afloat. In summation, this is a tired hotel, very much aimed at the business sector and tour bus operators, badly in need of renovation and, as an architect, I would be more than happy to help, that way I might find out the cause of that smell.

Reviews.Title: “Will return anytime!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pipesaldarriaga
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel. Although it was a brief stay, we really enjoyed the time very much. The staff was very friendly and courteous, room was very clean and the facilities in general were up to international standards. I just wanted to let you know what a wonderful place this hotel is. The shuttle bus to the city centre is very convenient and there are plenty of them throughout the day so you do not miss any of the venues at anytime.... Needless to say the conveniece of the airport shuttle!!! We really want to thank the hotel and their staff and look forward to staying with you SOON > the near future, >

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, great service, a little removed from the city”
Reviews.Author: DrLuv
Reviews.Content: The crowne plaza was everything you'd expect from this type of property and more. Very modern, very clean, great service with english speaking employees and nice decor. Spacious rooms, particularly for Europe. I would definitely stay here again. The are a few drawbacks, including that it is quite a distance from the airport!! To get there by taxi would exceed 100 Euros I think. The trains can get you close, but you have to take 2 seperate trains, and the second one only runs about every hour and a half. I took a cab from the 2nd train station because I didn't want to wait and it was 14 Euros on the meter, but the schmuck insisted I pay another Euro for having 1 bag. Oy vey. The Hotel does have a shuttle bus, but it only operates 1 time per day. It leaves the hotel at 7:15 am and returns from the Airport at 8 am. Thats it! If you are coming in or leaving at any other time, forget it. The reason is that the same shuttle goes from the hotel downtown and drops you off about 1 mile from the colliseum. It comes back about every 45 mins, so it is a great way to get back and forth to the center of Rome. As long as you understand the operation, you can plan and have an enjoyable experience. At $139 Euros a night, it was a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ljeanw31
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel that really treats its guests well. We arrived early from our flight knowing we would not have a room yet but they accomodated us, gave us a bus schedule into town, explained everything and put up with our fundamental Italian! Very helpful and even arranged a tour for us when ours was canceled unexpectedly. Due to our long flight and long day around Rome, we decided on an early dinner and ate at the hotel. It was really good. The waiter was excellent and funny, explaining how his "mother" cooked our meal just for him, etc. Spent a great night there before our cruise. I would definately go back to this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again for one reason.....”
Reviews.Author: BCtraveler44
Reviews.Content: This is an American style hotel transplanted to Rome. Our room was not ready when we arrived. The hotel was under construction. At one point we had to wade through construction debris. This was not noted on the hotel website nor were we told about it when we checked in. The value of movies and internet for a set price was good. The service in the restaurant can best be described as snooty. The food....transplanted Italian food in America. We had the buffet one night in the restaurant and then were told the kitchen did not want to make any more of the items that they were out of. The same restaurant, at lunch, served a partially frozen pizza. Coundn't believe it. At breakfast the snooty counter person got his guests out of order and then demanded we sit with other customers. The only reason I would return is for the hotel points and the pool for cooling off in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hrachel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 night stay at the Crowne Plaza Rome/St. Peter's. Although this hotel not near the city center, there is a bus stop right outside of the entrance where several buses run daily every 10-15 minutes. The bus system is much better than the metro/subway in Rome b/c right now the metro only has two lines. Take the bus, it will get you wherever you need to go. The hotel had everything that that we needed in terms of modern amenities. We enjoyed our private balcony. Be advised; wifi/internet is NOT free. We paid 25euros for every 72 hours of service. That was my only disappointment with this hotel. The staff were friendly and accommodating. We arrived about 4 hours before check-in and our room was ready with no problems. Front desk staff spoke several languages. The hotel also has a free shuttle service that runs about once an hour until 10p. The shuttle drops you off near Piazza Venezia which is convenient and safe. Pool/spa facilities were beautiful! Yes, you do have to wear a shower cap. Bring your own flip flops and save yourself the 4euros that you'll be charged for a pair of their 'slippers.' This hotel is not really within walking distance to any attractions or restaurants. I supposed you could walk, but there are no sidewalks in places and the road is curvy so it would be dangerous. There is one restaurant right next to the hotel but it is opened only limited hours. By bus, it took about 10 minutes to get to the Vatican daily; and 15 to get to Rome city center. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Updates on Crowne Plaza Rome - 27 Dec 08”
Reviews.Author: supplyguy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four day stay between Christmas and New Year's. Concur with most other reviews with following updates. Yes, hotel is near nothing (St. Peter's Basilica in not within walking distance), but free shuttle bus is pretty good deal. However - the bus holds 33 and is first come first served. Being near the front of the line means little - doors open and its every man for himself. We were three for three, but saw about four or five turned away each day when no seats were left (no standing allowed). Bus departs at 8:45, 10:15, 11:30, 3:00, 4:15, 5:30, 7:45, 9:00, and 10:00. Returns from downtown are 9:15, 10:35, 11:50, 3:15, 4:30, 5:45, 8:10, 9:15, and 10:15. Downtown drop is at Via delie Botteghe Oscure 23, in front of Museum Nazionale Romano Crypt Balbi, a few blocks from Piazza Campidogglio, and a 10 minute walk to the Pantheon in another. We also took the number 881 or 98 bus from directly in front of the hotel to the Cornelia metro, and trained it in from there very easily. Cost is 1 Euro for the bus/train combo for up to 75 minutes. Walked to the metro once (20+ minutes) and to several local restaurants. I don't recommend it with small children - other reviewers were correct that there are small to no sidewalks in most directions from the hotel and I kept nervous watch on my 10 year old as buses and cars whizzed by. We ate at three restaurants near the hotel and enjoyed them all; Arturo's right at the hotel driveway, Birbante, about 10 minutes walk at Via di Bravetta 8/10 [--], and our favorite, a family run place about five minutes beyond Birbante, called al Giardino d'Abruzzo, Via Del Fontanile Arenato 77 ([--]. Dinner for two adults and a child, with a bottle of wine, appetizers, and desserts, ran about 50 EUR at each place. Our rate at the hotel included full breakfast. Decent spread - no omellete chef. Eggs alternated hard or runny. Little bit of everything and no one should go hungry. My standard coke with breakfast was extra - EUR 6.50 one day and EUR 4 the next. I brought my own the next two days and no one complained. Had to bring them from a grocer though. Hotel will sell tokens at the front desk for the one or two coke machines on every floor, and I hit them all only to find that none of them worked. The hotel staff was concerned not at all, and refunded my money but took no action over four days to restock the machines. Room was hot - thermostat and fan blew out hot air at a constant rate only. Desk's recommendation was to open the balcony door to mitigate heat, which we did. Room was otherwise fine (mini-bar, hot water pot and instant coffee, no microwave). Was supposed to get a daily paper as a Priority Club member but that never happened. Late check out of 2pm though worked fine. We arrived from Termini Stazione by cab 25 EUR fare and an excessive and bogus baggage charge I was too tired to fight. We departed via cab to Stazione Trastavere (15 EUR and no baggage charge) and light rail to Fiumicino (EUR 5.50 per person) all in less than an hour. Beat the 70 EUR charge for a hotel shuttle to FCO. All in all I think being out of the downtown area, staying in a familiar brand name hotel, and shuttling in worked best for me. I was uncomfortable with attempts to reserve hotels in Rome through resellers who offered rooms that were never available on hotels' web sites, and reserving a Crowne Plaza room through the Holiday Inn web site delivered no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANGELA,GREECE
Reviews.Content: We arrive in the hotel after almost two weeks in Tuscany in the middle of a terrible storm . we did stay for 7 nights and three more member of the family arrive a day after for a Special occasion (my sister birthday) the place is located in a really nice area with many trees calm and quiet a bit out of Rome (exactly what we were searching for ) our Superior room was good size the internet worked well the staff were great ( especially Angelo Monica and Robert thank you ) the breakfast was really good room service was great the bar was lovely with live music (piano) we did not use at all the shuttle bus as we did have our car. the Osteria have really fresh and good food with good prices for Rome. The pool area was really clean (everyone had to wear a shower cap …?) Rome is lovely we will definitely return and when we will we will stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and convenient”
Reviews.Author: SHADDACalifornia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights stay. Staff wonderful, rooms very comfortable (& clean), great towels, extremely convenient for public transit buses. Very large hotel with many tours, conventions, banquets etc. Hotel food good - as long as you don't order American food! Shuttle bus also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Big Friendly hotel, Not so good location”
Reviews.Author: michelleitalia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in June this year. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.
