Although the location was pretty out from Rome, there was a free coach into city during the day. There are a few restraunts within walking distance, but not much choice. I am going to Rome this month, but staying closer to the city. I would recommend this hotel if you are not planning to spend evenings in Rome (unless you are willing to pay for taxis) as the free coach is quite limited, it only runs about 5 times a day. I didnt use the leisure facilities, although the pool looked very clean and inviting. Nice spacious room with Balcony, ice machines in corridor Overall a good clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Á sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: EMLN
Reviews.Content: Nine days/eight nights in this hotel in Rome: we loved every minute of it! Situated outside the noisy, busy and smelly center of the city: to wake up by the sound of singing birds early morning: a blessing! Sufficient parking space for our (rented) car, a most convenient shuttlebus on the premises, different buses going both directions right outside the hotel driveway and always taxi's available, by simply pushing a button or asking one of the staff: what else does one wish for. Room was excellent, spacious, with a sofa and 2 chairs arranged round a coffeetable, bed was hughe and excellent, bathroom contained everything one needs, closets with big mirrors: more than sufficient to store clothes for such a long period as we stayed. Lovely balcony with bench and stool. Staff very friendly, including Housekeeping: every request was immediately fullfilled. Should we ever return to Rome, we will definately consider this hotel and we can recommend it highly. Some advices: take the 2 bottles of complimentary water and fill them up at one of the many small taps in the city: pure, clear, cold drinking water with excellent taste! A wonderful place to eat: Ristorante Arturo, rightside outside the hotel driveway. Two fantastic trips we made: Tivoli (full day, 3 Villa's + gardens) and Ostia Antica (half day): get to know ancient Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lara021
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nignts in this hotel recently on a recent business trip. I am a frequent traveller to Rome and on many occasions I have stayed in hotels that somehow did not live up to my expectations. As I reluctantly regurgitated my creditcard number over the phone when booking, I thought, well..another Crowne Plaza. However, I was pleasantly suprised. The room was nice, the bed.. ah the bed was marvellous ( I tried to look for the mattress brand in case I can find a similar one at home), the bathroom was clean, and above all there was a balcony complete with a terrace overlooking the tennis court. The room was spacious and careful thoughts were given to the need of a traveller. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They were more than willing to help with directions and timetables for public transport. The restaurant were expensive and not good value for money. The service was slow and slightly frosty. However, an excellent restaurant was literally next door. It served wonderful food, the staff was friendly and the service was excellent. Although the hotel is far from the city centre, the transport link was good. There is a reliable hotel shuttle service to city centre but for those who love adventures and are willing to practice speaking in Italian, the bus stop is right ouside the hotel and there is a frequent service to the metro station, Cornelia for line A metro that takes you directly to city centre including Spagna for shopping. It was an enjoyable hotel stay in Rome and I have to admit, I was not expecting it.

Reviews.Title: “A roman jewel”
Reviews.Author: RiversideGirl
Reviews.Content: we started our holiday in Italy with a 3 night stay at this lovely hotel. The staff were friendly and courteous and the location was not a problem as we took the complimentary shuttle bus into Rome centre with great ease. We enjoyed the spa facilities - excellent facial and massage. A highlight of the hotel was the free tapas served with bar drinks - most excellent!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, so-so location”
Reviews.Author: CleoToo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night with a bus tour, leaving next day for So. Italy. Excellent hotel as far as cleanliness, size of room, amenities, bathroom, etc. However, as many other reviewers have said, it was not an easy walk to sights. We thought we could walk to the Castle St. Angelo, but didn't get far and realized we were uncomfortable on the tiny sidewalk/pathway vs. close-to-us traffic. We know they had a free shuttle to the town centre, but it did not drop people close to our destination. We would have ventured out, but had dinner appointment time with the tour, so not enough time when we didn't know where we were going or how much time was needed. When we left on our tour bus for dinner, we saw how far it was to the Castle and realized we could never have walked it.....not only the distance, but the way to get there. However, another couple of the tour took the free shuttle into Rome and said it was a 20 min. walk from there to the Castle, so if we had another day in Rome, we would have done so. This is a perfect hotel for a stopover or a "just staying for the night til our tour leaves." We would have liked to stayed another day, as we would have taken advantage of the free shuttle and gone into the historic area. We would opt for this very good hotel, with large room at that location, vs. staying close to sights and not having such a good room and amenities, especially since the hotel offered free shuttle into historic area. This was the only hotel on our tour that had tea kettle & coffee maker in our room. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurant, but several people on our tour did -- said the food was excellent and one man raved about a chocolate dessert.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MoeMom
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The location is no problem because their complimentary shuttle bus service into Rome is excellent. And the city bus, which stops near the driveway of the hotel, goes to the Vatican. We also took the complimentary shuttle bus service (departs at 0715) to the airport (FCO) which drops you off outside of Terminal C. We then took the airport shuttle over to T-5 where the check in is for American carriers and El Al. The hotel rooms are fantastic. The beds are fabulous. The bathroom is large. There is a safe that is probably big enough to put most laptops in. There's also a tea kettle with tea and coffee available. And a mini bar which also has space in case you need to put something in it. Our room overlooked the pool area, and we had no problem with noise. The balcony was wonderful, too. There is a flat screen TV with 4 or 5 English channels. Every hotel employee I talked to was very helpful and polite. We were able to check in a few hours early, which was great after a transatlantic flight. There is a business center available, but it costs 5 Euros for one hour of internet use. We had dessert and coffee in the restaurant one evening. Not worth it at all. Expensive and bland. The restaurant near the bus stop (turn right at the end of the hotel's driveway) was great. Very reasonable prices, and the service was excellent. Our waiter was a charmer. I would not hesitate to stay here again when I visit Rome. I thought the location would be a drawback, but it wasn't at all.

Reviews.Title: “loads of sunloungers what a treat .”
Reviews.Author: pinkgizmo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3days at this hotel. well first for the good points the hotel bed room was clean and there is a small balcony and a huge comfy bed. The hotel shuttel bus is free and takes you into the centre of Rome and drops you off and picks you up later. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and there was plenty of sunloungers to choose from to sit down at which is rare with most city hotels. The bad was the hotel shuttel bus has an option of 5.30pm bus or a 7.45pm but nothing inbetween so its either eat really early or really late so we would go early and have a few drinks first in a bar. The prices at the pool were ridicolous 8euros for a coke and a water which would be appropriate if you were at a 5star hotel in Rome overlooking the vatican but this was an out of town hotel with rather shabby halls as they were decorating and I herd lots of guests complaining of overpriced restaraunt with terrible food so we gave the restaraunt a miss. We did have room service one night of a club sandwich which was ok but you cant really go wrong with a club sandwich. There is a shuttle to the airport but not to Campiono airport so its 40euros in a taxi but if you use the hotel taxi service its 65 ruro !! This hotel was ok but to be honest if went back would stay in city only as if you get in at say 11am you either stay out all day and get back at 9pm feelung hot ,dirty and tired or you have the hassel of bus in and out again ect at least if you are in town you can go back shower change and go out later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: cleator
Reviews.Content: As others have stated the hotel is not ideally central. However, they have a large shuttle bus now that travels fairly frequently in to the centre and it works well. We stayed for 2 nights at the end of July as a family with 2 rooms which were superb. The front desk staff were amongst the best I have come across anywhere in the world. Overall, I would recommend this hotel providing you don't mind being a little out of the centre. You can also catch the metro but think it is a bit of a walk to/from the station. The Metro is really easy to use in Rome - buy your tickets at a newspaper stand near or at the station - a one way ticket costs 1 euro. Good value and efficient. We caught a taxi from St Peter's Square back to the hotel (the hotel shuttle bus doesn't go there - it goes past it but doesn't drop off) on one occasion and it cost about 13 euros - to give you an idea. The hotel was let down by their restaurant. We had lunch on arrival. Service was slow. There is one guy who swans around as if he owns the place (maybe he does!) He fronts it but that's the extent of his role. Then there was another guy behing a podium at the entrance. He didn't seem to do much either. Another supervisor type seemed to be adding the same amount of value and then there were the waitresses doing all the work - not many of them either. A waitress with an Italian/USA accent rescued the waitressing situation and seemed to be carrying the whole place - until she went off shift! The front man, podium man and superviser type could improve the efficiency of this restaurant no end if they would only work flexibly! The food was okay and not too expensive given the class of the hotel. But, don't let this put you off. There are 3 restaurants close by and they are much cheaper than those you find in the centre of the city. There is one right next door to the hotel - down the drive turn right. Others have commented how good this is. However, the owner sadly died the day before we arrived so it was closed while we were there. There are 2 other restaurants also close by but about a 5-8 minute walk. They are Birbante - turn left out of the hotel and walk along to the junction about 500 metres away and turn left. It is then in front of you on the right. The pavement towards the junction is narrow (single file only) so be careful and especially when crossing the road to the restaurant. The hotel will book you a table. Others have commented here with not very favourable remarks but we thought it was okay. A third one just a bit further on is the Giardino D'Abruzzo. Hotel will also book you a table here. This seemed to be full of locals. Service was a bit slow but it was okay too. So, you have a choice of 3 restaurants within easy reach - but don't get stressed out by the service - you have to get used to it in Italy in most places. The hotel has a great outdoor pool too. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Food, Nice Spa, Far away from anywhere”
Reviews.Author: adamscotland
Reviews.Content: We arrived after paying the driver of the Mercedes cab €60 this was the cost from the Champion airport to the hotel, email the hotel and they can pre-book it for you. Before booking i used the special request via alpharooms and asked for a quiet room and NOT to have an adjoining room. Went to our room which was the second one next to the elevator, facing the pool and guess what an adjoining room. We swiftly got moved to the front of the hotel which was quite and had a larger room. The room was 424. The rooms are fine nothing amazing the beds are very comfy for Italy and we were happy and therefore settled in. We were annoyed to find that after 9pm the buffet bar was closed and in order for me to get a beef burger we had no other choice but to order room service. This is mad room service Coke is €6.50 and the mini bar its €5 and in the landing it is €2 if you really are rich enough to pay that extra €4.50 euro for someone to chap your door and hand it to you i guess you should be thinking charity. Well the coke machine swallowed my token i had to get from the cashiers desk so i had to get a new one from them, they said if it has red lights on next to your choice it means its empty, so does that mean it its empty half the time. On our second night we had to order room service again and ordered The large mixed meat dish at €25 they said it would come in 20mins after several calls it came in 1hour and 10minutes time. It was cold so i sent it back and got a new one, now please don’t think what i am about to say is exaggerated never in my life have i had a meal drenched in so much oil it was rotten, you know what i left 70% of it in the hall it was rotten. I have to say though the burgers are really nice so 10/10. Anyway check your bill as they charged us twice for a meal we already paid for in cash to the room service man. Internet is €5 for hour and it cant be used again so if you check an email its costing you €5. Staff unfortunately are not the most friendliest people in the world not as friendly as us Scots, it seems if you ask one question you get a smile ask two you get a frown, i didn’t dare ask a third. Getting to the shopping area is very easy you walk straight out the hotel turn right get the No:889 bus to the Corlinnia tube station and then the tube to Spagna thats where Gucci, Replay and all the other big shops are. The little Restaurant everyone talks about on the right hand side was closed so if you take a left and at the top of the hill there is a find Italian restaurant there full of locals. The SPA Its FREE its lovely, now out of all the hotels in the world and in the UK i have been all over i have never been told to wear a see through cap on my head when in the swimming pool and Jacuzzi i was told to wear this, my hair is about 1cm long a crew cut my hairs on my arms, legs, chest are long and i get told to wear a cap, What is the matter with you Crowne Plaza Rome? So in all Okay hotel, good pool, boring lobby bad for snacks you have no choice but to go to there fancy restaurant so be warned French fries in the room are €9. I hope this has been helpful to you Adam from Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkey_madnessUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights last week. I found it to be above my expectations. The rooms were large and had been recently refurbished with free water and small chocolates each day plus clean towels and shampoo etc... They also have a complementary safe and fridge which does have the usual contents for a mini bar but they could be removed overnight to keep water cool for use the next day. The pool was great and with towels supplied by the hotel although these had to be obtained from the life guard as room towels were not allowed. The pool bar was also good for lunch time snacks however the prices were a bit expensive especially for drinks. Breakfast was very good i would recommend to save money only getting the 9 euro one as it includes everything but the eggs, bacon and sausages (hot food). Staff at the hotel were friendly, informative and spoke good english. When we arrived they explained the bus services and where to get the metro to the town if we did not want to use the complementary shuttle. The metro and bus tickets are only 1 euro for 75 minutes of travel including one metro journey which is an inexpensive way to get around Rome and the bus stop was right outside the hotel. If you did not want to eat in the hotel or travel all the way out to the centre of Rome there is a place just outside the hotel which serves good food at reasonable prices it may seem a little quiet until about 7.30 ish so unless you want to be one of the only two tables it is better to wait a bit. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like a break away but maybe not sightseeing all holiday as it may be better to stay somewhere a bit closer.

Reviews.Title: “Poor gym/spa expeience”
Reviews.Author: dylan8
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip last week and stayed in the hotel. The outdoor pool was great. However I was disappointed in the gym as it had no air conditioning and since Rome is already hot and humid, working out was a major challenge. More disappointing however was the attitude of the spa staff. They did not speak English and were not at all client oriented. They did not seem very interested in my business or in responding to my basic requests. I had reserved two spa treatments. I cancelled the second and almost didn't pay for the first since it did not meet even the minimum standard that I would expect from a spa in a major hotel in an international city. I would think twice before staying there, even if they do have a shuttle bus into town.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - good transport to City”
Reviews.Author: Bialykot
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here and thought the hotel was a good example of other Crowne Plazas I've stayed in. The room was a large standard one with two double beds and a (smallish) bathroom / toliet, well-furnished (eg LCD TV, additional seats, desk), safe for valuables (no additional charge) and fridge. There was a small balcony - great for early morning coffee. Air conditioning was generally good (but would have been nice if it went slightly cooler, since there was a heatwave when I was there - mid-30s every day). Ice machines were available on every floor. The maids always prepared the room very well each day and there were no problems getting extra bottles of water or towels from them at any time. The pool area was large and very clean with a lifeguard always present to help out with things like sun loungers and moving parasols around. Kids were allowed into the pool (some have reported that under-16s not allowed - not true). (I did not use the indoor pool so can't comment on that). The staff were very courteous and helpful (and patient with some of the tourists who asked some incredibly dumb questions in my opinion). There were some good floodlit tennis courts as well. The hotel is on a busy road (but set back in its own gardens) and there was a restaurant (Arturo's) next door with some shops about 1/2 mile to the left (cross the road near the restaurant for these as the path by the hotel is quite narrow and Italian drivers are a little mad). A shuttle bus (free) made the 15 min trip into the centre of Rome and back again about 6 times a day (last trip back from Rome was at 10:15pm). The bus was always on time and was an excellent service in general. Costs for drinks etc... were expensive - in keeping with Rome in general. The weak exchange rate made this seem even worse - so I purchased wine and beer from nearby shops and kept these in the fridge - problem solved. There was a good bus service from right outside the hotel and Ii used this to visit the Vatican (10 mins away by bus). Reception sold bus tickets and helped with bus timetables. I can't understand some of the poor comments here regarding this hotel (especially since they're more about location and exchange rates). I thought it was very clean and well-appointed. Don't be put off by it not being in the City Centre - the minimal effort to walk onto the shuttle bus and be in Rome 15 mins later is not exactly hard to do. In some respects it was good to get away from the hustle and bustle of the noisy city at the end of a day.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN ROIME”
Reviews.Author: whiteSox2005
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Crowne Plaza St. Peters in Rome on points on June 12-13, 2008. The staff all spoke English and all the rooms are refurbished. The rooms had modern bathrooms and 5 englsig channels on TV. The free bus to Rome was great. The only thing we forgot was a converter for electric for the laptops. The hotel has three computers with internet and a color printer in the business center. I recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: tryanythingonce
Reviews.Content: I was here for work, part of a conference team. I had stayed twice before, and the issues were the same each time. Check In I had no problems, but one of my colleages had to wait for 5 hours beyond the 3pm check in time to get access to his room. In any hotel in the US, this night would have been comped, but in Rome? No chance! The desk can get VERY busy as the hotel caters for conferences, tour groups and big groups coming off the cruise ships. It is a big hotel and the check in desk is not staffed properly. However, the staff are very sweet, and deal with large numbers of annoyed customers with a smile. Rooms Very very good. Comfortable, well designed, very large and all with a furnished balcony. Excellent beds, flat screen TV, loads of pillows, efficient aircon, large bathroom. Really nothing to complain about except the fact that when the hotel is full, housekeeping just can't keep up. They have very high standards and therefore, on three occaisions in a 6 night stay, the room was not serviced before 6pm. However, standards of cleanliness are exemplary. Facilities Really good spa, very nice large outdoor pool, well kept pretty gardens, pleasant bar with nicely furnished outdoor terrace (not enough staff when the hotel is full - you can wait AGES for a drink) taxi rank on site, good shop, and two good restaurants. A tip.... Arturo Restaurant at th end of the drive is really very good Overall The hotel is miles from Rome, but there is a courtesy bus. Taxis cost from €10 to €20 to get to the centre depending on traffic, which can be appalling. There is no way you would want to walk to the city - too far and the hotel is located on a traffic ratrun, with very very narrow pavements. Breakfast was comprehensive, but often very busy and not refuelled quick enough. This is not a cheap hotel and many fellow delegates at the conference felt it was not good value. However, if you don't mind the commute to Rome and want to retreat to a VERY comfortable room in an away from it all hotel with lots of facilities, then if you don't mind the cost, this is a competent bet.

Reviews.Title: “great for last night in Rome”
Reviews.Author: saweb123
Reviews.Content: Hotel had many American-style amenities (large room and bathroom, flat screen TV with satellite). It was a great place to spend our last night in Rome - the shuttle bus from the town center was easy to catch to take out to the hotel. Note that the hotel is not within walking distance to any of the major sites, but there are many city buses that you can catch practically at the hotel entrance. There is also a free shuttle bus to the FCO airport - it only makes one trip in the morning, but it was very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Dull”
Reviews.Author: SassieSue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of nowhere, and about 15-20 minutes to the centre of Rome. We found the shuttle bus that runs throughout the day, fine and was always on time. It drops you off at a central point in town, so be prepared to walk. If you wish to visit the Vatican it would be too far to walk from the shuttle bus drop off point though. There is a bus stop on the road outside of the hotel and you can purchase bus cards from the hotel reception area and hop on the bus direct to the Vatican. The hotel was quite bland, my room was very dark and very average. The hotel corridors were also dark, but I think they are in the process of decorating . The breakfast at the hotel was very nice, and you sit in a conservatory which was light and airy and very pleasant. The restaurant at night was very expensive, there is another buffet option but we found the food bland. There is nowhere near the hotel to eat apart from Arthuros to the right of the hotel, which was pleasant enough, but not exceptional. You are a bit stuck unless you wish to either stay in Rome centre, or get another shuttle bus back out to the centre at night. We stayed at this hotel with our 2 children, there is nothing to do for them, they could not use the outside pool and the indoor pool children are not allowed. There is tennis courts at the side of the hotel which is okay. But after a day sightseeing nothing really for them to do. This hotel is not in a good location and very very average, although the front of the hotel does look pretty at night as they have fairy lights in the trees which look lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy Location and NOT a hotel for Kids”
Reviews.Author: Ant_Jack
Reviews.Content: Enough has been already mentioned in these reviews about the hotels remote location and it's misleading name giving the impression it is nearer the city than it actually is. However, I must also add here that although the hotel is clean and modern it is in no-way child friendly. We travelled with our two children aged ten and nine and chose the hotel as it stated it had both an indoor and outdoor pool that they may use in the evenings after long days of sight seeing. However, as we were attempting to go for a dip we were quite abruptly told that the pool is for over 16's only. There are no other facilities available to amuse younger children so were left to spend the evenings in our room. Added to the fact that the hotel is on a busy road with no footpaths and little lighting then even short walks from the hotel with children are quite dangerous. On the night we arrived we asked the concierge to recommend a nearby restaurant as having looked at the menu for the hotel restaurant we discovered very high prices. He directed us to one a few hundred yards away down an extremely busy and poorly lt road called Bribante - the food and service here was very poor. The next night, by chance, we discovered Arturos which was next door to the hotel, filled with local families (always a good sign) and was a much better restaurant indeed - we wondered why the concierge had directed us further away to an obviously worse restaurant. Perhaps Arturos provides some competition to the Crowne Plazas own restaurant. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone travelling with a family - try to find one nearer the city centre - even if there are less facilities at least you'll be able to leave to find something to do.

Reviews.Title: “We have no complaints”
Reviews.Author: davidrc517
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Rome for our 5 year anniversary. We're both mid-twenties. I'm sure some of you might be scared on how to get here because it is outside of the heart of Rome but it's pretty easy. I know I was a little nervous. This is how: Once you get to Fiumicino, you take the train to Tremini. Then take metro A towards Battistini and get off at Cornelia. We got there at night so it was kind of confusing. You have to look around the corner and there's a huge row of buses lined up. The website says to take 889 but we got there sunday night so we had to take the 98 to get to the hotel. It does take work to get there, but it's really not that hard. The actual hotel is nice. The workers are extremely friendly and at your service. They all speak English well so there was never any miscommunication. The room was big. The bed was huge and our room had a 20" flat screen tv. What's also sweet is coming home from a long day of walking and going to the basement where you can go swimming, hit the jacuzzi, go in the sauna and even take a turkish bath. It's very clean and modern looking and it will definitely relax you. If you need to surf the internet, it only costs 5 euro for an hour which is pretty fair. I've seen a lot of people complain about the free shuttle but we never had a problem. It leaves almost every hour and takes you right where you need to be in Rome. It also picks up at the exact right time so if you're there, you'll never miss it. Everything in Rome is pretty much within walking distance (at least for us) from where the shuttle drops you off. Coloseo, Victor Emmanuel, Campo de Fiori, Piazza Navona are all within 15 mins walking. Vatican City isn't close from the shuttle but then you can just take the bus from the busstop right outside the hotel. The point of going to Rome is to be out and about experiencing all the different areas so you really shouldn't need to go to your hotel until you're done for the day. Thus, the Crown Plaza's location outside of Rome was an absolute non-negative for us. We loved it and we loved Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, adequate location”
Reviews.Author: RickersScotland
Reviews.Content: To be honest, there's little for me to add to the countless reviews of this hotel already on this site. The hotel is very clean and modern, the room had recently been renovated and was very nice indeed - view of the tennis courts didn't inspire me to exercise sadly, but it was a pleasant place to sit in the evening sunshine. The breakfast was fantastic, and was sufficient that we didn't need to stop for lunch on any of the days we were there ! This is not so much a financial benefit as a time-saving benefit; we had 4 pretty full days of sightseeing, and probably still didn't get to see 1/4 of what Rome has to offer. I pre-booked a breakfast-inclusive rate, so the cost of the breakfast wasn't an issue. Drinks in the hotel bar were excessively expensive, but hey-ho, we were on holiday in Rome and I was under no illusions that this was going to be an exercise in economical city visiting !! The courtesy bus was handy, but taxis are the way to go. I pre-booked a Merc to collect us from Fiumicino and take us back, which was fantastic -- lower prices than airport taxis, and no danger of being fleeced ! I found all of the hotel staff to be very courteous and helpful throughout, and could not fault any of them. As mentioned by many others, the restaurant immediately next door ( Arthuro's) was fantastic -- definitely a must to visit, but closed on Mondays. Open-top bus tour was good value, but it doesn't stop particularly close to many of the sights -- a lot of legwork still required. Enjoyed a fantastic guided tour of the Vatican, by a company called Eden Tours, whom I found via Trip Advisor -- it was a fantastic tour, and I would recommend the company (and especially our guide Grant) to anyone. All in all, a great first trip to Rome -- the hotel's location may not please some, but there are Holiday Inn Express nearer the centre of Rome with NO facilities AT ALL, who charge considerably more -- I gues it depends what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Not Crowne Plaza St Peters”
Reviews.Author: mattba
Reviews.Content: I think Crowne Plaza St. Peters has a nerve to call themselves Crowne Plaza St Peters. it is no where near St. Peter's. Having said that, the hotel was okay. I didn't like the construction going on early in the morning and the breakfast was was overpriced. The nice thing is the hotel has a free shuttle to take you to the center of town. Watch out for the taxi drivers, they will try and cheat you. Negociate your price before you get into the taxi. Do not attempt to walk downtown from the hotel. The streets are very narrow and you will get run down. Stay closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not Exactly AT St. Peter's”
Reviews.Author: WynneWoody
Reviews.Content: The name of this hotel is a bit misleading. It is a cab-ride away from St. Peter's. Unless you are up for a hike (and a not so pleasant one, at that), it's not within walking distance. That said, we stayed here during a major renovation project, and they had slashed the room rates, due to the construction. Since we weren't planning to spend much time in the hotel anyway, and since they promised that the work would go on only between the hours of 8:00 and 17:00 every day, we thought, what the heck? We'll save a few Euros. They were true to their word about the construction, and we weren't disappointed with the decision, but I have to say that, if I were paying the rates that they are charging now, after completion of the renovation, I would probably not feel the same way. I'm sure the renovation improved the look of the place, once it was complete, but it's still not in a convenient location - something the renovation couldn't fix - and it's just not special enough to make me think I will want to go back and pay full price. I'd rather pay a little more and be closer in, or pay even more still and be at the Cavalieri Hilton. Now that's a hotel that's in an inconvenient location, but well worth the trouble. The restaurant at the Crowne Plaza was lackluster, and the rooms were pretty average. Even though it's nowhere near the airport, it reminded me a little of a typical airport hotel, of the sort in which, as a frequent business traveler, I've spent more than my fair share of nights. On the plus side, the staff were quite friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WSR124
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at the Crown Plaza and we had a wonderful time. The hotel was in a great location. It was close to the Vatican and relatively close to the city. This is obtainable by taking the free courtesy bus which drops you off and picks you up at the center of town. From this point, most tourist atttraction and shopping are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value city break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SouthLanarkshireAnne
Reviews.Content: Before going to the hotel we read very mixed reviews on this site about the hotel. We are however now very relieved to disagree with them! The hotel was immaculately clean and tidy. The room was very spacious with very modern decor. Staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and quick to respond to our needs. The spa was a fantastic way to relax after a busy day. It looks fairly new and has a spacious sauna, steam room, jacuzzi plus more. As well as the swimming pool and gym. It too was very clean and well maintained. The hotel is approx 15 mins from the centre of Rome therefore the courtesy shuttle bus was great for transporting us to and from the centre. There were about 8 buses to and from each day which was more than enough for us. The same distance cost approx 10 euros in a taxi. Drink prices in the hotel were comparable to elsewhere in rome. We didn't ever go for breakfast, which was 18 euros for an american breakfast. A taxi rank is located in the hotel grounds which was handy too. There was live music in the bar each evening which was nice to end the day with. We really had a fantastic break in this hotel and would definately recommend it to anyone. It was approx £300 for 4 nights stay for 2 people, which we consider to be very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendy1997
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza St.Peters for 2 nights. Very surprised at the size of the hotel. Much bigger than what we had in mind. The reception staff were very helpful in explaining how the tour bus and their courtesy bus routes work. Rooms were great! King bed with clean white covers and fluffy pillows. Bathrooms are bright and clean. Many white, fluffy towels and bath robes. Tea and coffee making facilities available and also 5 English channels to choose from. Definitely made the best decision in booking this hotel. I'm sure the rooms nearer the Spanish Steps are probably half the size of what the Crowne Plaza have to offer. And probably double the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Who is this hotel for?”
Reviews.Author: bomaolciarain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nowhere near St Peter's-it is out in the countryside. It is nearly impossible to walk the nearby streets-little or no footpaths with terrible traffic. The hotel has a rarely running shuttle bus to town-it has only one pick up daily at the airport. On the website it advertises two pools;one outdoors and one indoors. The outside pool isclosed during the winter months-fair enough. However the indoor one was also closed during my stay(Jan 08)-also the advertised spa was closed. The hotel itself is not bad but is full of meetings. The hotel is completely unsuitable for families-no real facilities and the meals are quite expensive. Apart from group meetings-I cannot imagine who this hotel is aimed at-will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, overpriced, not cool!”
Reviews.Author: lovemuneca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under renovation; expect it to be dusty, loud and with severe paint odors. Customer service is poor and they will charge you outrageous prices per person, per anything you request, i.e. milk cost at the snack bar € 9.00, not reasonable at all. Public transportation is available; you need to do a couple of connections before getting anywhere. However, the hotel offers a shuttle bus to the center of town, that’s probably the only good thing about this place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but extortionate prices”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1310
Reviews.Content: We chose the Crowne Plaza as we wanted a hotel with a swimming pool, which seem to be few and far between in Rome. We found a great internet deal so the room itself was not expensive but sadly the hotel is a bit of a con, with extortionate prices charged for food and drink (£4.50 for a can of coke, £26 for breakfast). Although the hotel's redeeming features - its lovely, quiet outdoor pool and a relaxing indoor spa go some way to redress the balance. Unfortunately the staff were not particularly helpful and the service and food in the restaurant was abysmal, but thankfully there is a fantastic local restaurant next door which serves amazing pasta. The hotel is pretty far from the centre of Rome, but there are several bus stops right outside and tickets can be bought in the hotel reception, making it easy to get in and out of the centre. I did enjoy my stay in the hotel, mainly because of the pool facilities and nice bedrooms (with huge, comfortable beds) but I wouldn't go back there without taking out a second mortgage to afford their ridiculous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: Drumnaconagher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Feb 07 for a long weekend break with my partner. The hotel is not easy to find by public transport. We took a bus from the airport, then took the underground metro to the nearest station, and then had a fifteen minute walk to the hotel. The road leading to from the hotel is dangerous, very busy and very narrow in some parts. There is a bus stop outside the hotel, but the public transport system of Rome can be confusing especially if you do not speak Italian. On arrival at the hotel check in was excellent, and the room was large, clean and had excellent views. We found the service in the bar, and lounge areas when busy were very poor or non existent, be prepared to wait. The guest facilities are excellent and in keeping with the standards associated with Crowne Plaza hotels. The location of the hotel is poor with the name of St Peters in the title being a little mis-leading. You have to take a bus, metro or taxi to the center of Rome which is about 3.5 miles away. The hotel reception does not recommend walking to the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take your family here”
Reviews.Author: msod
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome for a long weekend with our daugthers 10 and 13. Had booked Crowne Plaza specifically because of the indoor pool. However, on checking in we were advised that children under 16 were not allowed to use it, even when accompanied by parents. The reception clerck was very insistent that this was our fault and we should have read the fine print. 5 minutes after getting to our room we get a phone call from the same reception to advise us that there is an additional charge for 4 occupants in the room. In fact, that is exactly what we had booked and paid for , but another 5 minutes was spent again trying to convince us that we had made a mistake. I must say that about 10 minutes after having arrived it felt very much as a mistake to have booked this hotel at all. Well, we have stayed on , overall hotel is ok but nothing special. Restauarant food is bland, good breakfast, wine list good value. Would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Fair value”
Reviews.Author: LeedsGlobalman
Reviews.Content: Friendly and professional staff. Nice pool, clean spacious bedroom. Nice spa. Only let down, restaurant menu lacking in choice, and my pizza was fairly poor, but the buffet food looked good. Bar area was fairly bog standard but pleasant. They should have more than one shuttle a day to the airport. Good hotel, but for £160 per night I wouldn't expect any less.

Reviews.Title: “Put up here on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Fridaysmom
Reviews.Content: I recently was put up here while attending a convention at a nearby hotel. I arrived from the states around 10:30 a.m. and was hoping to check in early and get some sleep. I was told that the room wasn't ready and that I might have to wait until 3 pm (regular check-in time), but eventually managed to get into the room around 11:30. The room was quite large, with two double beds, and I can't complain about it. It suited my needs completely. The hotel doesn't have a lot of charm and caters to many tour groups. At first I was put off by the distance from the city, but the free shuttle bus that they run and local buses that leave from very close to the hotel make it an easy venture into town. I usually took the local bus in (2 Euros) and returned by the hotel shuttle (which drops off and leaves from a very central location in the city). You need to carefully time your trips though if you want to come back via shuttle, as they come back only at 6 pm or 10 pm. Internet access from the room was very pricy, at 15 Euros for 24 hours. I therefore opted to buy wireless access cards for 5 Euros, which gave you 30 minutes of access time (still a rip-off). I had vouchers for the hotel restaurant, and I wouldn't recommend eating there unless you are really desperate (or can get a free meal, as I could). We ate outside and the environment was quite pleasant, but the food was really over-priced and not that great. The service was also quite slow (typical for dinner to last 2 hours) and they usually messed up with at least one item ordered. There is another restaurant adjacent to the hotel, which may provide better food and atmosphere, but I didn't eat there. Other than these 2 restaurants, I didn't see many other nearby options. The hotel is situated in an area that is pretty devoid of other services. If I had to pay for accommodations in Rome, this would not be a first choice, although if you are looking for a fairly large room and access to a nice pool then the hotel may be for you. I did not find the distance to town to be a major deterrent , but the hotel does lack in having much old world charm or hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Holiday Inn in a bad location”
Reviews.Author: syland
Reviews.Content: From the pictures and reviews we read, this hotel seemed nice enough, but we were sorely disappointed. The hotel is located far from the center of town, making it costly and inconvenient to get to most of the sites we wanted to see. That might have been overlooked if it had been beautiful, but it was ordinary and dull, the hallways were unairconditioned, and the lobby was uninviting. It was reminescent of a place one might stay with a teen travel group - definitely not what we were looking for. The hairs on the floor on the bathroom (as soon as we arrived) were somewhat off-putting.

Reviews.Title: “Think again!”
Reviews.Author: Moomincouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for one week with our two small children, aged 5 and 7 for our summer holiday. The rooms were ok, sort of standard Holiday Inn size and facilities. But we experienced some serious problems in the hotel: an expensive designer dress disappeared from our room and the management offered inadequate compensation for this, the swimming pool had many restrictions (e.g. no diving or jumping, even some noise by the children was forbidden), and the restaurant was terribly overpriced. The hotel is located near the Vatican, but too far away from the centre to walk. We will not use this hotel again for future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good experience”
Reviews.Author: dixiesong3131
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first night of our honeymoon at the Crowne Plaza before departing on our cruise. We arrived before check in began and were given a room immediately. The room was clean and staff was polite (always said "hello" in the hallways). Checking out was also easy, and they held our bags while we toured the Vatican before our cruise ship connection. non hotel related tip: don't be afraid to go walking in the area due to the narrow sidewalks. we took a left out of the hotel and found cheap, cheap wine and the best gelato in Rome not even a ten minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: ebusby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 5 nights at the end of June. I would stay here again - no complaints. I picked it mainly because of the pool - very important when traveling with kids, especially if you want them to do a lot of sightseeing. We spent some time each afternoon at the pool and then went back downtown for dinner and more sights. The pool is WONDERFUL and so is the lifeguard there. We did end up using cabs a lot, which got expensive, but was the easiest way to get around. The staff at the front desk was always helpful with a recommendation or a reservation. I relied on them daily for advice on something or other and they always took the time to assist me and were very friendly. They recommended the restaurant Il Polese - great choice. Breakfast is overpriced, we avoided it when possible. The hotel was a bit of a retreat in a schedule overflowing with sights to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: cam405
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel principally because it had a pool and as we were travelling with kids and thought it would be a good way to cool off after the days sightseeing. However the pool was far too deep to be suitable for kids with the shallowest point being 140cm. The deepest end of the pool was approx 3m. There was a splash pool but no use for swimming. The hotel is a bit out of the way as has been previously mentioned but the hotel does offer a free shutltle service to St Peters and the main airport. The service - although infrequent - was welcome as the alternative was usually very busy busses or taxi drivers who add a few euros onto the fare by either changing the category of the flat charge (increased flat fares only apply for holidays and sundays) or inflating the final fare by hitting a magic button. The fare to St Peters square should be ~ 7.50 euros. Needless to say the taxi drivers who inflated the price got no tip - Principle. We walked a lot on this holiday but walking to St Peters square from the hotel is not an option. The roads do not always have pavements and the roads can be quite narrow. We tried it on our first day and turned back. There is not a lot within walking distance of the hotel. Turn right at the exit from the hotel and there is a resturant which is fine - but not everynight. We did not try the hotel resturant so can't comment too pricey with kids. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant. The standard of the room was fine and the range of food available for breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked It”
Reviews.Author: GoldenBears
Reviews.Content: Our group of seven had an enjoyable three night stay at the Crowne Plaza after touring Tuscany. The rooms are comfortable and modern. The staff is helpful....at least by Italian standards. We did not try the hotel restaraunt, but there are (at least) two good restaraunts within a short walking distance. If you feel like staying at an American-style holel while in Rome, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: CTCTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs to get itself by the scruff of the neck, redecorate and raise its service standards. The lobby is gloomy and grubby, although the reception staff are as friendly and helpful as they can be when they have to deal with hoards of tourists. The rooms are just about acceptable but not very welcoming. If I didn't have to eat and drink in the Hotel, it would probably pass muster - just - but the food and beverge outlets are poor. The main bar area has deplorable and slow service but the restaurants (with the exception of the breakfast room which is OK) are a real nightmare. The problem is the waiter service - food is OK but I can honestly say that, in all the hotels I have stayed in Worldwide (and thats a lot) the restaurant service here is as surly and bad as you can get. It will always get business because its Crowne Plaza Hotel near the Centre of Rome but it doesn't deserve to.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start”
Reviews.Author: colnmike
Reviews.Content: We started our holiday in Italy at this hotel. After a very long flight it was a relief to collapse into comfortable beds in a well appointed room. The staff was very helpful. We thought the breakfast was a little steep at 9 Euros for a continental breakfast but it turned out to have a lot of food and we never left hungry. The biggest drawback was the shuttle service in to Rome. There were two trips a day to the Vatican but they had cancelled the service into the center of the city. We ended up having to take the train or the bus but that wasn't too difficult. We also found the shuttle to the airport was very infrequent - we weren't able to make use of it.

Reviews.Title: “Geat hotel as long as you eat elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Tasi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights prior to taking a med cruise. The room was great, the front desk service was brilliant BUT the service in the restaurants (excluding breakfast) was non-existent. They were rude, not helpful and the price was ridiculous. Although the breakfast was pricey we found the wait staff very helpful (mostly). We would stay again but we would not eat at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel in suburban Rome”
Reviews.Author: Thederg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza, St Peters on 23 April 2007 for 4 nights. When we arrived in Rome we made our own way to the hotel, by taking the Terravision bus from the Campino airport to Termini train station. (At the airport we were told that this bus goes every 20 minutes but we had to wait about 2 hours in the midday sun for this bus) I would not recommend it. Registered taxi drivers should not charge any more than 30 euros. We then got the Metro line to Cornelia and took a taxi from there to the hotel. (10 euros including tip). As you can gather from having to take all this transport the hotel is definitely not in central Rome. In fact it’s about 15-20 minutes on the bus to the Vatican and that not at busy spells. We found the complimentary bus to the Vatican satisfactory although we did have to take taxis 3-4 times as well. Please note that if there are large tour parties staying at the hotel and the complimentary bus is full, the bus will leave as soon as it is full, so it is wise to be early. We were staying in a standard room which was below standard. There were a few hair cracks in the sink and part of the shower handle kept falling off when we went to turn it on. Not what you expect from a 4 star. There were no bath robes and we had to ask for them, which was a bit disappointing. The room was spacious and clean and the bed very comfortable. The air conditioning was extremely useful and worked perfectly. We did go for a swim in the indoor pool which was a wonderful and relaxing experience. At the leisure complex when we asked for swimming hats we were given shower caps and flip flops and these were free. We also sat outside by the outdoor pool and relaxed after a days sightseeing which was bliss. The water felt too cold to venture in but the pool was clean and off a high standard. Food in the bar was good and really not badly priced around 60 euros for a full meal for 2. Although we did find the drinks at the bar were expensive, 8 euros for a pint of beer. We didn’t eat in the restaurant as it was over priced and the menu didn’t quite appeal to us. We were booked on a room only basis and we didn’t have breakfast in the hotel but our friends did and their overall impression was that the breakfast buffet had a great variety but overpriced at 18 euros. We found a nice little inexpensive coffee shop in the little shopping area just left of the entrance out of the hotel about ½ mile up. Also there is a great little deli type shop selling a vide variety of fine wine, olives, cheeses, sun dried tomatoes etc. If you decide to go to the shopping area, please cross the road just outside the hotel as this road is extremely busy and Italian drivers are maniacs. We did see a girl getting hit by a car on a Zebra crossing and she had to be taken away in an ambulance. This was extremely disturbing and very scary. We did eat twice in Arthuros next door to the Crowne Plaza. The staff were really friendly and the food and wine excellent and very reasonably priced. On our last night there were 5 adults and 2 children and we all had main courses, some puddings, drinks which consisted of 2 large bottles of wine,1 beer, 2 cokes and the bill was around 100 euros. We congratulated the staff on the beautiful food and they sent us out a bottle of champagne and some other tasty sweet treats and even posed with us for photographs. A definite highlight and perfect end to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but location not so good”
Reviews.Author: Sam715
Reviews.Content: We've just returned after staying here for 4 nights from 15-19 May and had a brilliant time in Rome. Although we did a lot of walking, this hotel is still far too out of the way. There is no public transport to Ciampiano Airport and a taxi cost 40 Euros there and 50 Euros back. There is a metro station 20 mins away but you can't walk there as part of the journey would involve walking along the side of a busy road due to there being no pavement and so not possible or safe esp as the road is narrow and buses travel very close to the side. The hotel staff didn't tell us this despite us asking for directions to the metro and we only found out after we started making our way over and had to turn back. When we asked them about this their reply was 'it's possible but I didn't say it would be safe or advisable!!'. This was slightly stressful when we first got there as that part of Rome is not clearly signed (i.e how to get to Metro after getting off bus) but once we got the hang of it, all was fine. The Metro comes in handy if you need to get to the East side of Rome. The Bus stop is right outside the hotel and they are very frequent and easy to use but drop you off just after the Trevere river so still a 20 min walk to Piazza Spagna etc which wasn't really a problem as we liked walking but obviously late at night when tired it would've been nicer to have had the hotel closer. Buses run until midnight everyday. Shuttle bus no good as only goes 4 times a day at odd times and only goes to St Peters - not town as they've stopped that service for some reason. On the positive side, it does get you walking which is not a problem in Rome as you don't notice it and you get to see things you may have otherwise missed. On the plus side, hotel room was brilliant, all mod cons, clean, lots of complimentary products with a balcony. Quiet location and rooms are spacious and king size bed was very comfy - perfect retreat after a long day of walking! This made the hotel worth staying in and the overall mark is pushed up due to this factor. Finally, lobby was a bit run down and staff service okay. We wouldn't stay there again as it's too far away from the city and travel uses up valuable 'Rome' time but good if you want luxury away from the City.

Reviews.Title: “Would return to this hotel in a second!”
Reviews.Author: caseyLI
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Wonderful staff, beautiful property, restaurants, and a free shuttle bus to take you to and from St. Peter's Square seven days a week. What an oasis from the noise and traffic of Rome's city centre. The rooms overlooking the Pool are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: SCCCreceptionist
Reviews.Content: Stayed First weekend in February--I know what took so long, for 3 nights. Staff was very helpful. Room was clean and neat. My only complaint was the food was sooooo expensive and not all that great. I'm happy with our choice of the Crowne Plaza. I was on vacation in Rome. One tip--make sure you do the Double-Decker bus tours (red ones) had a blast meeting all the peope and got a great video to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great facilities, shame about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: DJR21Kent
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a week at the Crowne Plaza as this was our only holiday. It is a very nice hotel, lovely swimming pool, room very nice. The only downside is you are a long way from the centre. The hotel does have a courtesy shuttle bus to The Vatican and also stops quite near the centre but a little way out and they dont have pick ups very late and there are only early drops at the Vatican. You can catch the metro back quite far but then have to walk along roads with no pavement, which was very dangerous and after a long day of sightseeing was not welcolmed. In general I enjoyed our stay very much and would only not go back as I think I'd prefer to stay closer to the centre as one night we were stranded as the roads were chaotic and we couldn't get a taxi. The one main problem is there is not really a mid-range restaurant, there is a bar with snacks like pizza, hot dogs, burgers and then an expensive restaurant but nothing in between. If you do stay here please get a taxi and visit the restaurant Antico Arco in Gianicolo as this was superb. Gianicolo Hill is a lovely place to go out in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week after Easter and found other comments on this website really helpful. We were e-mailed a copy of the courtesy bus schedule but one of the pick up times was wrong (16:00 hours from the centre should have been 15:45). I think this will now have been changed and although we missed that bus we caught the 18:00 hours so that was no problem.We took a taxi from the airport (50 euros for 4).. we had been offered higher prices but turned them down. We were able to check into our rooms as soon as we arrived (about13:00 hours) The rooms were lovely, spacious and clean. The taxi into Rome from the hotel cost us 9 euros that afternoon but the next morning (the early bus was full) we did get ripped off by a quite unpleasant taxi driver who demanded 25 euros for the same journey. We used the pool and, thanks to the earlier reviewers, had brought flip-flops and swimming hats with us-on the Tuesday there was a fun aqua aerobics class. We had croissants and coffee in the bar rather than breakfast and ate at Arthuros 2 nights (because it was so convenient) ..turn right out of the hotel. On our last night the doorman suggested a restaurant in town which was pricey (not too bad) but a fantastic end to the holiday ..I think it was Porto on via rippicine but ask Allessandro. We found all the staff really friendly and did not find the location a problem if you budget for the taxis (apart from our one unpleasant driver-sorry we did not get his number) or use the courtesy bus

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it should be”
Reviews.Author: Leo_Millward
Reviews.Content: It may have 4 star facilities but it's a bit shabby and more like a 3 star. Hotel grounds very nice at the rear and plenty of car parking at the front (unusual for Rome) although needed re-surfacing. The lunchtime buffet meal we had in the Osteria Restaurant was very poor indeed. Breakfast each day in the Le Jardin d'Hiver restaurant was spectacularly bland and repetitive as well as lukewarm instead of hot - certainly nowhere near worth 18 Euros each! The room was okay albeit tired and no aircon available as it was "not summer yet" - this made it necessary to leave the patio door wide open all night to keep the temparature down. If you have a car and want to stay on the outskirts of Rome to take advantage of trips out to the lovely coastal town/beach at Sperlonga or the fabulous lake towns around Lake Bracciano, then this hotel's fine if they have a special rate available. I would not however pay 128 Euros a night again for room only! Taxi to central Rome sights was around 12 to 15 Euros as the hotel is on the city outskirts.

Reviews.Title: “American standards in a suburban Rome location”
Reviews.Author: Chgoswatcher
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza St. Peter's is a typical Crown Plaza hotel. It is located in the western district of Rome, outside of the city center. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the Cornelia metro stop and a 15 minute drive from Vatican City. The hotel does advertise a complimentary shuttle service to/from the following: Fiumicino Airport, St. Peter's Square and Piazza Venezia. However, this shuttle service is infrequent (3 round trips daily) and on a first come first served basis. A 30 minute taxi ride from Fiumicino will run between 40-50 euro. I took the Leonardo Express train to Termini for 11 euro. A taxi from there to the hotel cost 16 euro. It all depends on your budget. Transportation into the city center and major activities would be needed. You can work with their shuttle schedule to plan your city adventures, or take advantage of the metro and abundant taxis. Parking in the city center is about 1 euro per hour on the metered streets. But be careful of zoning restrictions. The hotel room (#538) was what I expected of the Crown Plaza chain. Quiet and very large. A queen size bed, work desk, sofa and table with chairs. A flat panel plasma tv, mini bar, pants press, iron and ironing board and hairdryer were amenities in the room. Complimentary coffee and mineral water were replenished daily. A private balcony overlooked the front entrance to the property. The marble and granite bathroom was spotless and included a full size tub and shower, toilet, bidet and single basin sink. A terry bathrobe was also included. The hotel is a typical conference hotel complete with business center, expensive restaurant, bar and fitness center and spa.

Reviews.Title: “american style hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovecheesecake
Reviews.Content: American style hotel outside of Rome. Bus stop right around the corner. Walk out of the hotel and turn right about 5 yards. Very cheap and easy to use. Rooms are average Holiday Inn America hotel rooms. Good size rooms for Rome. Great breakfast. I don't know how to say it but there was nothing special about this hotel. Very forgettable. Dinner was expensive but not that great. I would say this hotel is average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: portugalrocks
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for the price. They are in the process of upgrading the rooms, so it tended to be a bit noisy during the day. However the updated room is very nice. It was definitely roomier that most rooms in Italy and very clean. The front desk staff are pleasant and helpful and the shuttle bus into Rome and to airport was convenient and easy. The hotel restaurant was a bit pricey, and with not too much selection nearby in the way of food, it tended to be a bit inconvenient with kids. We also had an strange issue with cleaning staff wanting to enter and clean at odd hours such as 7:30pm when you tended to want to be in your room. The indoor pool area has quite a few restraints that make it really inconvenient to use (must have cap, slippers, etc) Overall though, the stay was pleasant. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JMayLondon
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel, and would definitely go back again. I is not right in the centre of the city, but we wanted somewhere with a swimming pool, and were prepared to stay a bit further out. It takes about 10-15 minutes to get to the Vatican by bus, of which there are two which stop at the end of the drive. The hotel runs a courtesy bus to the Vatican and the city centre. There are 5 per day going to either or, and returning. They also run some courtesy buses to Fiumicino, but not Ciampino. We flew into Ciampino, and got a taxi from there to the hotel, which cost 70 Euros. However on the way home we got a cab to the side entrance of Termini railway station (12 Euros, most cabs are roughly this to the centre) and then the Terravision bus (8 Euros each) to the airport. The fitness centre is lovely; I think it must be brand new. I recommend taking your own swimming hat if you want to go in the swimming pool or Jacuzzi, or they’ll supply you with shower caps, not attractive! Service is pretty good, although we had to wait for 2 hours for someone to bring us up some tea and milk. An electrician came pretty quickly to sort out our (HD!) telly, when it wasn’t working. And to get the lights working you need to put the key into the black box by the door, which we weren’t old about! We didn’t eat in the restaurant, but the drinks at the bar were very expensive, 17 Euros for a Malibu and coke and a beer! Overall very nice hotel, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vix-7
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to this hotel for Valentine's Day in February 2005 after staying there previously with a friend for a girlie weekend. The staff were particularly great when I stayed there with my friend and we got all kinds of freebies. Snacks, drinks and even an evening out salsa dancing (which I am not sure they were supposed to do but it was great and they were perfect gentlemen). The assistant manager who was finishing his shift when we returned from Gilda's nightclub at 5 in the morning chatted to us and gave us red wine and croissants for our early breakfast/late supper : ) Very friendly. In the Summer the pool is fantastic to chill out in and they also have an indoor pool and steam room, sauna which my partner and I used during the Winter stay. Very relaxing. The sites nearby include St. Peters and the Vatican City obviously which I visited on both occasions. Beautifully atmospheric. The room are generally of the same design being a Croene Plaza but very nice all the same. Traditional italian and the bathrooms are superb. Bath/Power Shower and spotless. That's all I want. The concierge was excellent both times and gave us detailed instructions on how to get to the stadium when me and my partner went to watch a Lazio game. I bought the tickets prior to going and we had a hire car. No other maps we had were that clear. Rome is not easy to navigate. The concierge created one for us and we never got lost once, there or back. They will also advise on where to eat outside the hotel although the restauarnt in the garden is superb. Pricey but worth every euro. The concierge advised us on public transport which again we had no problem with at all and all the other famous sites are within easy reach. The hotel surroundings are in a nice area called Aurelia which is green and suburban although again it's not far from anything. Will return to this hotel time and time again. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, plush, plush!”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteandIwai
Reviews.Content: This is the Rolls Royce of hotels. We read a number of reviews before we went and having stayed there struggled to find any faults. The location is ideal - it is just outside Rome's town centre but within easy distance by taxi and they provide a free bus a number of times a day which always runs on time. Check in and out is quick and easy and the concierge is on hand 24 hours a day should you need anything. The room was spacious, nicely decorated and had all the facilities you need for your stay. Each double room has 2 beds - one soft and one hard so you can choose your preference. The bathroom was equally nice and has all the mod cons you would expect. Each room also has a large balcony which overlooks the pool area. The hotel has all the extras you would expect - ice rooms, gym, spa. Both this hotel and Rome are second to none and come highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: zjac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2007 using our loyalty points. It is a way out from the centre of Rome. Be warned, you will have to get buses or taxis from the hotel to the centre and back again. We didn't try public transport, preferring to use taxis. We didn't mind because we enjoyed coming back to the hotel. The hotel bar was small but the service was excellent and we particularly enjoyed the oysters and champagne daily offer! The rooms were large and the beds were huge. The hotel has all the mod cons you would expect from a decent Crowne Plaza. There wasn't much life to the hotel but in terms of comfort and convenience it was all there. Didn't rate the breakfast though. I would go back there but I would allow more of our holiday spending money for the taxis. For value for money it was a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but no "flower" in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sandyh2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a Princess Cruise package. We thought it would be a good deal because it was much cheaper than the Marriott downtown and they advertised a free bus to the Vatican and downtown Rome. First, the rooms were OK - the bed was nice. However, they turn off the air conditioning at some point in the fall and if it is hot (as it was during our stay), you will not be comfortable. We were able to change rooms but had to sleep with our sliding door open (not smart for security reasons). Upon return to the room each evening, we had to open the sliding door and hope it would finally cool down. Food was adequate but very very expensive. I was not overly impressed with the facility and since the pool was closed we had a hard time even walking around the hotel (doors locked). They were changing out the TV sets in each room as well as some furniture and lots of painting and work going on. The free bus was OK but nothing that made it convenient. Even though it is a short distance (about 3.5 miles) to St. Peters, it took the bus better than 30 minutes to get to the drop off. Then they don't tell you which way to go (drop off is in a side street off the main roads) to get to the front of St. Peters. Pickup later in the day is not at St. Peters but rather in the center of the city. We took a taxi back to the Hotel and that worked out well and was much quicker than the bus. Nothing is really close to the hotel (walking is difficult because of no sidewalks or very narrow places to walk) but one restaurant just outside the entrance. However, it does not open until 7:00 PM. If you do walk, be careful because the drivers in Rome drive "offensively" as opposed to "defensively." If you don't know what I mean, go to Rome and ride in a bus or taxi cab and observe. Overall, we will never stay here again. I should have paid the extra money to stay downtown at the Marriott. I think we would have had a much better time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: hhowell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a pre-night tour. I loved it. The indoor pool was sooo refreshing after a long flight from ALASKA. It was the only way I could relax and the staff was very nice when I couldn't figure out how to call the states. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Viajero Del Mundo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Dec. 2005 after a harrowing taxi ride from the Airport. The hotel was typically North American and were large rooms by Europe standards. We were two families and had adjoining rooms which was very nice. The indoor pool/spa was okay, the Jacuzzi was kind of gross, too much foam, made it feel dirty. Plus you had to have slippers or they made you buy them. Not too much around the hotel. There is a small little “town” with shops if you head to the left when you come out of the hotel…a bit of a walk, and no sidewalks. Took the bus (right outside the hotel) to see all the sites. Taking the bus was really no problem at all, really easy and quite convenient. Note – traffic is crazy, be careful when walking along, roads do not have sidewalks for pedestrians. Watch your wallet/purse, a lot of pick pockets. While waiting for buses we would notice them. If you watch for them, you will notice them, but they do blend into the crowd. We also took the hotel shuttle but when we missed it, it was really no problem to take the public bus.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: TwoCrabs
Reviews.Content: The ONLY reason I stayed in this hotel was because I was in Rome for business, booked at the last minute and this was the only hotel left in town. Otherwise, I would NEVER have stayed here and will never return. I've stayed in many Crowne Plazas around the world and never found them good. But this hotel is a disgrace to the name. The entire hotel seemed to be a construction site. Spare furniture, paint cans, ladders, tools and other construction equipment were dumped haphazardly along the hallway. The staff was surly and rude. And the architect of this hotel should be fired; my room on the 5th floor west wing was a good 1/4 mile walk from the elevator! The worst feature was its location. Talk about being in the middle of nowhere! One of the greatest pleasures of Rome is walking down the cobblestoned roads, exploring the alleys and cafes. But you can't walk anywhere from this hotel. It's tucked away in a quiet area of Rome but going anywhere requires a taxi, which are luckily cheap and plentiful, but still a hassle. The name of the hotel is very misleading; it's a good 12-15 minute taxi ride to St. Peter's cathedral and that's on a good day with no traffic. The only thing nice I have to say about this hotel was the bed. I loved it! Super super comfy. And the rest of the room and furnishings were comfortable but generic. This is a business hotel, and it's clearly billed that way in advertising. There is a large meeting and business center here (the week I was there, author John Gray was hosting a self-help seminar). The hotel has WiFi Internet access but it is VERY expensive: 10 euros per HOUR! Ridiculous. And a beer in the lobby bar costs 8 euros. Unless your company forces you to stay here, avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: Uptherobins
Reviews.Content: We arrived Thurs 26 Oct (family of 4; 2 adults, 2 boys aged 9 and 7) and obtained a non-smoking room though one was not available at time of booking on website, that was gratifying. At the same time, we were annoyed to find that children under 16 were not allowed into the indoor pool. However, we did have access to the outdoor pool (unheated) though it was officially closed; you just pushed through the hedge and joined the other keen swimmers. Hotel is a (crowded) bus plus metro ride from most attractions and unfortunately on the first evening my bag was slashed and mobile phone and purse stolen. Interestingly, when I reported it to hotel Reception they handed over a multilingual form for reporting such incidences and directed us to the Carabinieri. Over the next couple of days we observed a group of thieves actively targeting tourists awaiting service buses at the stop right outside the hotel, so beware. The hotel's own coach to the city and to the airport was easily the most convenient and comfortable (and safe!) way of moving around; it is very punctual but runs infrequently. Breakfast was generous and provided a wide range of foods, but service could be chaotic and items often ran out, or burners might not have been lit beneath food to keep it warm. Staff were generally friendly, spoke good English and were helpful with directions; though one day we did approach the concierge, who was lounging against his counter in full uniform, only to be told by him that the desk was "Closed" (!). In all, this was a pleasant hotel, but further than we had anticipated from the main sites of interest .

Reviews.Title: “Will Return to Crowne Plaza, Saint Peter's”
Reviews.Author: Camaldo
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel! It was very clean, in a convenient location, and with a helpful and friendly staff. Free shuttle bus, public buses and reasonably priced taxis made the magnificent sites easy accessible. The hotel's talented musician, Nino Soprano, provided memorable entertainment. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: D.Mackenzie
Reviews.Content: Apart from the hotel being just a bit off the beaten track, I could find little to fault it. We enjoyed a 4 day stay there last week , and are happy to recommend the hotel itself. St Peters and the Vatican are a short bus ride away (the bus stop is just outside the hotel). Don't walk it - you run out of pavement very soon and are then at the mercy of the Rome traffic, which is something else ! . The breakfast at the hotel at 18 euros is well worth it. The rooms were large and clean. Dinner in the hotel was on a par - quality and price wise with many restaurants in the city. Taxis in Rome are much more a concern. We were ripped off on taxi fares every other time we took a taxi. As our party consisted of 8 adults we quite often took 2 taxis to the same destination - at no time were the fares the same even though we left at the same tme to the same destination (in some cases the difference was up to 10 euros - and that was with the meter on !). Watch out for pickpockets in the city. Even in October Rome is busy, and there are opportunistic thieves about looking for a chance to steal your handbag. My sister sat down at the Vatican, put her bag at her feet - and it was gone in a moment without here ever noticing anyone taking it. We enjoyed the city, and although threw our coins in the Trevi fountain, I'm not sure we would return - I think in 4 days we saw what this city had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view at Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Arundellady
Reviews.Content: I had read about the Crowne Plaza in Trip Advisor and used the prior reviews to enjoy our stay. Since it was four of us traveling we used taxis. Cost us 10 Euros from Navona Piazza to hotel. Agree that the shuttle from hotel to St. Peter's is the best bet. You can skip the expensive hotel breakfast and grab a cappuccino and panini or croissant at a small coffee shop on the right hand side when you are dropped off by shuttle.
