We picked up wine, cheese, salami & jam & had a wine & cheese party overlooking the swimming pool & Villa Doria in the distance. Delightful! We put the leftovers in the refrigerator and had rolls & jam & wonderful cookies for breakfast since we had to leave at 7:00 am.to make the Sistine Chapel tour. We ate at the hotel bar and enjoyed a nice choice of food. We also ate at Arturos outside the hotel on the right. It was just okay. Our lunch across the street from the Roman Forum was much better. Up the street from the Roman Forum was where we found the stores selling the wine, cheese & bakery. Even though the hotel is a distance from St. Peters and all the sights we felt that the quiet comfortable rooms made up for it. You felt you were in Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Out of way location”
Reviews.Author: heroic_gal
Reviews.Content: This was a relatively nice hotel, but the concierge service left something to be desired. The woman wasn't very knowledgeable, and I had to get correct information from a tourist office. The name suggests that it is close to St. Peter's, but you have to take a bus to get anywhere you'd want to go. Tip: Take the hotel bus to and from St. Peter's (early morning and late night), and you should be okay to find your way around the rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “great for family”
Reviews.Author: 5happy
Reviews.Content: My family, two adults and three children just returned from Rome. Before taking a cruise we stayed at the Crowne Plaza which was excellent. The courtesy bus worked out very well and we returned to the hotel by taxi which was no problem. Taxis were about 10 euros-no problems accomodating 5 people. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Food at restraunt was very good. We found a restraunt within walking distance that was excellent. (walk to the end of the driveway and turn left. walk about 5 min. it will be on your right) The rooms were very clean. If you are staying with children I would reccomend this hotel. The hotel also booked a transfer for us to the pier, which was less expensive than doing this on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Rome”
Reviews.Author: eventhorizon
Reviews.Content: The info says walking distance to St Peters BUT..no way..it took the Taxi 15 minutes !! The hotel is a bit isolated but apart from the restaurant it was excellent. The restaurant in the evenings only serves nouvelle quisine...small ( very ) portions of dishes you never heard of and puddings that fit on one spoonful at ridiculous prices!! But, outside the hotel entrance, turn left and walk 200 yards there is an excellent pizza restaurant. Otherwise its a Taxi into Rome for about 9 Euros. Oh the hotel had one other fault..the bench press bench in the gym had a design fault ..the stands were placed right where you need to put your hands so it was useless. Nice pool, nice room , extra large bed ( 6 foot 6 inch wide ) maid comes every day. At leonardo da vinci airport Hotel bus takes you to hotel but service only a couple of times each day and also runs to rome 6 times a day...oterwise Get a Taxi to rome centre and back. Eat at piazza venneto. If you want to see the sistine chappel arrive early...we got there twice..9 am and next day 8.30 am...both days the queue was unbeliveable..thousands...and stretched for about 600 yards,,we gave up. Do not go on Panini travel coach trip to pompei...the seats are plastic, uncomfortable and air con is non existent and you get 2 hours only at pompei and ten spend 2 hours at naples harbour waiting for the sorrento and isle of capri people to pile back on the hot bus,,,it was worst journey I have ever had on a coach,,,,be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Littlebubu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza hotel for 4 nights. Compared to the other hotels we had in other countries in Europe with the same pricetag, this hotel is above average. The day we came in there was a taxi strike, luckily the hotel had a courtesy bus service which took us to our hotel. We also made use of this service the following days, since the next day the taxi's were striking again. The bus service saved us a lot of money and time. It goes to The Vatican, the City Center and the Airport several times a day. You can mail them for a schedule. The Spa was very enoyable after a day of walking. Indeed the hotel is far from the city center, but it doesn't realy matter because of the bus and all the public transport avaiable in front of the hotel. Hotel staff is very pollite en helpful. Of course sometimes there are people who are more rude then others, but that's always the case. Some minor details could be fixed though, like a simple paintjob for the reception counter or the tables at the reception desk. I think those are the only negative points about the hotel. The food is quite reasonable, but a bit pricy. As many other reviewers mentioned, right outside the hotel is a restaurant, Arturo which serves great food for a good price with very good service. But be carefull, it's very busy there. If I went to Rome again I will definitely pick this hotel again. Hope there is no taxi strike again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: b2buck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of a Globus trip. Room was clean and ok but was showing some wear. The beds were pretty poor. Shower and bathroom was pretty average even for Europe. The location of this hotel is really remote with no services within safe walking distance. Food in restaurant was average. Just nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “I thought It was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in May of 2006 and thought the hotel was great compared to most hotels I have stayed in in Europe! Yes, it is true you can't actually walk to the Vatican from the hotel without getting flattened by traffic, it was not hard to get there. There is a Taxi stand on the grounds (like 100feet out the front of the hotel). There is also a shuttle bus, and we never had a problem using either. The staff was friendly and I thought our room was very quiet. I actually expected a lot more noise. This is the closest thing I have gotten to an "American" style hotel in Europe, and it was very comfortable. The taxi fare to the town center was about 10 euros, so getting everywhere was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetofly77
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel for a 4 day post cruise stay May 22, 2006. There was a full tour bus of us arriving at the same time. Check in took a few minutes, with the hotel staff being very friendly and helpful. They also spoke excellent English. Our room was ready at check in - 10:30 A.M. We were given a complimentary shuttle schedule that has public bus and subway information on the back. Having read reviews on this site we knew how to get to shops and small restaurants near the hotel. We also heard the staff giving the info to others checking in - but not terribly detailed. Turn left out of the driveway and go the the first traffic light. Turn left again and follow the main road about 2 - 3 blocks. There is a small pizzaria and shops there, including a great small store that carries fresh cheese, sliced meats, bread, wine, etc. They speak English and are very helpful. We bought cheese, bread, wine and munchies there and used them for light lunches. There is a small fridge in the room to use for cold storage. The room was large and comfortable. The bed was GREAT. Nice linens and duvet for the king size bed. Housekeeping was very helpful. The maid dropped everything to get us a wine opener. The bar area just off reception was lovely, but very expensive. We didn't try it, so we don't know about service there. We ate breakfast every day at the hotel - included with our room. Decent food, including champagne and wine. The hotel is showing it's age, but very clean and comfortable. We used the hotel shuttle every day to get downtown and most days to return to the hotel. One night we stayed late at dinner downtown and missed it - the taxi back was 10.13 euro. The restaurant next door is wonderful - Arthuro's. Turn right at the end of the driveway and walk about a block to it. The food was great, it has a bar area also, and the prices were very reasonable for Rome. Be aware it is closed on Monday. Yes, the sidewalks are very narrow - but this is Europe. The room does have air conditioning - unlike a previous review stated. The thermostat is on the wall. Choose your preferred temp. and slide the switch on the top toward the sun logo on the front. For heat -slide it toward the snowflake. Just remember to put your hotel key into the slot by the door and turn on the main switch below it. In our case our key from the cruise ship did the trick, and the air stayed on even if we needed the hotel keys when we left. We found the room to be very quiet - 4th floor - with our balcony being right over the outdoor restaurant, so we could hear the music they play there every evening. Lovely! All in all - we would recommend this hotel. If you prefer being in walking distance to the sites downtown you probably won't be happy here, but the shuttle gets you to St. Peter's in the morning and downtown -Piazza Venezia- in the afternoon and evening for free. They are prompt, so be ready at the hotel or the drop off points when the schedule says. You can do your check out very easily using the TV. We just dropped the keys at the front desk and went. Very nice experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza from 8 - 12 May. Although hotel is not in the centre of town the bus service, just outside the hotel is very reliable - there are two buses which pass directly outside the hotel the 98 is one and I think the other is 889 - both will bring to close to the Vatican and into the centre of town. Would recommend that if you travel in from Airport on the train to termini arm yourself with a bus route map and underground map and use these services as they are very good once you work your routes out. The hotel was excellent, room size was very comfortable, rooms were clean and tidy, bathroom was lovely and a warm bath or shower at end of a busy sightseeing day was always most welcome. Housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was super with a very good variety for either hot or cold breakfast. Pastries looked delicious but a bit too early in the morning for us. Breakfast time was also very accommodating - from 6.00am to 11.00am. Bar area was nice to sit but price of beers and cocktails was expensive. I would not hesitate to recommend the Crowne Plaza to anyone travelling to Rome once they do not mind basing themselves outside the centre - there are taxis on site if you wish to use them - but we found the bus service more than adequate - the courtesy shuttle bus to the airport was very handy - times are limited but if you have an evening flight it leaves the hotel at 5.30pm on a first come first served basis and gets to the airport in about 30 minutes. It departs from the airport at 6.15pm each evening for the hotel - this is the last shuttle bus to the hotel in the evening and you pick up the coach outside the the arrival terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy”
Reviews.Author: Breven
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but the location is terrible. You have to catch a taxi or bus to get any where. The footpaths outside the hotel are ridiculous!!!! - they disappear and become part of the narrow road that is meant to be two way but really only fits 1 car each way. Breakfast was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, loved the spa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Crowne Plaza - the service was excellent, the staff were very helpful and the rooms were very comfortable. We particularly enjoyed the spa which allowed us to relax after the hectic sightseeing in Rome. I would recommend this to anyone going to Rome. I preferred being out of the centre and the 10 euro taxi ride was not excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: redeco
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as part of a tour package for our Collette Vacation. Reviews were generally good, so we were prepared for a comfortable hotel after our long flight. Jet lag days can be trying. Check-in was speedy and bags were delivered promptly. Rooms were large and most had balconies. Rooms clean and very comfortable; hotel staff very accomodating. I heartily recommend this hotel. Breakfast was the best we had during our entire ten days on tour. This hotel offered the usual Italian fare of crusty rolls, salami, and cheeses. However, there was also the offering of scrambled eggs, toast, sausage, bacon, and roasted tomatoes. Pastries were sensational. We also had a welcome dinner at the hotel, which I would describe as 'institutional' and not very memorable. My suggestion to the chef is that any welcome dinner for an American group ought to include pasta as a Primi. Be aware that this hotel is not within walking distance of anything of tourist interest. It's out by the film studios and closer to the airport than to town. We took a 15 minute cab ride (12 Euro) to Trestevere for an enjoyable two hours. This is a marvelous older neighborhood in Rome on the same side of the Tiber as the hotel, one often overlooked by tourists with busy schedules. Santa Maria in Trestevere is worth a visit, but wandering the streets is the real treat. St. Peter's is about the same distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel..........”
Reviews.Author: pattyc5us
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week with our four boys. I have to say with all are travels I have never been so surprised at the treatment and lack of customer service. The people at this hotel were down right rude. Ok so we are americnas and we know they dont like us, but when you are spending over 6000 dollars for two rooms I would hope you would be insured some type of civility and service. We received none of this. The rooms were poorly serviced by housekeeping each day, no vacuuming, no wiping down the furniture and the bathroom cleaning was pathetic. The front desk was disinterested and non attentive and basically of no help what so ever. One night they sent us to a restauruant up this narrow street to walk to for dinner, when we got there it was closed. By then we all were laughing because we were so in shock over the blatent disrespect of these people. I would reccommmend staying at a barn before even considering staying here. At least the animals would be friendly. The ciy of rome is amazing.......the sights, the history and most importantly if you are catholic this is a wonderful pilgrimmage for your faith. My kids loved the vatican, the ruins and the coloseum.........even they were aware of the rudeness and mistreatment by the staff of the hotel. I cannot stress enough there are far too many other options to stay at in rome, please exhaust them all before signing on with this hotel. Especially if you are American. It is better to stay closer into the main area of town as this hotel is on the outskirts and you will spend a fortune in cabs and will have no help what so ever in receiving information from the concierge as I never saw anyone behind that desk during our entire week stay. Truly Pathetic!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an out of town location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived for two nights here in Feb, just in time for the England V Rome 6 Nations game. After a metered taxi driver quoted us 45 euros to get from Termini to the hotel (we got to Termini on the Teravision bus), we were relieved when an honest cabbie quoted us approx 15 euros which is what we were led to believe, and in the end cost us 12 euros. (a bit different to 45 - so watch for dishonest cabbies!) We were too early for check-in so left our bags with concierge. Reception were really friendly and efficient, returning our passports immediately after taking the details from them. We returned about 1am to the hotel and received really poor service from the bar staff, who just left us waiting for ages. We complained to reception and they intervened, ensuring we got service but this was a real annoyance and dissapointment. Besides that, the rooms were really spacious, clean with everything you could need and overall was a great hotel. Unfortunately we never made breakfast nor saw the pool but we heard form friends who stayed there that they were great too. We would really recommend this hotel but it is a long way from the city and although there were buses running, the times were not convenient so we ended up spending a fortune in taxis. However, it was nice and quiet to return to at the end of a day's sighseeing. I would probably stay here again if there were 4 of us as you could share taxi costs, however, we stayed more centrally in Rome on our last visit and we much preferred that, but all personal preference. Oh - one last thing. The walls of the rooms are thin and hope that unlike us, you aren't woken at 2:30am with an amorous couple next door to you!! (either amorous or he was killing her!)

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in good location My girlfriend and I stayed here in mid December 2005 and had a fantastic time. The hotel staff are very friendly and bend over backwards to help you. The check in staff advised of all the trips and attractions and how to get to them etc. Rome by night is very recommended this includes a four course dinner at the end of the evening and return transport to your hotel. The hotel itself is clean and tidy and has great facilities (spa, swimming pool etc). Some reviews suggest this hotel is to far from the centre, however we found it an ideal location. It is easy to get into the centre via free shuttle busses that are right outside the hotel and there are taxis in the hotel grounds that only cost around 10 euro to the centre (both take about 5mins!!). We found this location ideal as the hotel was in a quiet area so if you had been out all day its easy to relax. All in I would highly recommend this hoteland forget what people say about the location its easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisified”
Reviews.Author: Coble78
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome from Dec 25th-Dec 27th. The hotel is not within walking distance of anything, so beware. We rented a car and the hotel provided us with city maps. There were signs for the hotel from the parkway or astrotrade (spl?) however it helps if there is someone else in the car to spot them for you. We arrived to the hotel at about 9:30am and we were promptly checked into our rooms. They did ask to see our passports but they gave them back within a few moments. The hotel has a nice lobby with a piano bar and couches. There is wi-fi access but of course you have to pay for it, you can buy $5 cards for 30mins of access at the front desk. Room - When you walk in the room you have to insert your door key in the wall in order for the lights to come on. This was new to us, but it was fine. We had a king size bed, there was a couch and a table with two chairs. The balcony overlooked the parking lot and the bathroom was a decent size. Food - Room service was verrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrry expensive. There is great food at the piano bar, we had two meals and two drinks with tax & tip it came to $20. Where as I ordered room service the previous night, it was a vegetable soup and it came to $17. We had the continental breakfast it was $18 a person. It was not what we expected but it was okay. There were croissants, boiled eggs, cold cuts, meats, scrambled eggs and pastries. There were also mimosas but you had to ask for them they didn't offer them to you. There was live music also that gave it a nice touch. Indoor Pool\spa - There is the saturna spa in the hotel on the ground floor. It is free to use if you are staying with the hotel. There is a heated pool, gym equipment, dry sauna, hot tub, steam room and a fireplace. You have to bring your own slippers or you can buy them from the hotel for 4 euros. We went during the holiday time and we weren't sure what would be open or available to us. If you go to crowne plaza's website and look up the hotel there is a link for the concierge service and they can email you back any questions that you may have. Vatican city is about a 5-10 min drive from the hotel. If this is your first time visiting know that there are few if any restaurants open after 11pm. There are only bars, that sell alcohol, croissants, pastries and coffee. So make sure you eat dinner early. We exchanged money at the hotel the rate was $1-.79euros. It is good to have euros for the smaller places. However we had left over euros and the hotel didn't exchange them back for us. I've also included some pics from our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you appreciate being misled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I have ever experienced in my many travels. Horrible sound-proofing of rooms meant that you got to unwillingly share in all sorts of conversations in neighbouring rooms in the middle of the night. The Crowne Plaza website states that this hotel has air-conditioned rooms. This is NOT the case during the winter season. No air-conditioning (or any other type of ventilation for that matter)is available as confirmed by hotel staff. When I complained to Crowne Plaza customer service about the incorrect information, they did nothing. I don't stay at Crowne Plazas anymore because of this willful misleading of their customers.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: miselemeas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights 8 - 10 December. Courtesy bus picked us up at the airport. Warmly welcomed by hotel staff. Our room was excellent - crisp white linen, wonderfully comfortable beds, lovely duvets and pillows. Usual complimentary bathroom toiletries. The room had a balcony overlooking the tennis courts. As it is coming up to Christmas the hotel was beautifully decorated, inside and out, without being over the top. Had food from the bar menu, which was very well prepared and presented and reasonably priced. Didn't eat at the dining room as the menu didn't suit our taste and was on the expensive side. Ate in the restaurant "Arthur" next door and had excellent food, not expensive. Unfortunately my pocket (inside jacket butoned) was picked in the restaurant - my own fault for leaving money in it. One of our party requested a late 2 pm checkout and was accommodated without any problem. The complimentary shuttle bus was such a bonus - to and from the airport, to and from St Peter's and to and from Downtown a few times during the day. I would happily spend 10 euro a trip if the bus was more frequent. Didn't use public transport at all. To sum up, a great hotel if you don't mind the fact that its away from the centre. We loved it. Finally, unfortunately we found Rome to be filthy dirty with constant pestering from gypsies and beggars. With so much wealth apparent its a pity they dont keep it cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza St. Peter's Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: May_Zee_2004
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at the Crowne Plaza St. Peter's Hotel in October. We booked the hotel for our post-cruise stay of one night because we had reservations for a Vatican tour the day we got off the cruise ship. There were several other fellow cruisemates booked here also. We arrived from the port at approx. 10:30 am and waited in line a few minutes to register. Our registration was prompt and efficient and the hotel staff spoke very good English. Our room was ready so we were able to put our luggage in it before we headed off to our 12:00 Vatican tour. We were on the 5th floor and our room was very spacious compared to other Rome hotels. It had a large king-size bed, a nice sitting area with table and comfortable chairs, a lovely bathroom with a marble vanity top, nice bathtub and shower, oversize fluffy bath towels, and travel size shampoo, lotion, etc. There were tea and coffee making facilities in the room, an iron and ironing board, hairdryer, and a safe. Our room was extremely quiet and no noise could be heard from outside the room. There was a nice balcony where you could enjoy the view of Rome. The hotel itself was very clean with nice couches and chairs in the lobby area. We did feel that the hotel had a "gently worn" look to it & could use some updating but that was our only criticism. There was a nice lounge right off the main lobby & you could also order food there. The concierge staff were very attentive to our needs and would order a taxi for us if one was not available outside the hotel. They also offer a free shuttle bus to St. Peter's Square, the center of Rome and to the airport. We took the shuttle to the airport the next morning. It leaves the hotel at 10:00 am and we arrived at the airport approximately an hour later. The hotel is located away from the mainstream of things so if you want to be conveniently located to all the tourist attractions, then you would probably not want to stay here. However, the metro and busses are conveniently located nearby. We opted to take a cab to St. Peter's Sq. for our Vatican tour and got the cab right outside the hotel lobby. We shared the ride with another couple and it was only E8.00 total for the ride to St. Peter's. My husband and I took a cab from St. Peter's Sq. (the cab drivers sit right there in the square) back to the hotel after our tour and it was E7.00 (rates depend upon which route the cabbies take). LOL The breakfast room was very bright and cheerful and overlooked some lovely gardens. We did not want the breakfast buffet and asked if we could order a light breakfast instead. The hostess said we could have a pot of coffee, a glass of juice and a croissant for E5.00 pp. That is what we had and it was sufficient for us as we were heading to the airport. Our checkout was very prompt and efficient also. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Crowne Plaza St. Peter's Hotel. We had read some negative reviews from people that had stayed there but we could not find fault with anything. We would, indeed, stay there again and would recommend the hotel to others. I consider myself to be very picky about hotels but loved our stay there. We ate dinner with our fellow cruisemates at a small Italian restaurant right around the corner from the hotel that had such fantastic food. Very reasonable also. Our last day and night in Rome were very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snirpy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel but not the most convenient to Rome. I was there with a tour and luckily we were taken into Rome to see the sites however I would not stay here if I wanted to do any site-seeing. The hotel was very clean and the rooms comfortable and spacious. Indoor and outdoor pools and internet is available.

Reviews.Title: “a bit out but nice pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel but the decor is a bit out of date (due for refurbishment in 2005 though). The hotel is not in the centre of Rome but a 10min walk to the Metro and another 10mins metro has you in the Centre of Rome. The hotel has a lovely 25m pool and nice poolside bar (expensive though) and loungers, great for relaxing after the heat of Rome in summer. Rooms are very spacious and clean but as mentioned the decor is dated.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hard To Find If You Are Driving Yourself”
Reviews.Author: ruthitalia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very hard to find when you are driving yourself. There were not enough signage for the hotel.. It was too far away from center city Rome. The staff was very courteous and helpful and most spoke English. Restaurant staff were very friendly, but then again, they could afford to be for the prices they charged in the restaurant. Room service was very expensive. 11 Euro for ice cream and 11 Euro for mixed fruit. The doormen were very helpful. All in all, take taxis from the hotel to the city. We stayed there from 9/25-9/28/05.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjb4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crown Plaza last week for 3nights having booked the superior room. Could not fault the accommodation or the attentive staff, all reception staff spoke English and had all necessary information. Restaurant not in keeping with standard of hotel. ambience good, food expensive and limited menu. Waiters a little too attentive! Would recommend Trastevere area (short taxi ride) particularly "Galeassi" in Piazza S. Maria. Taxis in the square to return. We landed at Ciampino airport having booked the Terravision bus (£9.50 return each) which we had to queue for and then a taxi which cost us 73 euros (£52) due apparently to traffic. Took 2hours from landing!! Would highly recommend the hotel limousine service fixed price of 70 euros (£50) which they just added to our bill and took 20minutes to get back to airport.

Reviews.Title: “perfct position”
Reviews.Author: thrutone
Reviews.Content: excellent position near to everything, local buses outside the front door,good service, clean rooms, very good bar and food ,my two young daughter (and wife) loved our short stay here

Reviews.Title: “We liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: OregonDuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Sept 3 and 4th precruise. Booked it on our own at a greatly reduced rate than the cruise ship would give us. We thought it was very nice; large room, clean and the staff very friendly. It was away from the center of town, but if you plan your day around their free shuttle buses, it can be quite convenient. The bus is large so no one gets turned away. There is a very nice affordable restaurant "Arturo's" just right outside the grounds to the right. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jay1979
Reviews.Content: Came here for our honeymoon and what a great place. Rooms are huge and nicely decorated- the bed was the hugest I've ever slept in- over 6' wide, and you even get a seating area with sofa! Very clean, and they always topped up the freebies, even giving us complimentary bottled water (although we drank tap water too without any probs). It's probably not worth paying the 13 euros a day for the extra TV channels- there only seemed to be one film on the film channel a day. However if you like seriously hardcore porn, and we don't I hasten to add, you won't be disappointed as the 13 euros gets you two channels... Loved the gym and dance studio, and although the outdoor pool is probably too deep for non-swimmer children, there is a kiddy pool too and I think there's also an indoor one. Plenty of sun loungers round the pool, although you can get quite bitten by insects even if you are not out there late in the day! Staff were helpful and spoke good English. The room service breakfast is fantastic, but other room service meals were uncooked/ incomplete and the choice of food in the restaurant/ bars is relatively limited, and we couldnt find any other restaurants open near us. It's true that the hotel is quite far out of town- you CAN walk to Vatican City despite what the staff say, but it takes about 45 minutes and there is no pavement early on in the walk. However you won't be ripped off by licensed taxis- it costs about 12 euros to get into town and the hotel has a taxi rank in the front car park. Brilliant and a decent base for sightseeing. If the food had been more varied I would have given it 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: cargio
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome, having stayed at the Crowne Plaza St. Peter's, for a week, with my husband and my son. I feel that my experience was enhanced, because I knew what to expect beforehand from the informative reviews on Trip Advisor. Thus, I hope I can pass on some tips to others. First, we arrived at Fiumicino Airport, at about 8:30 am. Unfortunately, this meant that we missed the 8:00 courtesy bus to the hotel, and we were too tired to wait for the next bus, which was scheduled to come at 11:15. (Other airport pickups are scheduled at 2:30, 6:30, and 9:00. Just look for a large red bus outside of arrivals.) Therefore, we checked out the taxis, and limo services, and were able to engage a driver for $40 EU. Upon our arrival at the hotel, the reception desk was very helpful, and they let us go to our room, even though it was well before check-in time. Everyone speaks English very well, and they were very helpful. The first thing I asked for was a schedule for the courtesy bus. We were able to plan our sightseeing around the hotel's bus schedule, and thus, only had to hire a taxi at the end of each day. The hotel room had excellent amenities, which are often not available in Rome, including iron, hair dryer, hot pot for boiling water, free instant coffee and tea, and a refrigerator. We removed the hotel's water, soda, liquor, etc, from the refrigerator, and chose not to use these, because the prices were exorbitant. Instead, at the end of our sightseeing ventures each afternoon, we sought out a supermarket, and purchased necessities, such as water, soda, lunch meat, and other goodies. The restaurant at the hotel was expensive, but not much worse than the restaurants in Rome center. We chose to eat dinner each night at a different restaurant in Rome. There is a restaurant at the end of the hotel driveway, but it was closed for August. However, if you go to the end of the driveway and turn left, you will find a narrow sidewalk, which will take you to a pizzeria, fruit stands, and gelaterias. We even took a day out for an excursion to Capri, which was arranged by the hotel's concierge. Incidentally, Capri is beautiful and unforgettable. The main reason we stayed at Crowne Plaza, however, was price. We booked a room with 2 double beds, several months ago, at the hotel's website, and the price was incredibly low, thereby saving us at least a thousand dollars over the cost of a comparable hotel in city center, which can buy alot of taxis, dinners, etc. Finally, the hotel has outdoor and indoor pools, a jacuzzi, and an exercise room. All are clean and pleasant. If you are looking for a city hotel, right in the middle of all the action, then this is not the hotel for you. However, if you can plan your day wisely and enjoy some quiet at night, then you'll love the place. If you decide to stay at Crowne Plaza, I hope your experience will be as delightful as ours was.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza, comfortable and friendly!!!”
Reviews.Author: rhondafae
Reviews.Content: Planning a trip to Europe for five adults is stressful enough, especially when you run across poor reviews about your accomodations just days before departure! I'll admit, I was uneasy, and even moreso when we entered the Crowne Plaza lobby. During my last (2003) trip to Rome, my husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Roma. Although the property was lovely, I swore I'd never darken their door again simply because of the snobbish, uncaring attitude of the staff. My first impression of the Crown Plaza was that it looked "tired". The exterior design was clearly from the early 1970's, and the lounge furniture just to the left of the front entrance matched it, perfectly. My apprehension level rose as we proceeded to our rooms. The beds had the same tired, used look and indeed, when the covers were turned back, there were tiny holes in the sheets, just as I'd read!! That, however, is where my disappointment ended. We LOVED it!!! The staff (with the exception of one doorman/bellman who while efficient, wasn't friendly) was absolutely wonderful! There was entertainment in the lounge every night and our bartender was a delight to come home to after a hard day of sight-seeing. We either took the courtesy bus to St.Peters each day or caught a cab to Cornelia Metro. I'm sorry to say that the restaurant reviews are dead-on. We ate there twice and the breakfast buffet every day. It's pricey and although the service is superior, the food is barely palatable. I'd love to see the bar menu expanded! The bottom line is, leave your snobbish, high-brow standards at home and enjoy this beautiful, inviting property. Tiny holes in snow-white sheets didn't disrupt my peaceful sleep one bit! The lounge was comfortable despite the need for some refurbishing and this hotel has family-friendly class that the Sheraton Roma will never be able to buy!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a Glorified Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: emtf
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here a few weeks ago while on Honeymoon in Rome. The rooms were clean and basic but nothing special but fit for purpose none the less. This would be an ideal place for a family holiday as you have the use of the pool which was a bonus. What put us off was the bus loads of cruise tours arriving everyday to which the staff seemed to bend over backwards while the rest of us didn't matter, we even got sent to a separate dining room one morning for breakfast as they were too full!! The breakfast was pretty good and the staff in the restaurant were nice enough as were the reception staff. Location wise its too far away from everything and also its not even safe to walk as there are no real footpaths on either side until you get down the road a bit. The Bar and Restaurant for food at night were extremely expensive and there is a piano player there all the time which is OK but starts to get annoying at 8.30am while your trying to enjoy your eggs! An OK hotel but would not rush back

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Danesthesia
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is an ok hotel for an overnight stay. The rooms were clean, and it was nice that they had an ironing board with iron to use. My only concern was that is was too far away from downtown Rome. Nothing to really do at the hotel. Food and drinks were VERY expensive and not much to choose from on the menu. A dinner salad cost 12 Euros. Plan to spend 80-100 Euros for an average dinner at their restaurant. This hotel would be ok for a transition hotel, but not for an extended stay. Personnel were nice. Would have been nicer if there were other restaurants to choose from but there isn't!

Reviews.Title: “American style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe1118
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel as part of our land package on a Celebrity Cruise. Having stayed in hotels throughout Europe I would say that if you are looking for the amenities that are typically found in a big chain American hotel, this hotel is perfect. If you want the ambiance of this beautiful city surrounded by the local atmosphere, this is not.. As previous reviews stated, the rooms are spacious with modern bath/showers and a lovely balcony. The pool is really great and certainly refreshing with the hot Italian summers. You typically don't get the spacious rooms and certainly not a pool, in the more prime locations.If you want a good location, close to the main sites, this is not the hotel. Of course, taxis (which are expensive) and buses are available if you want that. We enjoy being able to walk in the areas we stay. However, if you travel with children, this is the hotel. With the hot days, the kids often love the pool. The only complaint we really had was trying to find a restaurant nearby. AS stated in previous reviews, there really is nothing around. The staff was not forthcoming with information and suggestions. They told us there was no where to go and kept pushing their restaurant, which was expensive with a very limited menu. This is not exactly true. Having read a previous review, we walked down the driveway, made a right and found a wonderful neigborhood restaraunt right there. We went there often. We would stay there again, but you need to be aware of the limited, inconvenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel, but a bit pricey at times”
Reviews.Author: Ernsts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza from 22nd to 27th July. We have got 2 Kids (9&8) and we were with another family who also had Kids (7&5). As far as the Kids were concerned, the hotal has a nice Pool, which was great for cooling off after a hard days sightseeing. The location is about 15 mins from the Vatican and the hotel lays on a courtesy bus @ 8.45am every morning. From the Vatican there are buses across the river into the centre of Rome. The Beer at the hotel pool was extortionate @ EURO8.00 for a half a lager. Eventually, we went to the supermarket outside of the hotel a bought crates of 24 beers for EURO10.00. Initially, we were discreetly trying to pour the beers into the glassed provided by the hotel pool, but once we reallised that the hotel staff didn't care whether you were drinking their beer or not, we just straight from the can! There is a restaurant just to the right as you leave the hotel that serves good food and then to the left as you leave the hotel after a halfmile walk. Turning left out of the hotel can be quite dangerous though, especially with young kids, as there is hardly a pavement (or sidewalk to all you septic tanks) to walk on. We would certainly return here though!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: Bookistan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July 2005, primarily because we could use Priority Club points. We were aware of the distance from the center but it was not a problem. There are a few buses just outside the door that will take you to the Vatican, from there, you can take other buses or walk to the subway on the other side of St. Peter's Square. The hotel also has a free shuttle to the Vatican, but it only runs a couple of times a day. Rooms are on the ample side for Rome and we had a large balcony to enjoy. The pool was also very nice - I disagree with the reviewer who says the landscaping was not kept up; it looked fine when we were there and there were always staff members tidying up things. We enjoyed the bar at night, especially the 6 Euro champagne and oysters. Staff was friendly and accommodating. If you are looking for an American-style hotel and are willing to overlook the negatives (distance plus the fact that the rooms should be updated), this is a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimbecky
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Clean with a lot of "American" extras like a coffee pot, iron etc. Buffet breakfast was excellent with a lot of choices. Hotel staff was very accomidating. Only draw back was that there wasn't anything close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good transition hotel, Not a great vacation hotel”
Reviews.Author: iloveleona
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Crowne Plaza because it was a good location between the airport and the city center and had free parking. We stayed there one night on our way to Umbria where we rented a house. The hotel was adequate for our purposes but in no way would I say it's a great place to stay. The hotel is old, landscaping is unkept, and there is nothing nearby that is walkable. On the other hand, the staff was efficient, the food was good and the surrounding neighborhoods (if you have a car) are great.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusto!”
Reviews.Author: nitzi1944
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Princess cruise post cruise package. This is not even a 2 star hotel--severely understaffed. Room never made up. Could not get towels. Also they padded our bill and refused to take off charges! The food was outrageously expensive and took over 1 1/2 hrs to get at various times. They have a management problem. The location is a one-half hour bus ride to vatican City. No other restaurants nearby. In the middle of nowhere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: MaureenStewart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and had a fantastic holiday. Couldn't say a bad word about it. Staff friendly & helpful and were a great help to me to assist with my food allergy (ceoliac). Beautiful hotel & grounds and easy access to city centre via courtesy bus from hotel and excellent bus/metro service. Also free shuttle bus to/from airport which saved a great deal of money. Can't wait to return to this fantastic hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: May 25-June 1, 2005. A wonderful location to root your Rome visit. A simple, two-mile, 1 EURO brings you to the Vatican and other locations. A hotel bus shuttle is also available but at specific times. The hotel is very "American" in size. My friend and I had a room with twin beds and it was very roomy for two guys to live in. A balcony overlooking looking the beautiful pool began our day with coffee from the room and a little brandy at night. We enjoyed the pool surroundings several times to break from the touring of Rome. The hotel provided us with a perfect balance to our vacation. Even though we did not have children, the hotel had plenty of families enjoying the surroundings and the pool. We chose the hotel through a package from Yahoo and hoped for the best. We got what we hoped for. Truly recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: PHV009
Reviews.Content: We went there from 5th till 8th May 2005 for a city trip and we did enjoy our stay at the CP St Peters. Location: Of course, this hotel doesn't offer a central location but you don't have to be a genius to guess it! We really cannot understand people who complain about the location: they have to ask tourist offices or surf on the Internet to know exactly where the hotel is located and what are the public transport possibilities! We planned every single transportation by visiting the website ---- and we thus weren't surprised by the location at all. If the location doesn't fit their needs, can't they find another hotel closer to the center? In front of the hotel, there were 4 or 5 bus stops, so you could go almost everywhere. If this is not enough for some people, then they should pick another hotel downtown or rent a car! Room: Nice King Size-bed room with view on the parking/gardens - tiny bathroom but no need to get it bigger - airco working properly Staff: As usual, you get to talk at the reception to some people who don't seem to care about you and to others who are ready to give you a little hand. Regarding the waiters/waitresses for breakfast, they can definitely do better. Smiles were quite rare. Food: We only had breakfast there (because there are too much typical and really tasty restaurants in the city centre - it's a pity not to get out of the hotel for dinner!!!!) and the least we can say is that there is no plenty of choice at the buffets, except for the croissants: 4 or 5 different tastes. We were clearly disappointed by the buffets. Having read the review from someone who complained about the dinner, well I can understand that the quality of the food is not a strenght at the CP St Peters. To cut a long story short, we would say that this a very nice hotel for city trip lovers (as we spent the most of our time outside) and should we come back again in Rome, we'd book the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, shame about the food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome for the May Bank Holiday with my friend and we were really looking forward to a grand old time. After a torturous taxi ride (beware rip off taxis and make sure you belt up!), we arrived at our hotel and were pleased with what we saw. On first impression, you see a very smart hotel, well presented and with excellent facilities. We negotiated a mass of Americans in the lobby who were booked onto Princess Cruises (this hotel is their stopover in Rome) and checked in. Our room was spacious, airy and had a balcony with a very nice view of the outdoor pool. Using our first day to familiarise ourselves with the hotel and surrounding area, we were impressed with the facilities that included a spa, tennis courts and plush green grounds as well as the aforementioned outdoor pool. Outside the hotel, however, there is an extremely busy road that really is not comfortable to walk along, there being virtually no pavement. What little pavement there was, led to nothing. There is nothing of any interest along this stretch of road, apart from a Pizzeria at the top end (a good 5 minute walk). We decided, however, to eat in the hotel restaurant the first night - and boy did we regret it! It's overpriced, stingy portions and not particularly well cooked. I remarked to my friend that the table next to us had ordered starters which looked tasty - imagine my surprise when our "main" meal turned out to be exactly what the next table had been presented with. Two snotty pieces of beef sitting on the plate with a couple of apple slices beside and no veg! We were told that veg was in the buffet server - but not that we had to pay extra for that. Very expensive! We ate out the rest of our stay and found that other guests in the bar were warning off the newer guests about eating in the hotel restaurant. Would that we'd been in the bar before we had ventured into the restaurant ourselves!! Staff at the hotel were helpful, although the bar staff are pretty slow. Order your drink - then, when it arrives, order your second and you should get it around the time you finish your first. Make sure you take flip-flops or slippers with you if you want to use the spa - or they'll charge you a whopping 4Euro for theirs before they let you in. Experience the violent jacuzzi - it has to be done, its like no other I've been in. Don't rely on the courtesy coaches, they aren't so frequent and you'll have to get taxis or public transport to get you back from the centre unless you go and come back really early. The doormen are very helpful and have a very good system for getting you a taxi to take you where you want to go - they'll also give you an idea of how much it will cost you (believe me, ask!) On the whole, this is an acceptable hotel. Good amenities but not very well sited to get around and not really what I expect from a supposed four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay - excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: MC
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on the strength of the comments here on Trip Advisor. The hotel represented excellent value for money at Euro 120 per room per night (we got an early booking deal). When we arrived the staff were friendly, warm, welcoming and very helpful. Nothing appeared too much trouble for them and we could see they were very very busy all the time. As we checked in, they took great trouble to make sure we had a map and were able to know how to make the most of our short time in Rome. The room was above average in size, clean and the bed was huge, and as somebody else noted, there were complimentary chocolates and water each day. The outdoor pool was a bonus and likewise so was the indoor pool, sauna, steam room gym (all free) Before you stay at this hotel, shop around and see what you can get for 120 Euro's a night and then read the ratings!!! I noticed some people complained about the location. It's a short taxi ride to the Vatican and depending on the time of day or night it is 8 Euro's upwards. None of the taxi drivers cheated us, they took us the most reasonable route available for the time of day. All in all - we would stay again and would recommend the hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Below Average for a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the Vatican City. We were fortunate enough to book our stay early and secured a room for 4 nights during the week of the Pope's funeral. The nearest train station is San Pietro but from here, you'd definitely need a taxi. We thought it would be a 30 mins walk max, but it took us more than an hour. Plus, the roads leading to the hotel had no pavements so it's very dangerous. The only public transport which stops outside the hotel are two buses and neither of them stop at San Pietro. My advice is to catch a bus from Via Paola. The hotel is not the easiest to reach. The reception staff gave a below average standard of service for a 4-star hotel. Our return flight was cancelled due to air space being unavailable. We asked the staff if they could find out any information for us but they referred me to the airline's website. I had to pay 5 EURO for 30 mins internet access which is very very expensive. The staff were also not helpful about transport links to the city centre and offered minimal information. I was very disappointed with the level of service. Our room was a king-size room. It was reasonably clean but I noticed peeling paint in one corner of the room. We also had a balcony which wasn't anything special. The bathroom was reasonably clean but small. Our fridge door was slightly broken but not too serious. For a discerning guest, this would probably have been an acceptable room. We also dined in the restaurant. The service was nothing special. I asked the waitress what she recommended and she didn't seem to understand my English. I ordered the lamb and it was nice but the portion was small. The cost of the meal was also high compared to outside. I wouldn't recommend it unless you're tired and you don't want to venture out. The location of the hotel is far from the city centre and it takes ~ 30 mins bus journey to get to Piazza Venezia (the centre). The hotel runs a shuttle service to Piazza Venezia but there are only 2 services to and fro!!! There are no shuttle buses to any airports. Overall, disappointing for a 4-star hotel and the Crowne PLaza chain.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this place!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryPal
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start. The room was great, clean, a good size for Europe and had a really nice little balcony with chairs to sit outside. We are very down to earth, casual people, so a fancy dinner was not what we wanted. We ate in the lobby bar instead, of the hotel rest., the food was great, you get alot of it, and our waiter Stephan took such good care of us, and he was so friendly!! My mother in law went down to work out and swim while we ate, and she said that pool was beautiful, and the people that worked down there, treated her just wonderfully!! There is a very conveinent bus stop right at the end of the driveway to get to the Vatican, or else there is a taxi station right outside in the parking lot. Everyone that worked there could speak perfect English which can be a problem in Italy and was also very nice. We had a wonderful stay there, and would definetly go and stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not so good location”
Reviews.Author: raquelrattle
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from Rome having stayed four nights at this hotel. The hotel is set back from a (very busy) road, in beautiful landscaped gardens. The pool area and spa look great. The restaurant was expensive and had very, very small portions, however service was immaculate. There are two pianists - the main one plays in the restaurant in the evenings and then moves to the bar. His repertoire is very limited, basically he plays the same cheesy stuff over and over again, plus he "sings" in a gruff Italian "doesn't matter whether I'm in tune or not" manner. The pianist that plays in the restaurant at breakfast however is extremely good. In order to get to the Metro station, you really need to take a local bus. The bus stop is right outside the hotel and you can buy tickets from the reception desk. It's only a ten minute ride, but I wouldn't recommend walking it - the road is very busy and there is no footpath most of the way. The courtesy bus into town only leaves the hotel at 8.45am and 12noon and even then only goes to St Peter's. It would make much more sense for this hotel to run a bus every 30 mins to the Metro station - but they don't. There is also a taxi rank at the hotel which was extremely useful. Our room was spacious and clean, there is English language TV available and pay per view movies if you want them. The reception staff were also very helpful and courteous. I think if you want a hotel in Rome that is slightly away from the action, then this place is right for you. Having now experienced Rome is all it's manic, busy and noisy glory, I'm glad we didn't stay in the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very good in my opinion, the staff were nice, and it was better than we had expected. the spa was very good and there was no extra charge for its use, also the shuttle bus was very helpful in getting to the airport and city centre. rome was a very nice place to go and the crowne plaza was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Valjean
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza in early March 2005 three nights. I think the best thing about the hotel is that we were allowed to check into our rooms at 8:30 AM. That is great after a long 18 hours on planes and in airports. Hotel was clean, beds comfortable, and the bathroom the largest we had during the two weeks in Italy. The hotel bar was good for a late evening drink and the staff was helpful. Because of the cold temperatures we were unable to use the pool and other outdoor facilities, but they looked nice. When we travel we do not hesitate to take what ever transportation is the most available and convenient. The bus when available was just down the drive but you always had to wait and then take 20 plus minutes to get into the city center. We often took the taxi, no matter where you go it cost 10E, or at least seemed so. Taxis were always available when we walked out the door. The only meals we ate at the hotel were breakfast and felt they were very over priced even by Italian standards. Did not look for anything else near the hotel as we were alway in a hurry to start our day of sightseeing. There is a restaurant just outside the hotel entrance to the right. It opens at 7:30 PM. Good food, good service, frendly neighborhood atmosphere, good price, and good wine. What else could you ask for. While I did not find anything bad about the hotel, next time I would try to find something closer to the city center. If nothing was available I would not hesitate to stay at the Crowne Plaza again.
